SourceText: Role play

SourceText:
Letâ€™s start acting! â­

Role-playing is when you pretend to be someone in a certain situation, and act out how you think things will go. 

This is a fun way to help your teen understand how others might act or feel, and for you to learn more about how your teen thinks and feels. âœ¨
text:
Tuanze kuigiza! â­

Igizo ni pale ambapo unajifanya kuwa mtu katika hali fulani na kuigiza namna unafikiri vitu vitakavyoenda. 

Hii ni njia ya furaha ya kumsaidia kijana wako aelewe jinsi wengine watafanya au kujisikia na kwa ajili yako kujifunza zaidi kuhusu namna kijana wako anavofikiria na kujisikia. âœ¨

3. ğŸ¬ Let your teen decide who plays each role, and act it out together!
4. ğŸ’¬ After the role-play, talk about what you both learned. Ask questions like, â€œHow did that feel?â€ or â€œWhat did you notice about the situation?â€ This helps your teen understand different perspectives and emotions.

4. âœ… Mtu anapokisia kwa usahihi, inakuwa zamu yake kufikiria neno jipya na kuigiza. Endelea kuchukua zamu na ufurahie mchezo!

SourceText:
* Make sure everyone gets a turn to act out words or phrases.

* If the game is too easy, try more difficult words. 
* Remember to have fun and support each other!
text:

ğŸ“… Choose a time and place where you and your teen can talk comfortably - like after dinner, before bed, or during a walk.

text:

SourceText: Traffic Lights
text: Taa za Trafiki

SourceText: A group activity is a great way to bond with others! ğŸ’›
text: Shughuli ya kikundi ni njia nzuri ya kushikamana na wengine! ğŸ’›

SourceText:
ğŸ’¡ Choose one person to turn and face a wall. This will be the traffic officer. 

ğŸ Everyone else will begin the game at the other side of the room, or if you are outside, at a starting line. Set a long distance between the traffic officer and the players. 

ğŸ’š The game begins when the officer shouts â€œGreenâ€, and everyone can start moving towards the traffic officer at any speed they choose. 

ğŸ”´ The officer can shout â€œRed!â€ at any time, without looking behind them. When they shout this, everyone must stop and freeze! 

â¸ The officer turns around to see if everyone is frozen. If they see anyone moving, they have to send them back to the start line.

ğŸ† The winner is the first person to get to the officer without being sent back to the start.

ğŸ‘‘ The winner then becomes the traffic officer and you can play another round!
text:
ğŸ’¡ Chagua mtu mmoja wa kugeuka na kuangaliaa ukuta. Huyu atakuwa afisa wa trafiki. 

ğŸ Kila mtu mwingine ataanza mchezo upande mwingine wa chumba, au ikiwa uko nje, kwenye mstari wa kuanzia. Weka umbali mrefu kati ya afisa wa trafiki na wachezaji. 

ğŸ’š Mchezo huanza wakati afisa anapopiga kelele â€œKijaniâ€, na kila mtu anaweza kuanza kumsogelea afisa wa trafiki kwa kasi yoyote anayochagua. 

ğŸ”´ Afisa anaweza kupiga kelele "Nyekundu!" wakati wowote, bila kuangalia nyuma yao. Wanapopiga kelele hivi, kila mtu lazima asimame na kuganda! 

â¸ Afisa anageuka ili kuona kama kila mtu ameganda. Iwapo wataona mtu yeyote anasonga, wanapaswa kumrudisha kwenye mstari wa kuanzia.

ğŸ† Mshindi ndiye mtu wa kwanza kufika kwa afisa bila kurudishwa mwanzo.

ğŸ‘‘ Mshindi basi anakuwa afisa wa trafiki na unaweza kucheza raundi nyingine!

SourceText: Think Big, Think Small
text: Fikiri Sana, Fikiri Kidogo

SourceText: Working towards big goals can be hard! Here is a way you can help your teen set new goals for the things they want to achieve. ğŸ‘‘
text: Kufanya kazi kwa malengo makubwa inaweza kuwa ngumu! Hapa kuna njia unayoweza kumsaidia kijana wako kuweka malengo mapya kwa mambo anayotaka kufikia. ğŸ‘‘

SourceText:
ğŸ‘‘ Ask your teen to come up with three things that they are good at, and discuss what they did to become so good at them. For example: keeping their room neat, helping your family with housework, or playing a sport.

ğŸ† Next, ask your teen what they wish they were good at. 

ğŸ”‘ Remind them that it took work and practice to become good at the skills they have. They will have to do the same for any new goal.

â° Help your teen break down their goal and set up smaller goals they need to achieve to reach their greater goal.
text:
ğŸ‘‘ Muulize kijana wako aeleze mambo matatu anayoyafanya vizuri, kisha mjadili jinsi alivyofanikisha kuwa mzuri katika mambo hayo. Kwa mfano: kuweka chumba chake safi, kusaidia familia kwenye kazi za nyumbani, au kucheza michezo.

ğŸ† Kisha, muulize kijana wako ni kitu gani angependa kukifanya vizuri.

ğŸ”‘ Wakumbushe kwamba ili kufanikisha ujuzi walio nao, inahitaji kazi na mazoezi. Watahitaji kufanya vivyo hivyo ili kufanikisha malengo mapya.

â° Msaidie kijana wako kugawanya lengo kubwa kuwa malengo madogo madogo ambayo anahitaji kuyafanikisha ili kufikia lengo kubwa.

SourceText: ğŸ“ It is much easier to achieve a goal if you write it down! This way, you can be reminded of it as you work towards it.
text: ğŸ“ Ni rahisi zaidi kufikia lengo ikiwa utaliandika! Kwa njia hii, unaweza kukumbushwa unapoifanyia kazi.

SourceText: Take A Pause with your Teen
text: Chukua Pumziko Na Kijana Wako

SourceText: Take a pause with your teen. This helps them deal with stress in a healthy way!
text: Chukua pumziko na kijana wako. Hii huwasaidia kukabiliana na mafadhaiko kwa njia yenye afya!

ğŸ‘‚ Sit down together and close your eyes. Listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. 

â­ Take 5 more deep breaths.

ğŸ‘€ When you are ready, open your eyes again. Do you feel any different? 

â¸ Ask your teen what it was like to take a pause. Listen and accept whatever they say about it.
text:
ğŸ‘‚ Keti pamoja na ufunge macho yako. Sikiliza pumzi yako inapoingia na kutoka. Angalia jinsi unavyohisi.

â­ Vuta pumzi 5 zaidi.

ğŸ‘€ Ukiwa tayari, fungua macho yako tena. Je, unahisi tofauti yoyote?

SourceText: Whatâ€™s New?

SourceText: Learning is fun! ğŸ“
text: Kujifunza ni furaha! ğŸ“

SourceText:
â“ Ask your teen to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together. 
- For example: keeping a ball in the air with your foot, juggling, making soup, moonwalking, whistling, saying the alphabet backwards, learning all the countries in Africa. 

ğŸ”„ Take turns trying out the new skill.  Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!

ğŸ’› Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your teen or yourself for your ability in the skill.
text:
â“ Mwambie kijana wako afikirie ujuzi mpya, wa kufurahisha mnaoweza kujifunza pamoja. 
- Kwa mfano: kuweka mpira hewani na mguu wako, mauzauza, kupika supu, kutembea mwezi, kupiga miluzi, kusema alfabeti nyuma, kujifunza nchi zote za Afrika.

ğŸ”„ Badilishana kujaribu ujuzi mpya.  Hakikisha kusifu kila mmoja na kujifunza na kucheza pamoja!

ğŸ’› Jifunze ujuzi huo kwa njia ya fadhili na ya kufurahisha, na usijihukumu kijana wako au wewe mwenyewe kwa uwezo wako katika ujuzi huo.

SourceText: Yes, No or Maybe
text: Ndiyo, Hapana au Labda

SourceText: Are you tired of hearing your teen say yes, no, or maybe to all of your questions? Turn your chat into a game, and donâ€™t allow one-word answers. ğŸˆ
text: Je, umechoka kusikia kijana wako akisema ndiyo, hapana, au labda kwa maswali yako yote? Geuza gumzo lako kuwa mchezo, na usiruhusu majibu ya neno moja. ğŸˆ

SourceText:
â­ Take turns asking each other questions. The only rule is that you cannot use one-word responses, such as Yes, No, Maybe, Fine, and Okay.
âš½ You can ask about things your teen likes or what they did today. For example, how was your day? What are you excited for? Is there anything worrying you?
ğŸ”„ It is important to let your teen ask a question as well. Trust is built when your teen can see that you are also sharing your life with them, and not only trying to learn about their life.
text:
â­ Kuulizana maswali kwa zamu. Kanuni pekee ni kwamba huwezi kutumia majibu ya neno moja, kama vile Ndiyo, Hapana, Labda, Sawa, na Sawa.
âš½ Unaweza kuuliza kuhusu mambo ambayo kijana wako anapenda au alichofanya leo. Kwa mfano, siku yako ilikuwaje? Je, unachangamkia nini? Je, kuna jambo lolote linalokusumbua?
ğŸ”„ Ni muhimu kumruhusu kijana wako aulize swali pia. Uaminifu hujengwa wakati kijana wako anaweza kuona kwamba pia unashiriki maisha yako naye, na sio tu kujaribu kujifunza kuhusu maisha yao.

SourceText: Secret Handshake
text: Kushikana Mikono kwa siri

SourceText:
Letâ€™s make a special, fun, and unique handshake that only you and your child share ğŸ‘‹  

This isnâ€™t just about having fun - it helps build your childâ€™s confidence and teamwork skills while creating a special tradition you both can enjoy. âœ…
text:
Hebu tufanye kupeana mikono maalum, ya kufurahisha na ya kipekee ambayo wewe na mtoto wako pekee mnashiriki ğŸ‘‹

Hii siyo tu kwa ajili ya kujifurahisha â€” pia inasaidia kumjengea mtoto wako kujiamini na kujifunza kushirikiana, huku mkiunda desturi maalum ya kufurahia pamoja. âœ…

SourceText:
ğŸ”¶ First, sit down together and talk about the kind of handshake you want. Should it be quick and silly, or cool and complicated? Itâ€™s totally up to you! 

ğŸµ You can start by choosing a few simple moves like clapping patterns, high fives, fist bumps, or snapping fingers.

ğŸ”„ Next, practice adding different steps. Maybe a spin, a shoulder tap, or even a fun dance move. The more creative and playful, the better!

ğŸ’› Once youâ€™ve mastered your moves, make your secret handshake a part of your routine! Use it as a fun greeting after school, or anytime you want to feel that special connection.
text:
ğŸ”¶ Kwanza, keti pamoja na mzungumze kuhusu aina ya kupeana mikono unayotaka. Je! inapaswa kuwa ya haraka na ya kijinga, au ya baridi na ngumu? Ni juu yako kabisa! 

ğŸµ Unaweza kuanza kwa kuchagua miondoko michache rahisi kama vile mifumo ya kupiga makofi, mikunjo ya juu, ngumi, au kupiga vidole.

ğŸ”„ Kisha, fanya mazoezi ya kuongeza hatua tofauti. Labda zunguka, bomba la bega, au hata hoja ya ngoma ya kufurahisha. Ubunifu zaidi na wa kucheza, ni bora zaidi!

ğŸ’› Mara tu unapofahamu hatua zako, fanya kupeana mkono kwa siri iwe sehemu ya utaratibu wako! Itumie kama salamu ya kufurahisha baada ya shule, au wakati wowote unapotaka kuhisi muunganisho huo maalum.

text: Bao

SourceText: Playing Bao can be a fun way to spend time with your teen. They will be excited to play a game with you and not only do chores.
text: Kucheza Bao inaweza kuwa njia ya kufurahisha ya kutumia muda pamoja na kijana wako. Watakuwa na hamasa kucheza mchezo pamoja na wewe na sio tu kufanya kazi.

SourceText:
ğŸª£ Draw a board in the sand â€” 2 rows of 8 small holes and 2 big holes at the ends.
ğŸŒ± Find 32 small seeds or stones.

1ï¸âƒ£ Put 2 seeds in each small hole. Leave the big holes empty.
2ï¸âƒ£ Choose who starts. Take the 2 seeds from one hole and drop them one by one into the next holes going around. Then itâ€™s the other personâ€™s turn.
3ï¸âƒ£ Keep playing until no one can move. The person with more seeds in their big hole wins! ğŸ†
text:
ğŸª£ Chora ubao kwenye mchanga â€” mistari 2 yenye mashimo madogo 8 kila moja na mashimo 2 makubwa kwenye ncha zake.
ğŸŒ± Tafuta mbegu ndogo au mawe madogo 32.

1ï¸âƒ£ Weka mbegu 2 katika kila shimo dogo. Acha mashimo makubwa yakiwa matupu.
2ï¸âƒ£ Chagueni ni nani ataanza. Chukua mbegu 2 kutoka shimo moja na ziweke moja moja kwenye mashimo yanayofuata kwa kuzunguka. Kisha ni zamu ya mtu mwingine.
3ï¸âƒ£ Endeleeni kucheza hadi hakuna anayeweza kufanya mzunguko tena. Mtu mwenye mbegu nyingi zaidi kwenye shimo lake kubwa ndiye mshindi! ğŸ†

- If you played before, tell your teen stories about you playing the game.
- Play a practice game to help your teen understand the rules.
- Celebrate your teenâ€™s successes and encourage them to keep practising, even if they do not win right away.
text:
- Ikiwa uliwahi kucheza hapo awali, mwambie kijana wako hadithi kuhusu ulivyokuwa ukicheza mchezo huo.
- Chezeni mchezo wa majaribio ili kumsaidia kijana wako kuelewa sheria.
- Sherehekea mafanikio ya kijana wako na umtie moyo aendelee kufanya mazoezi, hata kama hajashinda hata mara moja.
