SourceText: Take a moment to check in with yourself.
text: Chukua muda kujiangalia wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well.
text: Ni jambo la kuvutia sana, Ninafurahi sana mambo yanaenda vizuri.

SourceText: Great! So good to hear you are in a positive space.
text: Hongera! Ni vizuri sana kusikia uko katika hali chanya.

SourceText: Things are not always easy. But that is how we can grow and learn every day!
text: Mambo sio rahisi kila wakati. Lakini hivyo ndivyo tunavyoweza kukua na kujifunza kila siku!

SourceText: Life can be hard. Whatever you are feeling, you can be proud of yourself for being here!
text: Maisha yanaweza kuwa magumu. Vyovyote unavyohisi, unaweza kujivunia kwa kuwa hapa!

SourceText: You matter! Take a moment to check in with yourself.
text: Wewe ni wa muhimu! Chukua muda kujiangalia wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!
text: Inafurahisha sana kusikia kuwa unaendelea vizuri. Wewe ni mzazi mzuri sana!

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers but you really do your best!
text: Pole kwa sababu leo siyo siku nzuri sana kwako. Hongera kwa kujaribu kuelewa kila kitu. Hakuna ajuaye kila kitu, lakini kwa kweli unajitahidi kwa kadri uwezavyo!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!
text: Pole tunasikitika kusikia kwamba leo siyo siku nzuri kwako. Hongera kwa kuamka kila asubuhi na kujaribu tena, hata unapokuwa umechoka. Huo ni ujasiri wa kweli na kujitoa kwa dhati!

SourceText: Recognising how you feel helps you care for yourself well. You deserve it.
text: Kutambua jinsi unavyohisi inasaidia kujijali vizuri. Unastahili.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy! Keep up the good work.
text: Vizuri, Nimefurahi sana! Endeleza kazi hiyo nzuri.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult. All families struggle. @global.app_name is here to help!
text: Pole kwa mambo kuwa magumu. Familia zote zinapambana. @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia!
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Whatever went â€˜wrongâ€™ today, let it go and try again tomorrow. It is okay!
text: Jambo lolote lililoenda 'vibaya' leo, hebu lisahau na ujaribu tena kesho. Itakuwa sawa!

SourceText: Looking after yourself matters. And how you feel matters too!
text: Kujitunza ni muhimu. Na jinsi unavyohisi ni muhimu pia!

SourceText: Sometimes things go great. Sometimes they do not. And sometimes we do not quite know what to think... and that is totally okay! Remember that you are not alone.
text: Wakati mwingine mambo huenda vizuri sana. Wakati mwingine hayaendi vizuri sana. Na wakati mwingine hatujui kabisa cha kufanya... na hii ni sawa kabisa! Kumbuka kwamba hauko peke yako.

SourceText: Sorry that things are hard right now. You deserve good things and @global.app_name is here to support you every step of the way.
text: Pole mambo kuwa magumu kwa sasa. Unastahili mambo mazuri, na @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia kila hatua unayopiga.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Caring for yourself is so essential. When you know how you feel, you can see what you need.
text: Kujijali ni muhimu sana. Unapofahamu jinsi unavyohisi, unaweza kuona kile unachohitaji.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well. Keep up the good work.
text: Ni jambo la kuvutia sana, Ninafurahi sana kuona mambo yanaenda vizuri. Endelea kwa kazi nzuri.

SourceText: We all have better and worse days. The fact that you are here shows courage and commitment!
text: Sisi sote tuna siku nzuri na mbaya zaidi. Ukweli ni kwamba kuwa hapa unaonyesha ujasiri na kujitolea!

SourceText: Remember that YOU matter! Letâ€™s check in with our emotions first.
text: Kumbuka kwamba WEWE ni muhimu! Hebu tuangalie hisia zetu kwanza.

SourceText: Well done for recognising a positive feeling. I am happy to hear you are feeling well today!
text: Hongera kwa kutambua hisia chanya. Nimefurahi kusikia kwamba unajisikia vizuri leo!

SourceText: Well done for recognising that you are not feeling great. Be kind to yourself, you deserve it.
text: Umefanya vizuri kwa kutambua kuwa haujisikii vizuri. Unastahili kuwa mwema kwako mwenyewe.

SourceText: Well done for recognising a difficult feeling. It is okay not to be okay sometimes. Remember @global.app_name is here to support you.
text: Umefanya vizuri kutambua hisia ngumu. Ni sawa kutokuwa sawa wakati mwingine. Kumbuka @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Self-care is a key parenting tool. It starts with recognising how we feel.
text: Kujithamini ni muhimu kwa malezi. Inaanza na kutambua jinsi tunavyojisikia.

SourceText: Great. And amazing that you are using this app â€“ it shows your commitment as a parent. Make sure you give yourself credit and praise for what you are doing.
text: Safi sana. Na inapendeza sana kuona unatumia programu hii â€“ inaonyesha jinsi unavyojitoa kwa dhati kama mzazi. Hakikisha unajitambua na kujisifia kwa kile unachokifanya.

SourceText: Every day has its highs and lows. Praise yourself for being here and trying â€“ you are moving forward.
text: Kila siku kuna kupanda na kushuka. Jisifie kwa kuwa hapa na kujaribu â€“ unasonga mbele.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult right now. Take a deep breath and know that you are valued.
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo ni magumu sasa hivi. Vuta pumzi ndefu na ujue kuwa unathaminiwa.

SourceText: Recognising how you feel is key to handling life well. Be real and kind to yourself.
text: Kutambua jinsi unavyohisi ni muhimu ili kushughulikia maisha vizuri. Kuwa halisi na mkarimu kwako mwenyewe.

SourceText: You are a star. And you are making a real difference. You can be proud of yourself.
text: Wewe ni shujaa. Na unaleta mabadiliko ya kweli. Unaweza kujivunia mwenyewe.

SourceText: Everyone has good and bad days. Well done for using this app. It shows you are a committed parent. Remember to praise yourself for it!
text: Kila mtu ana siku nzuri na mbaya. Umefanya vizuri kutumia programu hii. Inaonyesha wewe ni mzazi unayejituma. Kumbuka kujipongeza kwa hilo!

SourceText: Sorry that things are not easy today. All parents have these days. You are trying and moving forward!
text: Pole kwamba mambo sio rahisi leo. Wazazi wote wana siku kama hizi. Unajaribu na kusonga mbele!

SourceText: Being a great parent also means taking time to care for yourself every day. It starts with recognising how you feel.
text: Kuwa mzazi mahiri pia humaanisha kupata wakati wa kujijali mwenyewe kila siku. Inaanza na kutambua jinsi unavyojiskia.

SourceText: So good to hear you are feeling well today. You are incredible!
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa unajisikia vizuri leo. Uko vizuri!

SourceText: We all have days where we just donâ€™t know. That is okay! You are here and that is what matters.
text: Sisi sote tuna siku ambazo hatuzielewi. Hiyo ni sawa! Uko hapa na hicho ndicho cha muhimu.

SourceText: Being a parent can be hard. But you are here and that shows you want to keep improving things. That is a big accomplishment already!
text: Kuwa mzazi inaweza kuwa ngumu. Lakini uko hapa na hiyo inaonyesha kuwa unataka kuendelea kuboresha mambo. Hayo ni mafanikio makubwa tayari!

SourceText: Taking a moment for YOU makes a big difference for everyone!
text: Kuchukua muda kwa ajili YAKO mwenyewe huleta mabadiliko makubwa kwa kila mtu!

SourceText: Great that today is going well! What is one thing that has gone well today? Remember to praise yourself for it.
text: Ni jambo zuri sana kwamba siku ya leo inaenda vizuri! Je, ni jambo gani moja ambalo limeenda vizuri leo? Kumbuka kujisifia kwa hilo.

SourceText: Every day has its good and hard parts. Praise yourself for everything you have done so far â€“ you are amazing.
text: Kila siku ina nyakati zake nzuri na ngumu. Jisifu kwa kila kitu ambacho umefanya hadi sasa â€“ uko vizuri sana.

SourceText: Sorry to hear you are feeling difficult feelings today. Well done for recognising those emotions and trying to be calm and kind to yourself. You are setting a great example for your family.
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kuwa leo unajisikia vibaya. Hongera kwa kutambua hisia hizo, na kujaribu kuwa mtulivu na kuwa mwema kwako mwenyewe. Unaweka mfano mzuri kwa familia yako.

SourceText: Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.
text: Kujithamini huanza kwa kutambua namna unavyohisi.

SourceText: Fantastic! And well done for investing in yourself and your family â€“ you have accomplished a lot.
text: Hongera! umefanya vizuri kuwekeza kwako na familia yako â€“ umefanikisha mengi.

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. @global.app_name is here to help.
text: Pole kwa kutokuwa na siku nzuri zaidi. Umefanya vizuri kwa kujaribu kubaini kila kitu. @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Being a parent can be challenging. Take a deep breath and recognise all you have done for your family â€“ you deserve praise!
text: Kuwa mzazi kunaweza kuwa changamoto. Vuta pumzi na tambua yote uliyoifanyia familia yako â€“ unastahili kusifiwa!

SourceText: Take a moment for yourself first.
text: Chukua muda kwa ajili yako mwenyewe kwanza.

SourceText: It is great to hear you are feeling positive today. You make a real difference for your family!
text: Inafurahisha kusikia unajisikia vizuri leo. Unafanya mabadiliko ya kweli kwa familia yako!

SourceText: Life has its great and hard moments â€“ that is okay. You are on the right track.
text: Maisha yana nyakati ngumu na nzuri â€“ hiyo ni sawa. Uko kwenye njia sahihi.

SourceText: It is normal to have hard days as a parent. Take a deep breath and know you are not alone!
text: Ni kawaida kuwa na siku ngumu kama mzazi. Vuta pumzi ndefu na ujue hauko peke yako!

SourceText: Take a moment to notice how you are doing.
text: Chukua muda kutambua jinsi unavyojisikia.

SourceText: Great! So good to hear that you are in a good space today. What a wonderful feeling!
text: Safi sana! Tunafurahi sana kusikia kwamba hali yako ni nzuri leo. Furaha iliyoje!

SourceText: Some days will have their challenges. That is okay. You are on the right path!
text: Baadhi ya siku zingine zinakuwa na changamoto zake. Hiyo ni sawa. Uko kwenye njia sahihi!

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult now. It is completely normal to struggle sometimes. Remember that you are not alone!
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo ni magumu sasa. Wakati mwingine ni jambo la kawaida kabisa kupata misukosuko. Kumbuka kwamba hauko peke yako!

SourceText: There is no right or wrong way to feel. However you are feeling, it is okay.
text: Hakuna njia sahihi au mbaya ya kuhisi. Kwa namna yeyote unayojisikia, ni sawa.

SourceText: Well done for recognising how you feel. Good to hear that you are feeling well today!
text: Hongera kwa kutambua unavyojisikia. Nimefurahi kusikia kwamba unajisikia vizuri leo!

SourceText: We all have good and hard days. Remember, you are the best parent for your teen and you deserve praise!
text: Sisi sote tuna siku nzuri na siku ngumu. Kumbuka, wewe ni mzazi bora kwa kijana wako na unastahili pongezi!

SourceText: It can be hard to cope with everything happening in our lives. Remember, you are stronger than you may think!
text: Inaweza kuwa vigumu kukabiliana na kila kitu kinachotokea katika maisha yetu. Kumbuka, una nguvu kuliko unavyoweza kufikiria!

SourceText: Letâ€™s take a moment for YOU. Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.
text: Hebu tuchukue muda kwa ajili YAKO. Kujitunza vizuri huanza na kutambua jinsi unavyohisi.

SourceText: Amazing, life is the best when you're feeling good.
text: Ni vyema, maisha ni bora wakati unajisikia vizuri.

SourceText: Everyone has times when they are not feeling good. This is completely normal. Hopefully you feel better soon.
text: Kila mtu ana wakati ambapo hajisikii vizuri. Hii ni kawaida kabisa. Natumaini kwamba utajisikia vizuri punde.

SourceText: It is part of life to have bad days. Always remember, tough times never last and tomorrow is another day!
text: Ni sehemu ya maisha kuwa na siku mbaya. Kumbuka kila wakati, nyakati ngumu kamwe hazidumu na kesho ni siku nyingine!

SourceText: How are you feeling today?
text: Unajisikiaje leo?

SourceText: Happy
text: Furaha

SourceText: Okay
text: Vizuri

SourceText: Sad
text: Huzuni

SourceText: How did one-on-one time go?
text: Muda wa pamoja wawili ulikuaje?

SourceText: Your goal was to spend one-on-one time with your teen.
text: Lengo ni kuwa na muda wa pamoja na kijana wako.

SourceText: Thatâ€™s wonderful! Well done for spending time together. It lays the foundation for a great relationship with your teen!
text: Vizuri sana! Hongereni kwa kutumia muda pamoja. Kufanya hivyo kunaweka msingi wa uhusiano mzuri sana na kijana wako!

SourceText: Sometimes it will be easy and fun to spend time with your teens and sometimes it will be more challenging. Spending time together will definitely improve your relationship!
text: Wakati mwingine ni rahisi na inafurahisha kutumia muda pamoja na vijana wako na wakati mwingi inakuwa ina changamoto zaidi. Kutumia muda pamoja itaboresha mahusiano yenu!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that it was difficult for you to spend time with your teen. We all have challenges sometimes. Just be patient with yourself and your teen â€“ things will get better. Well done for trying!
text: Pole kusikia kwamba ilikuwa vigumu kwako kutumia muda pamoja na kijana wako. Wakati mwingine, sisi sote tunakabiliwa na changamoto. Jivumilie tu na mvumilie kijana wako â€“ mambo yatakuwa mazuri. Hongera kwa kujaribu!

SourceText: How did praising your teen go?
text: Kumsifia kijana wako kuliendaje?

SourceText: Your goal was to praise your teen once a day.
text: Lengo lako ni kumsifia kijana wako mara moja kwa siku.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Keep up the praise â€“ you will see your teen do more and more of the behaviour you like to see!
text: Ni vizuri sana kusikia ilienda vizuri! Endelea kusifia â€“ utamuona kijana wako anafanya zaidi na zaidi tabia unazopenda kuziona akizifanya!

SourceText: It sometimes takes a bit of time to adjust to praising, but it makes a big difference â€“ you will see.
text: Wakati mwingine inachukua muda kidogo kuanza kusifia, lakini huleta mabadiliko makubwa - utaona.

SourceText: Sorry that you struggled with this. Starting with praise can take some practice, but you will see the positive results soon!
text: Pole kwa kuwa ulipambana na hili. Kuanza kusifia kunaweza kunahitaji mazoezi, lakini utaona matokeo mazuri hivi karibuni!

SourceText: You deserve some praise, too. Thank you again for using @global.app_name. It shows you really care!
text: Unastahili pongezi pia. Asante tena kwa kutumia @global.app_name. Hii inaonyesha kwamba unajali kweli!
note: The string @global.app_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: How did solving a problem together go?
text: Kutatua matatizo pamoja kuliendaje?

SourceText: Your goal was to try and resolve a problem together with your teen using the four steps of problem-solving: Know It, Solve It, Try It, Test It.
text: Lengo ni kutatua tatizo pamoja na kijana wako kwa kutumia hatua nne za kutatua matatizo: litambue, litatue, jaribu, jaribu tena.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! When your teen learns how to solve problems, they can use that skill their whole life. What a gift!
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri! Kijana wako anapojifunza kutatua matatizo, anaweza kutumia ujuzi huo maishani mwake mwote. Zawadi iliyoje!

SourceText: Solving problems together takes some practice. The more often you involve your teen when you are both calm, the better it will go. Well done for trying!
text: Kutatua matatizo pamoja kunahitaji mazoezi fulani. Kadiri unavyomhusisha kijana wako mara nyingi wakati wote mmetulia, ndivyo mambo yatakavyokuwa mazuri zaidi. Umefanya vizuri kwa kujaribu!

SourceText: Sorry that this was hard. Sometimes we just have to keep trying. Find a time when you and your teen are calm and try again to talk through a problem using the four steps of problem-solving. Together, you can do so much!
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo yalikuwia magumu. Wakati mwingine tunapaswa kuendelea kujaribu. Tafuta muda ambao wewe na kijana wako mtakuwa mmetulia halafu mjaribu tena kuzungumzia tatizo kwa kutumia hatua nne za kutatua matatizo. Pamoja, mnaweza kufanya makubwa!

SourceText: How did taking care of yourself go?
text: Kujitunza kuliendaje?

SourceText: Your home activity was to relax, recognise your efforts, and reward yourself.
text: Shughuli yako nyumbani ni kupumzika, tambua jitihada zako, na kujipongeze.

SourceText: Great to hear you took time for yourself! Taking care of yourself helps you be the best parent you can be.
text: Nimefurahi kusikia umechukua muda kwa ajili yako mwenyewe! kujijali kunasaidia kuwa mzazi bora zaidi.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that it was difficult to prioritise yourself. Remember, taking care of yourself is essential and will help you take care of others even better!
text: Pole kusikia ilikua vigumu kwako kujithamini. Kumbuka kujithamini ni muhimu na kutakusaidia kuwajali wengine vizuri zaidi!

SourceText: How did giving clear instructions go?
text: Kutoa maelekezo bayana kuliendeje?

SourceText: Your home practice was to give your teen positive instructions.
text: Mazoezi yako ya nyumbani yalikuwa kumpa kijana wako maelekezo chanya.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well. You are a star!
text: Nimefurahi kusikia ilienda vizuri. Wewe ni shujaa!

SourceText: Sorry to hear it was difficult for you. Well done for trying!
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kuwa mambo yalikuwia magumu. Hongera kwa kujaribu!

SourceText: Giving instructions in a new way takes some practice. Keep trying, you will soon see the difference it makes!
text: Kutoa maagizo kwa njia mpya kunahitaji mazoezi fulani. Endelea kujaribu, hivi karibuni utaona tofauti yake!

SourceText: How did keeping calm under stress go?
text: Kuwa mtulivu kwenye msongo wa mawazo kuliendeje?

SourceText: This week, your goal was to respond calmly and talk to your teen about how you both felt in a stressful situation.
text: "Wiki hii lengo lako ilikua ni kujibu kwa utulivu na kuzungumza na kijana wako kuhusiana na namna gani nyote kwa pamoja mlikua kwenye msongo ya mawazo".

SourceText: Wonderful! You deserve all the happy times!
text: Vizuri sana! Unastahili kufurahi nyakati zote!

SourceText: Sorry that this was difficult for you. You are a star for trying!
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kuwa mambo yalikuwia magumu. Wewe ni mshindi kwa kujaribu!

SourceText: Life can be so stressful. Every small step counts. Keep up the good work!
text: Maisha yanaweza kutupa msongo wa mawazo. Kila hatua ndogo inahesabiwa. Endelea na kazi nzuri!

SourceText: How did setting a rule go?
text: Kuweka sheria kulikwendaje?

SourceText: Your goal was to set one rule together with your teen.
text: Lengo ni kutengeneza sheria moja na kijana wako.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Consistent rules help make our teens feel secure and keep them safe!
text: Inafurahisha sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri! Sheria thabiti husaidia kuwafanya vijana wetu kujisikia salama na kuwaweka salama!

SourceText: It can be hard to create your first rule together, but you will see the benefits of involving your family. Keep trying!
text: Inaweza kuwa vigumu kuunda sheria yako ya kwanza pamoja, lakini utaona manufaa ya kuhusisha familia yako. Endelea kujaribu!

SourceText: Sorry that this has been difficult. Creating rules together requires some practice but it is worth it!
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa jambo hili limekuwa gumu. Kuweka sheria pamoja kunahitaji mazoezi, lakini kuna faida!

SourceText: Well done for this! It is not easy, and teenagers will not keep to the rules all the time, but making a few key rules together is a great start. Praise yourself for trying this â€“ we are proud of you!
text: Umefanya vizuri sana kwa hili! Si rahisi, na vijana hawawezi kutii sheria wakati wote, lakini kwa kutengeneza sheria muhimu kwa pamoja ni mwanzo mzuri. Jipongeze kwa kujaribu hili â€“ tunajivunia wewe!

SourceText: How did introducing a positive consequence go?
text: Utangulizi wa matokeo chanya uliendaje?

SourceText: Your goal was to introduce one POSITIVE consequence (for your teen taking good actions) and one NEGATIVE consequence (for your teen breaking a household rule).
text: Lengo ni kumuonesha kijana matokeo CHANYA (kwa kijana wako kuchukua hatua nzuri) na matokeo HASI ( kwa kijana wako kuvunja sheria za nyumbani).

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Getting consequences right helps teens behave better and makes family life calmer.
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri! Kuweka athari sahihi husaidia vijana kuwa na tabia nzuri zaidi na kufanya maisha ya familia kuwa tulivu zaidi.

SourceText: Staying calm and consistent can be hard, but you are doing so well. You can do this!
text: Kukaa kwa utulivu na thabiti inaweza kuwa ngumu, lakini unafanya vizuri sana. Unaweza kufanya hii!

SourceText: Sorry that this was difficult for you. Setting consequences together will make your teen want to follow the rules more often!
text: Pole kwamba hii ilikuwa ngumu kwako. Kuweka matokeo pamoja kutafanya kijana wako atake kufuata sheria mara nyingi zaidi!

SourceText: How did making safety maps go?
text: Utengenezaji wa ramani za usalama ulikuaje?

SourceText: Your goal was to make two maps with your teen of safe and unsafe places â€“ both in your community and online.
text: Lengo ni kutengeneza ramani pamoja na kijana wako ya maeneo salama na maeneo hatarishi â€“ ndani ya jamii na mtandaoni.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Talking about risks and support options prevents problems and really helps to keep your teen safe.
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri! Kuzungumzia hatari na njia za msaada huzuia matatizo na husaidia sana kumweka salama kijana wako.

SourceText: Even if it did not go so well yet, you will get there! Mapping risks and support systems together will help your family. Well done for trying.
text: Hata kama haijaenda vizuri bado, Utafanikiwa! Kubainisha maeneo hatari kwa pamoja na mifumo ya msaada itasaidia familia yako. Vizuri sana kwa kujaribu.

SourceText: Sorry that this was hard. Mapping risks and places to get support can be challenging and emotional. It really does help to keep your teen safe!
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo yalikuwia magumu. Kuonyesha maeneo ya hatari na ya kupata msaada kunaweza kuleta changamoto na hisia kali. Kufanya hivyo kunasaidia sana kumweka salama kijana wako!

SourceText: How did talking about a crisis plan go?
text: Kutengeneza ramani za usalama kuliendeaje?

SourceText: Your goal was to discuss a possible crisis situation with your teen and make a plan for how you could respond together.
text: Lengo ni kujadiliana na kijana wako changamoto inayoweza kujitokeza na kutengeneza mpango wa kuitatua pamoja.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well!
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri!

SourceText: It can be hard to think and talk about a crisis happening in your family. By trying you are already on the right path. Keep up the good work!
text: Inaweza kuwa vigumu kuzungmzia majanga yanayotokea katika familia yako. Kwa kujaribu tu, tayari upo katika njia sahihi. Endelea na kazi nzuri!

SourceText: Sorry it didnâ€™t go so well. This can be tough. Try sitting down with your teen again â€” and think about whether someone they trust could join the conversation to help.
text: Samahani haikufanikiwa. Hii inaweza kua ngumu. Jaribu kukaa chini tena na kijana wako â€” fikiria kama kunamtu anamuamini anaweza jiunga kwenye mazungumza na kusaidia.

SourceText: How did making a family budget go?
text: Kutengeneza bajeti ya familia kuliendeaje?

SourceText: Your goal was to make a family budget.
text: Lengo lako lilikuwa kutengeneza bajeti ya familia.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well. Talking about your finances together really makes your family stronger!
text: Inafurahisha sana kusikia kuwa mambo yalienda vizuri. Kuzungumzia fedha zako pamoja kunaimarisha zaidi familia yako!

SourceText: It is never easy to talk about money. Well done on starting the conversation and teaching your teen about this.
text: Haijawahi kuwa rahisi kamwe kuzungumza juu ya pesa. Hongera sana kwa kuanzisha mazungumzo na kumfundisha kijana wako kuhusu hili.

SourceText: Sorry to hear it was difficult for you. Well done for trying. Helping your teen understand money better will benefit them so much in life!
text: Pole kusikia ilikuwa ngumu kwako. Umefanya vizuri kujaribu. Kumsaidia kijana wako kuelewa pesa vizuri itamnufaisha sana maishani!

SourceText:
Thank you for sharing your experiences! Well done for thinking about how you can budget and save with your family. This will really help you to work towards your family goals.

Together you can achieve so many good things!
text:
Asante kwa kutushirikisha uzoefu wako! Hongera kwa kuweza kufikiria unavyoweza kupanga bujeti na kutunza akiba pamoja na familia. Hii itasaidia sana kufanyia kazi malengo ya familia yako.

Kwa pamoja mnaweza fanikisha mambo mengi mazuri!

SourceText: How did reading the stories and talking about body changes go?
text: Kusoma hadithi na kuzungumza kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili kuliendeaje?

SourceText: Your goal was to look at the stories in this module together with your teen and use them to start a conversation about body changes and relationships.
text: Lengo ni kupitia hadithi zilizo kwenye vipindi pamoja na kijana wako na tumia hivyo kuanzisha mazungumzo kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano.

SourceText: Well done for trying it out â€“ you took a very important step to help your teen!
text: Hongera kwa kuijaribu - ulichukua hatua muhimu sana kumsaidia kijana wako!

SourceText: Talking about these sensitive topics can be uncomfortable for both you and your teen. The more you try, the better it will get. It is worth every bit of your effort!
text: Kuzungumza kuhusu mada hizi nyeti kunaweza kukukosesha raha wewe na kijana wako. Unapojaribu zaidi, itakuwa bora zaidi. Inastahili kila juhudi yako!

SourceText: It can be hard to talk to your teen about these things. That is okay. Well done for trying, you will get another opportunity again soon!
text: Inaweza kuwa vigumu kuzungumza na kijana wako kuhusu mambo haya. Hiyo ni sawa. Hongera kwa kujaribu, utapata fursa nyingine tena hivi karibuni!

SourceText: How did talking about staying safe with your teen go?
text: Mazungumzo ya jinsi ya kubaki salama na kijana wako yalienda vipi?

SourceText: Your goal was to discuss the Staying Safe module with your teen.
text: Lengo ni kujadili pamoja na kijana wako kipindi cha kukaa salama.

SourceText: Well done for involving your teen! Discussing these difficult topics can help keep your teen safe when it matters most.
text: Hongera kwa kumshirikisha kijana wako! Kujadili mada hizi ngumu kunaweza kusaidia kumweka salama kijana wako katika nyakati ngumu sana.

SourceText: Talking about potentially dangerous situations with your teen can be challenging, but just know that you started an important conversation! Keep up the good work.
text: Kuzungumza na kijana wako kuhusu hali zinazoweza kuwa hatari kunaweza kuwa vigumu, lakini jua tu kwamba umeanzisha mazungumzo muhimu! Endelea na kazi nzuri.

SourceText: Discussing potential dangers and how to respond can be a trigger for any parent and teen. The fact that you tried already makes a big difference and really shows you care.
text: Kujadili hatari zinazoweza kutokea na jinsi ya kujibu kunaweza kuwa kichocheo kwa mzazi na kijana yeyote. Ukweli kwamba umejaribu tayari hufanya tofauti kubwa na inaonyesha kuwa unajali.

SourceText: How did sharing feelings of grief with your teen go?
text: Kushirikishana hisia za majonzi na kijana wako ilikuaje?

SourceText: This week, your goal was to share with your teen how you feel, and ask them to also name their feelings.
text: Wiki hii, lengo ni kumshirikisha kijana wako jinsi unavyojihisi na kuwaomba pia wakwambie hisia zao.

SourceText: Well done! Sharing feelings will help your family to support each other and get through this difficult time together.
text: Hongera! Kuwashirikisha hisia zako itafanya familia yako wasaidiane kwa pamoja na kuondokana na hali hii ngumu pamoja.

SourceText: Talking about feelings can be challenging at first. Try again another time. It will help you and your family.
text: Kuongea kuhusu hisia zako inaweza kuwa changamoto mwanzoni. Jaribu tena wakati mwingine. Itakusaidia wewe na familia yako.

SourceText: Losing someone impacts everyone differently. Be kind to yourself and take some time to notice and share how you feel when you are ready. You will see it will help you and your family.
text: Kupoteza mtu inaathiri kila mtu tofauti. Jikarimishe mwenyewe na pata muda kutambua na kushirikishana jinsi unavyohisi ukiwa tayari. Utaona itakusaidia wewe na familia yako.

SourceText: How did trying a fun activity with your teen go?
text: Kujaribu shughuli za kufurahisha na kijana wako kulikuaje?

SourceText: Your goal was to try a fun activity with your teen.
text: Lengo ni kujaribu shughuli ya kufurahisha na kijana wako.

SourceText: Great to hear it went well! Spending fun, relaxed time with your teen helps them learn important life skills  â€”  and it strengthens your bond.
text: Nimefurahi kusikia kua ilikua nzuri! kufurahi pamoja na kua na mda wa utulivu pamoja na kijana wako kunasaidia kujifunza ujuzi muhimu wa maisha â€” na pia kunaimalisha uhusiano wenu.

SourceText: You're doing well! Even small moments of fun and conversation can help your teen feel valued and motivated. Keep it up!
text: Unafanya vizuri! Hata nyakati ndogo za furaha na mazungumzo zinaweza kumfanya kijana wako ajihisi kuthaminiwa na kuhamasika. Endelea hivyo!

SourceText: Taking time for yourself can be challenging, but youâ€™re doing great. Keep it up â€” you deserve it!
text: Kuchukua muda kwa ajili yako mwenyewe kunaweza kuwa changamoto, lakini unaendelea vizuri. Endelea hivyo â€” unastahili!

SourceText: Letâ€™s check in on your home activity!
text: Hebu tuangalie shughuli yako ya nyumbani!

SourceText: Did you have a chance to try this?
text: Je, ulipata nafasi ya kujaribu hili?

SourceText: That is okay, do not be too hard on yourself. We encourage you to try and do it when you can.
text: Hiyo ni sawa, usiwe mgumu sana kwako mwenyewe. Tunakuhimiza ujaribu kuifanya unapoweza.

SourceText: How did it go?
text: Je, liliendaje?

SourceText: Well done for exploring solutions to your challenges. Go try these solutions out. Your relationship with your child will get stronger and stronger!
text: Hongera kwa kuchunguza suluhisho la changamoto zako. Sasa jaribu kutumia suluhisho hizi. Uhusiano wako na mtoto wako utaimarika zaidi na zaidi!

SourceText:
Yes, it can be really hard to find time duringâ€¯the day, with work, chores, and everything else.

Youâ€™re doing great by making the effort to connect!
text:
Ndiyo, inaweza kuwa vigumu kweli kupata muda mchana, kazi, kazi za nyumbani, na kila kitu!

Unafanya vizuri Sana kwa kuweka bidii kuwa karibu na familia yako!

SourceText: My teen does not want to spend time with me
text: Kijana wangu hataki kutumia muda pamoja na mimi

SourceText:
Sorry that you struggled with that. It can make usâ€¯feel bad ifâ€¯ourâ€¯children do not want to spend one-on-one timeâ€¯withâ€¯us.

Youâ€™re doing great by making the effort to connect!
text:
Pole kwa kwa kuhangaika na hilo. Inaweza kutufanya kujisikia vibaya kama watoto wetu hawahitaji kutumia mda wa pamoja na sisi. â€¯

Unafanya vizuri Sana kwa kuweka bidii!

SourceText: My teen only wants to watch TV or play on his/her phone
text: Kijana wangu anataka tu kutazama runinga au kuchezea simu yake

SourceText:
Sorry that you had that challenge. Teens often want to spend time watching TV or playing with a gadget.â€¯

You could watch or play on the gadget with them â€“ showing interest is a great first step!

Once you begin spending time together you can suggest another activity.

Need ideas for activities? Tap the â€˜Playâ€™ button at the bottom of the App.
text:
Pole kwa kuwa na changamoto hiyo. Vijana mara nyingi hutaka kutumia muda kuangalia runinga au kuchezea vitu vyao.

Unaweza kuangalia au kuchezea vitu vyao pamoja nao - kuonesha unavutiwa ni hatuna nzuri ya mwanzo!

Ukianza kutumia muda nao pamoja unaweza kupendekeza kazi nyingine.

Unahitaji mawazo ya kazi? Gusa kitufe cha 'Cheza' chini ya App.

SourceText: My teen wants to do things that are not safe or that cost money
text: Kijana wangu anataka kufanya mambo yasiyo salama au vitu vinavyogharimu pesa

SourceText: You are not alone here. Many parents have this challenge, too. One-on-one time should always be safe and it does not have to cost a thing!
text: Hauko peke yako hapa. Wazazi wengi wanakabiliwa pia na changamoto hii. Kila mara, muda wa kuzungumza wawili unapaswa kuwa salama na haulazimiki kugharimu chochote!

SourceText: My teen wants to do things that I cannot physically do
text: Kijana wangu anataka kufanya vitu ambavyo mwili wangu hauwezi kuvifanya

SourceText:
Sorry to hear that. Teens can feel sad if we canâ€™t do what they want, like playing sports or other active things.

But the most important thing is spending time together â€“ and that can look different for every family.
text:
Pole kwa kusikia hivyo. Vijana wanaweza kujisikia huzuni kama tunashindwa kufanya vile wanavyotaka, kama kucheza mchezo au vitu vingine.

Lakini cha muhimusana ni kutumia muda pamoja - na hiyo inaweza kuonekana tofauti kwa kila familia.

SourceText: All my children want one-on-one time with me at the same time
text: Watoto wangu wote wanataka muda wa pamoja kwa wakati mmoja

SourceText:
Many parents face this. It can be difficult to spend one-on-one time withâ€¯ourâ€¯teensâ€¯whenâ€¯weâ€¯have more than one child.

You can also spend time with all your children together â€” just make sure everyone can join in.

Need ideas for activities? Tap the â€˜Playâ€™ button at the bottom of the App.
text:
Wazazi wengi wanakumbana na hili. Inaweza kuwa vigumu kutumia muda pamoja na vijana wetu tukiwa na watoto zaidi ya mmoja.

Unaweza pia kutumia muda pamoja na watoto wako wote - hakikisha tu kila mmoja anajiunga.

Unahitaji mawazo ya kazi? Gusa kitufe cha 'Cheza' l ilichopo chini ya App.

SourceText: It can sometimes be hard to remember to praise our teens. Next time you spend one-on-one time with your teen, try and think of one thing you can praise them for. You can even say, â€œThank you for spending time with me!â€
text: Muda mwingine inaweza kuwa vigumu kukumbuka kuwasifia vijana wetu. Wakati mwingine ukiwa unatumia muda wa pamoja na kijana wako, jaribu na fikiria kitu kimoja unachoweza kumsifia. Unaweza hata ukasema, â€œ Asante kwa kutumia muda pamoja na mimi!â€

SourceText: My teen was surprised or suspicious
text: Kijana wangu alishtushwa au kushangaa

SourceText: Remember, it takes some time for your teen to get used to seeing you praise them. The more time you spend with them, the better it will go!
text: Kumbuka, inachukua muda kwa kijana wako kuzoea kukuona ukimsifu. Kadri unavyotumia muda mwingi pamoja naye, ndivyo itakavyokuwa bora zaidi!

SourceText: My teen did not like it
text: Kijana wangu hakuipenda

SourceText: It happens â€“ just be patient. Make sure to keep spending time with your teen, so they will value your opinion more and more. When your praise is genuine, you will see the benefits soon!
text: Huwa inatokea â€“ kuwa tu mvumilivu. Hakikisha unaendelea kutumia muda wa pamoja na kijana wako, kwa namna hiyo atathamini mawazo yako zaidi na zaidi. Ukimsifia kwa moyo wa dhati, utaona faida zake hivi karibuni!

SourceText: It felt unnatural
text: Ilionekana siyo asili

SourceText:
Thatâ€™s completely normal. If youâ€™re not used to giving praise, it can feel strange at first. Start with something simple, like â€œThanks for helping with that.â€ 

The more you give praise, the easier it becomes â€” and it really helps build your teenâ€™s confidence.
text:
Hiyo ni kawaida kabisa. Kama hujazoea kusifia, inaweza kuonekana ajabu mwanzoni. 
Anza na kitu flani rahisi, kama "Asante kwa kusaidia hicho."

Kadri unavyotoa sifa, ndivyo utakavyoona rahisi - na inasaidia kumjenga kijana wako kukuamini.

SourceText: I got very angry when my teen broke the rules
text: Nilikasirika sana pale kijana wangu alipovunja sheria

SourceText:
When we take a pause before responding, it helps us to calm down and respond better.

Next time your teen makes you angry, try to take a pause first. Even a few deep breaths can make a big difference!
text:
Tulipovuta pumzi kabla ya kujibu, ilitusaidia kutulia na kujibu vizuri zaidi.

Wakati mwingine kijana wako akikukasirisha, jaribu kuvuta pumzi kwanza. Hata kwa kuvuta pumzi ndefu kidogo inaweza kuleta tofauti!

SourceText: My teen got very angry with me after I gave the consequences
text: Kijana wangu alinikasirikia sana nilipomuadhibu

SourceText:
When your teen gets angry, you might need to walk away until you are both calm.

Check to make sure your consequence is fair and reasonable. Listen to your teenâ€™s explanation and react calmly if they broke a rule in order to stay safe.
text:
Kijana wako anapokasirika, utahitaji kutoka kidogo mpaka nyote wawili mtakapo tulia na kuwa sawa

Fatilia na kuhakikisha kuwa adhabu unayotoa niya haki na yenyekuendana na kosa. Sikiliza maeleza ya kijana wako na ujibu kwa utulivu ikiwa alivunja sheria ili kujiweka katika hali ya usalama.

SourceText: I introduced the consequence without first discussing it with my teen
text: Niliweka adhabu bila kuijadili kwanza na kijana wangu

SourceText: Can you make a consequence if this happens again? When we establish a consequence together with our teens, the consequence will be more realistic and our teens will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
text: Unaweza kutengeneza adhabu kama hii itatokea tena? Tukianzisha adhabu pamoja na vijana wetu, adhabu itakuwa halisi zaidi na vijana wetu watakuwa tayari na kuweza kufuata Sheria.

SourceText: Even with the consequence, my teen still does not follow the rule
text: Pamoja na kuweka adhabu, bado kijana wangu hafuati sheria

SourceText:
If your child keeps breaking rules, you might need to spend more positive time with them. 

Try to keep going with your other goals â€” like self-care, one-on-one time, and praise. All these skills will help your child feel more loved and secureâ€¦ and you, less stressed!
text:
Kama kijana wako anaendelea kuvunja sheria, unaweza kuhitaji kutumia muda chanya zaidi pamoja naye.

Jaribu kuendelea na malengo yako mengine â€“ kama kujithamini, muda wa pamoja wawili, na kusifia. 
Ujuzi huu wote utamsaidia kijana wako kuhisi anapendwa zaidi na kulindwaâ€¦ na wewe kupunguza msongo wa mawazo!

SourceText: We only created a negative consequence, not a positive consequence
text: Tuliweka adhabu hasi tu, na si adhabu chanya

SourceText: It can be difficult to think of positive consequences sometimes. Positive consequences will encourage your teen to take more responsibility and you will see the difference!
text: Wakati mwingine inaweza kuwa vigumu kufikiria athari nzuri. Athari zitamchochea kijana wako kuwajibika zaidi na utaona mabadiliko!

SourceText: My teen suggested being hit as a negative consequence
text: Kijana wangu alipendekeza kuchapwa kama adhabu hasi

SourceText:
Teens can be used to seeing hitting as the only possible consequence for breaking rules.

Think together of some calm consequences that could help them understand that they have done something wrong. These will be more effective and will set positive examples!
text:
Vijana wanaweza kuzoea kuona kuchapwa ndo adhabu pekee ya kuvunja sheria.

Fikiria pamoja nao kuhusu baadhi ya adhabu nyepesi zinazoweza kuwasaidia kuelewa kwamba wamefanya kosa. Hizi zitaleta ufanisi zaidi na kutoa mifano chanya!

SourceText: I forgot the steps of problem-solving
text: Nilisahau hatua za kutatua matatizo

SourceText: It takes some practice to use all four steps of problem solving. Next time a problem comes up, look at the four steps together with your teen â€“ it will make a big difference!
text: Inachukua muda kidogo na mazoezi kuweza kutumia hatua zote nne za kutatua matatizo. Tatizo litakapotokea tena, pitia hatua hizi nne pamoja na kijana wako â€“ kufanya hivyo kutaleta mabadiliko makubwa!

SourceText: I started with the solutions right away
text: Nilianza na suluhisho moja kwa moja

SourceText:
When we have a problem, we often want to get to the quickest end result and can forget about the steps. 

To come up with the best solution together, it is helpful to first have a full understanding of the problem and the different solutions.
text:
Tunapokuwa na tatizo, mara zote huwa tunataka kulitatua haraka sana na tunaweza kusahau hatua za kulitatua tatizo. 

Ili kupata suluhisho bora kwa pamoja, ni vema kwanza kulielewa tatizo kikamilifu na njia mbalimbali za kulitatua.

SourceText: We could not agree on a solution to try out and we got into an argument
text: Hatukuweza kukubaliana kuhusu suluhisho la kulijaribu hivyo tuliishia kulumbana

SourceText:
Sometimes it can be difficult to agree with everyone in the family, especially if everyone is not calm. 

You can try one solution first, then try another if needed. If things get stuck, take a break and come back later to decide together.
text:
Wakati mwingine inaweza kuwa vigumu kukubaliana na kila mmoja katika familia, hasa kama kila mmoja hana utulivu.

Mnaweza kujaribu suluhisho moja kwanza, baadae mjaribu kingine kama unahitajika. Kama vitu nitakuwa vimegoma, pumzikeni na mrudi wote baadae kuamua kwa pamoja.

SourceText: I got angry when the problem came up and I forgot to use the problem-solving steps
text: Nilikasirika tatizo lilipotokea, nikasahau kutumia hatua za kutatua matatizo

SourceText: When a problem comes up, we all get angry or stressed sometimes. Remember, when you feel angry or stressed, you can take a pause to help you stay calm and then solve the problem you are facing.
text: Tatizo linapojitokeza, wote huwa tunakasirika au kufadhaika wakati mwingine. Kumbuka, unapohisi hasira au msongo wa mawazo, unaweza kupumzika kwanza ili utulie halafu ndipo utatue tatizo linalokukabili.

SourceText: My teen got angry and did not want to talk about the problem
text: Kijana wangu alikasirika na hakutaka kuzungumza kuhusu tatizo

SourceText: Your teen might be too overwhelmed to deal with the problem right away. Recognise and name their emotions. Create a time later in the day or week to discuss and solve the problem together. By giving your teen time, the problem can be solved well.
text: Kijana wako anaweza kushindwa kabisa kushughulikia tatizo mara moja. Zitambue na kuzipa majina hisia zake, halafu tafuta muda baadaye siku hiyo au wiki hiyo mjadili na kutatua tatizo hilo pamoja. Kwa kumpa muda kijana wako, tatizo linaweza kutatuliwa vizuri.

SourceText: I forgot to do the activity
text: Nilisahau kufanya zoezi

SourceText: It happens! Life gets busy. You could try setting a reminder or choosing a regular time each week to make it easier to remember.
text: Hutokea! Maisha yamekuwa na mambo mengi. Unaweza kujaribu kuweka kikumbushio au kuweka muda maalumu kila wiki kufanya iwe rahisi kukumbuka.

SourceText: I didnâ€™t understand the activity
text: Sikuelewa zoezi

SourceText: It didn't feel right to take time for myself
text: Nilihisi haikuwa sawa kutumia muda kwa ajili yangu

SourceText: Thatâ€™s okay. Self-care can mean different things to different people. It could be anything that helps you feel calmer or more rested â€” like taking a short walk, listening to music, or having a quiet moment to yourself. Try starting small.
text:
Hiyo ni sawa. Kujithamini inaweza kumanisha vitu tofauti kwa watu mbalimbali. Inaweza kuwa chochote kinachokusaidia kuhisi utulivu zaidi au mwenye kupumzika zaidi - kama kufanya matembezi mafupi, kusikiliza muziki, au kuwa na muda tulivu mwenyewe. 
Jaribu kuanza kidogo.

SourceText: I was too tired to do anything for myself
text: Nilikuwa nimechoka sana kufanya chochote kwa ajili yangu

SourceText: Thatâ€™s completely understandable. When youâ€™re exhausted, self-care can feel like one more task. Start with something very small â€” even resting is a form of self-care.
text: Hiyoinaeleweka kabisa. Ukiwa umechoka Sana, kujithamini inaweza kuwa kama kazi nyingine. Anza na kitu flani kidogo Sana - hata kupumzika ni namna ya kujithamini.

SourceText: Myâ€¯teenagerâ€¯did not want to follow the instruction
text: Kijana wangu hakutaka kufuata maelekezo

SourceText: Our teens need time to learn to follow instructions. Be patient, try again, and remember to praise them every time they follow an instruction!
text: Watoto wetu wanahitaji muda wa kujifunza kufuata maelekezo. Kuwa na subra, jaribu tena, na ukumbuke kuwasifu kila wakati wanapofuata maelekezo!

SourceText: I did not find time to spend one-on-one time with my teen
text: Sikupata muda wa kutumia pamoja na kijana wangu

SourceText:
Getting used to giving positive instructions can take time. Try finding a few minutes each day to practise. 

You can try asking your teen or someone else to help out with a chore at home, so you have more time to practice this new skill.
text:
Kuzoea kutoa maelekezo chanya inaweza kuchukua muda. Jaribu kupata dakika chache kila siku kufanya mazoezi.

Unaweza kumuomba kijana wako au mtu mwingine kusaidia kazi za nyumbani, hivyo una muda zaidi wa kufanyia mazoezi ujuzi huu mpya.

SourceText: I gave a negative instead of a positive instruction
text: Nilitoa maelekezo hasi badala ya maelekezo chanya

SourceText: Yes, it takes some time to get used to giving positive instructions â€“ it is really worth trying again! Think about the behaviour you would love to see your teen do more and think of positive ways to give that instruction!
text: Ndiyo, inachukua muda kuzoea kutoa maelekezo chanya â€“ inafaa kujaribu tena! Fikiria tabia ambayo ungependa kuona kijana wako akizidi kuifanya na fikiria namna chanya za kutoa maagizo hayo!

SourceText: I shouted at myâ€¯teenâ€¯instead of giving them a positive instruction for what theyâ€¯shouldâ€¯do
text: Nilimfokea kijana wangu wakati alipoonesha tabia hasi, badala ya kumpa maelekezo chanya ya nini anapaswa kufanya

SourceText: It is difficult to come up with instructions while we are still angry. Try and find a time when you are calm to introduce a positive instruction to your teen.
text: Ni vigumu kutoa maelekezo wakati bado tuna hasira. Jaribu na upate muda unapokuwa mtulivu kuanzisha maelekezo chanya kwa kijana wako.

SourceText: I was afraid my teen would think I was weak
text: Niliogopa kijana wangu angeniona mimi dhaifu

SourceText: Sharing feelings helps your teen to be aware and learn to do the same. You can choose how much detail you want to share about the situation. It is up to you! You can also choose to answer questions later by saying, *â€œI am feeling angry/stressed now. Could you please give me some time? We can talk about this more tonight.â€
text: Kushirikishana hisia humsaidia kijana wako kutambua na kujifunza hivyohivyo. Unaweza kuchagua mambo gani unayotaka kuwashirikisha kuhusu hali hiyo. Ni chaguo lako! Pia unaweza kuchagua kujibu maswali baadaye kwa kusema, *" Najisikia hasira/ msongo wa mawazo sasa. Mnaweza kunipatia mda kidogo tafadhali? Tunaweza zungumza zaidi kuhusu hili usiku,"*.

SourceText: My teen and I could not agree on a rule
text: Mimi na kijana wangu hatukuweza kukubaliana kuhusu sheria

SourceText: Think about whether the rule is reasonable. Can your teen follow it? When making rules as a family, it helps to think about your teen, how old they are and what is important to them.
text: Fikiria kama sheria ina mantiki. Kijana wako anaweza kuifuata? Mnapotunga sheria kama familia, ni vizuri ukafikiria kuhusu kijana wako, umri wao na nini ambacho ni muhimu kwao.

SourceText: My teen felt it was unfair that they have to follow the rule while I dont have to follow it
text: Kijana wangu alihisi kuwa haikuwa haki kwamba wanatakiwa kuifuata sheria hiyo wakati mimi sihitaji kuifuata

SourceText:
We should always remember that our teens learn best from us. The more we follow the rules, the more they will follow the rules, too.

You can adjust the rule to make sure that it is realistic for everyone to follow.
text:
Tunakiwa daima kukumbuka kwamba vijana wetu hujifunza vizuri sana kutoka kwetu. Kadri tunavyofuata sheria, ndivyo watakavyofuata sheria pia.

Unaweza kuibadilisha sheria kuhakikisha zinakuwa halisia zaidi kwa kila mmoja kuzifuata.

SourceText: I felt uncomfortable because I feel that I should be the one making the rule, not my teen
text: Nilijisikia vibaya, kwa sababu ninahisi kwamba mimi ndiye ninapaswa kuweka sheria hiyo, si kijana wangu

SourceText: When we make rules together with our teens, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic, and our teens will be more willing and able to follow the rules.
text: Tunapoweka sheria pamoja na vijana wetu, husaidia familia kuelewana vizuri zaidi. Sheria hizo zitakuwa na uhalisia zaidi, na vijana wetu watakuwa na utayari zaidi na wataweza kuzifuata sheria hizo.

SourceText: My partner felt uncomfortable, because they feel that they should be the one making the rule, not the teen
text: Mwenza wangu alijisia vibaya, kwa sababu anahisi kwamba yeye ndiye anapaswa kuweka sheria hiyo, si kijana

SourceText: When we establish rules together with our teens, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic, and our teens will be more willing and able to follow the rules.
text: Tunapoweka sheria pamoja na vijana wetu, husaidia familia kuelewana vizuri zaidi. Sheria hizo zitakuwa na uhalisia zaidi, na vijana wetu watakuwa na utayari zaidi na wataweza kuzifuata sheria hizo.

SourceText: When we tried to set a rule, we got into an argument
text: Tulipojaribu kuweka sheria, tulijikuta tunabishana

SourceText: Was your teen in a good mood when you tried to set the rule? It is best to set rules when the situation is calm. If you or your teen are tired or hungry, it is better to talk about rules at a later time.
text: Je, kijana wako alikuwa na hali nzuri kihisia mlipojaribu kuweka sheria? Ni vizuri zaidi kutengeneza sheria wakati kukiwa na hali ya utulivu. Kama wewe au kijana wako atakuwa amechoka au ana njaa, ni vizuri zaidi kuzungumzia sheria baadaye.

SourceText: We were not able to stick to the rule
text: Hatukuweza kufuata sheria

SourceText: The rule needs to be specific and realistic. Make sure to have a rule that can be kept easily, like having one meal together every Sunday instead of every night.
text: Sheria zinapaswa ziwe mahususi na zinazotekelezeka. Hakikisha kuwa una sheria inayoweza kufuatwa kwa urahisi, kama vile kula mlo mmoja pamoja kila Jumapili badala ya kila siku usiku.

SourceText: My teen and I disagree on which areas and online activities were unsafe
text: Mimi na kijana wangu hatukukubaliana kuhusu maeneo na shughuli za mtandaoni ambazo hazikuwa salama

SourceText: Well done for trying the activity! When we listen to our teenagers, even if we disagree, we learn to understand their thinking. Try and find time to do the activity again â€“ try to really listen and show you understand them before sharing your thoughts.
text: Hongera kwa kujaribu shughuli hii! Tunapowasikiliza vijana wetu, hata kama hatukubaliani nao, tunajifunza kuelewa wanavyofikiri. Jaribu kutafuta muda wa kufanya shughuli hii tena â€“ jaribu kusikiliza na kuonesha kuwa unawaelewa kabla ya kuwashirikisha mawazo yako.

SourceText: My teen identified the house of someone I trust as unsafe. I was shocked and did not know what to do
text: Kijana wangu alitambua nyumba ya mtu ninayemwamini kuwa si salama. Nilishtuka na sikujua cha kufanya

SourceText: It is shocking to learn that people who are close to us and who we trust may be a danger to our teens. Remember to take a pause when you are upset and try to listen calmly to your teen. Find someone you can talk to about this, perhaps a friend or support service, so you can get the support you need.
text: Ni jambo la kushtua kujua kwamba watu walio karibu nasi na tunaowaamini wanaweza kuwa hatari kwa vijana wetu. Kumbuka kuchukua pumziko unapokuwa umekasirika na jaribu kumsikiliza kijana wako kwa utulivu. Tafuta mtu unayeweza kuzungumza naye kuhusu jambo hili, labda rafiki au huduma ya msaada, ili uweze kupata msaada unaohitaji.

SourceText: My teen thinks a place is safe, but I donâ€™t agree. Iâ€™m not sure how to talk to them about it
text: Kijana wangu anafikiri eneo ni salama, lakini sikubaliani. Sina uhakika wa namna ya kuongea nao kuhusu hilo

SourceText: This can be very frustrating. To find a solution, your teen needs to feel heard â€“ so listen calmly to your teen's reasons and only then share your own thoughts. Then, think together about a rule that allows them to have fun but stay safe.
text: Jambo hili linaweza kukatisha tamaa sana. Ili kupata suluhisho, kijana wako anahitaji kuhisi kuwa anasikilizwa â€“ kwa hiyo, sikiliza kwa utulivu sababu za kijana wako, halafu ndipo umshirikishe maoni yako. Kisha, shirikianeni kuweka sheria inayomruhusu kufurahi huku akiwa salama.

SourceText: As an adult, I feel responsible to protect â€” but when I told my teen what is safe and what is not, my teen got angry
text: Kama mtu mzima, ninahisi ninawajibika kumlinda â€“ lakini nilipomwambia kijana wangu kuhusu kilicho salama na kisicho salama, alikasirika

SourceText: Our teenagers may know things about our communities and technology that we are not aware of. When we actively involve our teens in the mapping activity and really listen to them, they feel heard and valued, and it can be easier to come up with a plan that everyone agrees on.
text: Vijana wetu wanaweza kujua mambo yanayohusu jamii zetu na teknolojia ambayo hatuyajui. Tunapowashirikisha kikamilifu vijana wetu kwenye shughuli ya ubainishaji na kuwasikiliza, watajisikia kuwa wanasikilizwa na kuthaminiwa, na inaweza kuwa rahisi zaidi kupata mpango unaokubaliwa na kila mmoja.

SourceText: It was hard to identify support resources available in my community
text: Ilikuwa vigumu kujua sehemu za kupata msaada zilizopo katika jamii yangu

SourceText: It is difficult to know every detail about our communities. Involve another family member or friend in your mapping activity. You can even visit some of the services available and ask what they do. The more we know, the better we can keep our families safe!
text: Ni vigumu kujua kila kitu kuhusu jamii zetu. Shirikisha rafiki au mwanafamilia mwingine katika shughuli yako ya ubainishaji. Unaweza hata kutembelea baadhi ya huduma zinazopatikana na kuuliza wanachofanya. Kadri tunavyojua mengi, ndivyo tunavyoweza kuziweka salama familia zetu!

SourceText: I do not know much about technology, so I do not know how to talk about it with my teen
text: Sifahamu mengi kuhusu teknolojia, kwa hiyo sijui jinsi ya kuizungumzia na kijana wangu

SourceText:
That is totally fine! You can still support your teen. Ask your teen to explain the gadgets they use â€” you could do this during one-on-one time. 

This is a great opportunity to show interest in your teenâ€™s life and to discuss potential risks together. If you are not sure which rules to set, you can always agree, with your teen, to try a new rule for two weeks and then discuss how things are going and change the rule if needed!
text:
Haina tatizo kabisa! bado unaweza msaidia kijana wako. Muulize juu ya vifaa vya kielektroniki anavyotumia - unaweza kufanya hivyo wakati wa mda wa pamoja wawili.

Hii ni nafasi nzuri ya kumuonesha kijana wako unayajali maisha yake na kujadiliana changamoto mbalimbali kwa pamoja. Ikiwa huna hakika na sheria zipi uweke, mnaweza kukubaliana na kijana wako kujaribu sheria mpya kwa wiki mbili halafu mjadili jinsi mambo yanavyoendelea na kubadilisha sheria hiyo ikiiwa kama kunaulazima!

SourceText: My teen told me that something serious happened to them and I did not know how to handle it
text: Kijana wangu aliniambia kunajambo kubwa limewatokea na sikujua jinsi ya kulishungulikia

SourceText: Praise your teen for telling you, that is not easy to do! Remember, you can use all the skills you picked from your toolbox: Take a pause, use the four steps of problem solving and reach out to get the support you and your teen need!
text: Msifie kijana wako kwa kukwambia, si kazi rahisi kufanya hivyo! Kumbuka, unaweza kutumia ujuzi wako ulioupata kwenye kisanduku cha hazina: chukua pumziko, tumia hatua nne za kutatua matatizo na tafuta msaada unaohitaji wewe na kijana wako!

SourceText: The conversation made me very uncomfortable because I was reminded of a negative experience I had
text: Mazungumzo yale yalinifanya nijihisi vibaya sana kwa sababu yalinikumbusha matukio mabaya nilikwishapitia

SourceText: When we are reminded of such experiences, it is normal to feel upset or angry. It is important to find a time when you are calm, so that you can think of what support you need. You may need to talk to someone.
text: Tunapokumbushwa nyakati kama hizo, ni kawaida kuhisi kufadhaika au kukasirika. Ni muhimu kutafuta muda ambao umetulia, ili uweze kufikiria msaada unaouhitaji. Unaweza kuhitaji kuzungumza na mtu.

SourceText: One of us did not feel comfortable
text: Mmoja wetu hakujisikia vizuri

SourceText: This is difficult stuff to talk about. Find a relaxing time for it. We know it is much easier to not talk about these things and to hope they will never happen to us. However, learning to deal with crises is like getting insurance â€” it is ALWAYS best to be prepared.
text: Haya ni mambo magumu kuyazungumza. Tafuta mda wa utulivu kwaajili yake. Tunajua ni rahisi zaidi kutozungumzia mambo haya na kuamini hayatatutokea. Hata hivyo, kujifunza jinsi ya kukabiliana na misukosuko ni kama kupata bima â€” na DAIMA bora kuwa tayari.

SourceText: I did not want to tell my family how much I earn
text: Sikutaka kuwaambia familia yangu ni kiasi gani ninachopata

SourceText: You do not have to reveal the exact amount you earn; you could give an estimate. You could say, â€œIn this household, we have TSh2000 every monthâ€ rather than, â€œI make TSh2000.â€
text: Hauhitaji kusema kiasi halisi unachopata; unaweza kutoa makadirio tu. Unaweza kusema, â€œKatika nyumba hii tunapata TSh2000 kila mweziâ€ badala ya kusema, â€œNinapata TSh2000.â€

SourceText: When budgeting, we could not agree on what should fall under needs and what should fall under wants
text: Wakati wa kuteengeneza bajeti, hatukuweza kufikia muafaka ni kitu kipi ni mahitaji na kitu kipi ni matamanio

SourceText: Peopleâ€™s wants and needs are different sometimes. Talking about them together can help you and your teen to understand each other, respect your differences and see where you can compromise.
text: Mahitaji na matamanio ya watu wakati mwingine hutofautiana. Kuyazungumza pamoja kunaweza kuwasaidia wewe na kijana wako kuelewana, kuheshimu tofauti zenu na kuona wapi mnaweza kufikia muafaka.

SourceText: I did not understand what to do
text: Sikuelewa nini cha kufanya

SourceText: I am sorry to hear this. I know it can be difficult! Why donâ€™t you try to go through the module again? Your teen or other family members can join and help you!
text: Nasikitika kusikia hili. Najua inaweza kua vigumu! kwanini usijalibu kurudia kupitia vipindi upya? kijanawako au mwanafamilia mwingine wanaweza kujiunga na kukusaidia!

SourceText: My teen did not want to do the budgeting with me
text: Kijana wangu hakutaka kupanga bajeti pamoja nami

SourceText:
Try making the budget with other adults in your home first. Your teen may get interested in what you are doing.

Making a budget may sound serious but try to make it fun â€” make it a game during one-on-one time!

Remember to praise them when you are done!
text:
Jaribu kupanga bujeti kwanza na watu wazima wengine walioko katika nyumba yako, Kijana wako anaweza vutiwa na kile unachokifanya.

Kutengeneza bajeti inaweza kuonekana jambo zito sana, lakini jaribu kulifanya liwe la kufurahisha â€” lifanye kuwa mchezo wakati wa muda wa pamoja!

Kumbuka kuwasifia baada ya kumaliza!

SourceText: It made me uncomfortable
text: Ilinifanya nikose raha

SourceText:
Talking about body changes, intimate relationships, and sex can be uncomfortable â€“ many parents feel this way!

Remember, these are all normal parts of life. The more you talk about them and educate your teen, the more prepared they are for keeping themselves healthy and safe.
text:
Kuzungumza kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili, mahusiano ya kimapenzi, na ngono inaweza kuwa ngumu â€“ wazazi wengi wanajisikia hivi!

Kumbuka, haya yote ni kawaida katika maisha. Kadri unavyoyazungumzia na kumuelimisha kijana wako, ndivyo watakua tayari zaidi kujilinda na kudumisha afya na usalama wao.

SourceText: It made my teen uncomfortable
text: Ilimfanya kijana wangu akose raha

SourceText:
Teens often do not want to speak to their parents about body changes, intimate relationships, and sex. Tell your teen that that is normal and you also went through this.

If they do not want to talk to you, give them resources so they can learn about the topic. Tell your teen that you are happy to speak with them any time!
text:
Vijana mara nyingi hawataki kuzungumza na wazazi wao kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili, mahusiano ya kimapenzi, na ngono. Mwambie kijana wako kwamba hiyo ni kawaida na wewe pia ulipitia hayo.

Ikiwa hawataki kuzungumza nawe, wape nyenzo ili waweze kujifunza kuhusu mada hizo. Mwambie kijana wako kwamba unafurahi kuzungumza naye wakati wowote!

SourceText: I do not know where to find resources to support my teen's development
text: Sijui wapi pakupata rasilimali za kusaidia maendeleo ya kijana wangu

SourceText: It can be hard to find resources! Go to your nearest clinic or another support service and ask what resources they may have available.
text: Inaweza kuwa ngumu kupata rasilimali! Nenda kwenye kliniki iliyo karibu nawe au huduma nyingine ya usaidizi na kuuliza ni rasilimali gani zinaweza kuwepo.

SourceText: My teen and/or I felt uncomfortable
text: Kijana wangu na/ au mimi tulijisikia vibaya

SourceText:
Talking about potential dangers in our direct environment is never easy. However, dangerous situations can happen to anyone and helping your teen be prepared can make the biggest difference to keep them safe.

Try to have another conversation or practise with your teen so you can both get more confident with your new skills to stay safe.
text:
Kuzungumza juu ya hatari zinazowezekana katika mazingira yetu halisi sio rahisi kabisa. Hata hivyo, hali hatari zinaweza kutokea kwa mtu yeyote na kumsaidia kijana wako kuwa tayari kunaweza kuleta tofauti kubwa zaidi ili kumuweka salama.

Jaribu kuwa na mazungumzo mengine au fanya mazoezi na kijana wako ili nyote wawili muweze kujiamini zaidi na ujuzi wenu mpya ili kubaki salama.

SourceText: I discovered my teen experienced a dangerous situation or trauma
text: Niligundua kuwa kijana wangu amepitia hali hatarishi au mshtuko mkubwa

SourceText:
It can be hard for teens to open up about a difficult situation or trauma they experienced, especially if it happened while they were in a place or with people that you may not approve of as a parent. 

Remember to breathe and listen to what your teen needs. You can find support together if needed.
text:
Inaweza kuwa vigumu kwa vijana kufunguka kuhusu hali ngumu au mshtuko walioupitia, hasa ikiwa ilitokea walipokua mahari au na mtu ambaye mzazi hakuidhinisha. 

Kumbuka kupumua na kusikiliza kile kijana wako anachohitaji. Unaweza kupata msaada kwa pamoja ikiwa itahitajika.

SourceText: The conversation reminded me of a difficult experience I had
text: Mazungumzo yalinikumbusha kuhusu hali ngumu niliyopatia

SourceText:
It is normal to feel upset or angry when we are reminded of such experiences. Think about what support you may need. Taking good care of yourself is essential for taking good care of your family.

Once you are in a calmer space, you can try again to talk to your teen about how they can stay safe.
text:
Ni jambo la kawaida kukasirika au kukasirika tunapokumbushwa mambo kama hayo. Fikiria juu ya msaada gani unaweza kuhitaji. Kujitunza vizuri ni muhimu ili kutunza familia yako vizuri. 



Unapokuwa katika sehemu tulivu, unaweza kujaribu tena kuzungumza na kijana wako kuhusu jinsi anavyoweza kukaa salama.

SourceText: I was afraid my teen would think I was weak.
text: Niliogopa kijana wangu angeniona mimi dhaifu.

SourceText: Sharing feelings, especially the difficult ones, sets an important example for your teen! It actually makes everyone in the family stronger, because you can understand and support each other better.
text: Kushirikishana hisia, hasa zile ngumu, huonesha mfano wa kuigwa kwa kijana wako! Kwa hakika humfanya kila mtu kwenye familia kuwa imara zaidi, kwa sababu mnaweza kuelewana na kusaidiana vizuri zaidi.

SourceText: I felt uncomfortable about naming specific difficult feelings
text: Nilijisikia vibaya kuhusu kutaja hisia ngumu

SourceText:
Being specific is not rude or insensitive â€“ it really helps others to understand you clearly and this prevents confusion in the family. 

Feelings, like anger and stress, are part of our lives. All we need to do when we feel angry and stressed is handle our emotions well by taking a few deep breaths before responding.
text:
Kuwa mahususi si ukosefu wa adabu au kutokuwa na huruma â€“ kunasaidia wengine kukuelewa vizuri na kuepuka mkohelewana ndani ya familia.

Hisia, kama vile hasira na msongo mawazo, ni sehemu ya maisha yetu. Kile tunachohitaji kufanya tunapojisikia hasira na msongo ni kushughulikia hisia zetu vizuri kwa kuvuta pumzi ndefu kabla ya kuamua cha kujibu.

SourceText: My teen felt uncomfortable when I shared my feelings
text: Kijana wangu alijisikia vibaya wakati niliposhirikisha hisia zangu

SourceText: Starting a new thing is always difficult at first. Give yourselves some time to get used to it and keep showing a good example by observing and sharing your feelings. Over time, your teen will learn to do the same, and they will feel even more loved and cared for!
text: Kuanza kitu kipya mara zote ni vigumu. Jipe muda wa kuzoea na endelea kuonyesha mfano mzuri kwa kutambua hisia zako na kuwashirikisha wengine. Baada ya muda, kijana wako atajifunza kufanya hivyohivyo, na atahisi kupendwa na kutunzwa mno!

SourceText: When I shared my feelings, my teen asked many questions, which made me uncomfortable
text: Kijana wangu alijisikia vibaya wakati niliposhirikisha hisia zangu

SourceText: Sharing feelings helps your teen to be aware and learn to do the same. You can choose how much detail you want to share about the situation. It is up to you! You can also choose to answer questions later by saying, *â€œI am feeling angry/stressed now. Could you please give me some time? We can talk about this more tonight.â€*
text: Kushirikishana hisia humsaidia kijana wako kua makini na kujifunza pia kufanya hivyo. Unaweza kuchagua mambo gani unayotoka kuwashirikisha wengine kuhusu hali hiyo. Ni chaguo lako! Pia unaweza kuchagua kujibu maswali baadaye kwa kusema, *"Najisikia hasira/ msongo wa mawazo. mnaweza kunipatia mda kidogo? tunaweza zungumza kuhusu hili zaidi usiku."*

SourceText: I was too sad or overwhelmed to try sharing my feelings â€” I prefer to be alone when I feel like that
text: Nilihuzunika sana au kujihisi vibaya kushirikishana hisia zangu - napenda kuwa peke yangu ninapohisi hivyo

SourceText: It is okay to not want to share at that time. Find some time to explain later, when you feel calmer, so that everyone can understand.
text: Si vibaya kutotaka kuwashirikisha wengine kwa wakati huo. Tafuta muda wa kuwaelezea baadaye, unapohisi utulivu zaidi, ili kila mtu aelewe.

SourceText: I did not have enough time
text: Sina muda wa kutosha

SourceText: Thatâ€™s okay â€” it can be hard to find time. Try starting with something small, like helping them with one task or asking about their day. Every bit helps.
text: Sawa tu â€” inaweza kua vigumu kupata muda, jaribu kuanza na kitu kidogo, kama kuwasaidia kufanya kazi moja au kuwauliza kuhusu siku yao. Kila kidogo husaidia.

SourceText: My teen wasn't interested in the activity
text: Kijana wangu hakua tayari kwa shughuli

SourceText: It can be tough when teens seem not interested. Try letting them choose the activity next time â€” it might help them feel more involved.
text: Inaweza kua vigumu kijana anapoonesha kutokua na utayari. jaribu kuwaachia wachague shughuli kwa wakati ujao â€” hii inaweza wasaidia kujihushisha zaidi.

SourceText: I felt unsure what kind of activity would help with learning
text: Sikujua ni aina gani ya shughuli ingesaidia katika kujifunza

SourceText: Thatâ€™s okay. It doesnâ€™t have to be school-related â€” even cooking or watching a video together can be a chance to learn and connect.
text: Sawa tu. Haihitaji kuwa na uhusiano na shule â€” hata kupika au kuangalia video pamoja inaweza kuwa fursa ya kujifunza na kuungana.

SourceText: We did something together, but I donâ€™t think it helped
text: Tulifanya shughuli pamoja lakini sidhani kama ilisaidia

SourceText: Itâ€™s normal to wonder if itâ€™s working. Just spending time together builds connection and supports learning â€” even if it doesnâ€™t seem obvious right away.
text: Ni kawaida kujiuliza ikiwa inafanya kazi. Kutumia muda pamoja hujenga uhusiano na kusaidia kujifunza â€” hata kama haionekani kuwa wazi kwa mara moja.

SourceText: I tried, but my teen was too busy
text: Nimejaribu lakini kijana wangu hakupata nafasi

SourceText: Teens often have full schedules. Try asking when theyâ€™re free, or offer to join something theyâ€™re already doing â€” even briefly.
text: Vijana mara nyingi huwa na ratiba nyingi. Jaribu kuwauliza ni lini wako huru na jiunge nao kufanya kitu ambacho wanafanya â€” hata kwa ufupi.

SourceText: My teen chose a competitive activity. I won and s/he got angry
text: Kijana wangu alichangua shughuli ya ushindani. niliposhinda akakasirika

SourceText:
Competitive activities can be tough if your teen doesnâ€™t like losing.

Once theyâ€™ve calmed down, talk about what it means to win or lose kindly.

Try suggesting activities where you work together instead of compete.

Need ideas for activities? Tap the â€˜Playâ€™ button at the bottom of the App.
text:
Shughuli yenye ushindani inaweza kua ngumu ikiwa kijana wako hapendi kushindwa.
Baada ya kutulia zungumza nae maana ya kushinda au kushindwa kwa upole.
Jaribu kupendekeza shughuli ambazo mtashirikiana na si kushindana.

Unauhitaji wa mawazo ya shughuli? Bonyeza kitufe cha 'cheza' kilicho kwenye App.

SourceText:
Your data is important to us. This @global.privacy_policy sets out our policies for the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data in the use of @global.app_name_full.

Please read this @global.privacy_policy carefully. By downloading or using the app, you confirm to be informed concerning the collection and use of personal data in relation to this policy. We will not use or share your personal data with anyone except as described in this @global.privacy_policy.

The terms used in this @global.privacy_policy have the same meanings as in our @global.terms_and_conditions, which are accessible within the app, unless otherwise defined in this @global.privacy_policy.

Tafadhari soma hii @global.privacy_policy kwa umakini. Kwa kupakua na kutumia programu hii unathibitisha kua umejulishwa kuhusu ukusanyaji na matumizi ya data binafsi. hatutashirikisha au kutuma data zako binafsi kwa mtu yoyote isipokua kama ilivyoelezwa katika @global.privacy_policy. 

Masharti yaliotumika katika @global.privacy_policy yanamaana sawa na yaliopo kwenye @global.terms_and_conditions, ambayo yanapatikana ndani ya programu, isipokua yamefafanuliwa vinginevyo katika @global.privacy_policy.

SourceText: What personal data does the app collect about you and how do we use it?
text: Ni data gani binafsi programu hukusanya kukuhusu wewe na tunaitumiaje?

SourceText: Information Sharing and Third Party Service Providers and Websites
text: Ushirikishaji wa taarifa na watoa huduma wengine na tovuti

SourceText:
Your personal data may be shared with third parties such as researchers and partners involved in the improvement or implementation of the app including those outside your country. Prior to the disclosure of information with research partners we will make them anonymous by extracting data and removing any personally identifiable information. In reading this @global.privacy_policy, you acknowledge that we will use your anonymised data in published research.

We may transfer your personal data outside your country, for example, to administer cloud services. We will ensure that any country, company or person that we pass your personal information, will treat your information with the same level of protection as we are obliged to and we will rely on Standard Contractual Clauses.

The app is supported by duly authorized third parties that may collect your personal data in order to provide their services. We do so for the following reasons:
-   To provide the app on our behalf;
-   To perform app-related services; or
-   To assist us in analysing how our app is used.

Links to the privacy policies of third-party service providers used by the app:
-   [Apple Media Services](https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/)
-   [Google Play Services](https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/)
-   [Google Analytics for Firebase](https://firebase.google.com/policies/analytics)
-   [Sentry](https://sentry.io/privacy/)
-   [Matomo](https://matomo.org/privacy-policy/)
-   [GlitchTip](https://glitchtip.com/legal/privacy)

This app may contain links to other sites that are not covered by this @global.privacy_policy. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to that site. This @global.privacy_policy applies only to the processing of your personal data by this app. It does not address, and we are not responsible for, the privacy, information, or other practices of any third parties, including any third party operating any site or service to which this app links to.
text:
Taarifa zako binafsi zinaweza kushirikishwa kwa watu wengine kama watafiti na washirika wanaohusika kwenye kuboresha na utekelezaji wa programu ndani ya nchi na nje ya nchi. Kabla ya kuweka wazi taarifa kwa watafiti washirika  tutafanya siri kwa kuchimba taarifa na kuondoa utambulisho. Kwa kusoma hii @global.privacy_policy, una kubali kwamba tutakuwa tunatumia taarifa zako bila kujulikana kwenye utafiti uliochapishwa. 

Tunaweza kuhamisha taarifa zako binafsi nje ya nchi yako, kwa mfano, kusimamia huduma za wingu. Tutahakikisha kwamba nchi yoyote, kampuni au mtu ambaye tutampa taarifa zako, ata tunza taarifa zako kwa daraja sawa la ulinzi kama ambavyo sisi tuna tunza na tunategemea vifungu vya mkataba wa viwango.

Programu ina ungwa mkono na watu ambao wame kubaliwa ambao wanaweza kukusanya taarifa zako binafsi ili kutoa huduma. Tunafanya kwa kwa sababu zifuatazo:
- Kutoa programu kwa niaba yetu;
- Kufanya huduma zinazohusiana na programu; au
- Kutusaidia sisi kwenye kuchambua namna ambayo programu inatumika. 

Viungo kwenye sera za faragha kwa watoa huduma za mtu wa tatu ambavyo zimetumika kwenye programu:
-  [Huduma za mawasiliano za apple](https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/)
-  [Duka la huduma za google](https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/)
-  [Google Analytics for Firebase](https://firebase.google.com/policies/analytics)
-  [Sentry](https://sentry.io/privacy/)
-  [Matomo](https://matomo.org/privacy-policy/) 
-  [GlitchTip](https://glitchtip.com/legal/privacy)

Programu hii inaweza kuwa na viungo kwenda tovuti nyingine ambazo siyo sehemu ya  @global.privacy_policy. Uki bonyeza kwenye kiungo cha mtu wa tatu, utapelekwa kwenye hiyo tovuti. Hii @global.privacy_policy inahusu tu uchakataji wa taarifa zako binafsi kwenye hii programu. haiwezi kubaini na hatuwezi kuhusika na, faragha, taarifa, na mazoea mengine ya mtu wa tatu, ikijumuisha mtu wa tatu yoyote anayeendesha tovuti yoyote au huduma ambazo programu hii inaungana nazo.

SourceText: How long do we keep your data?
text: Je, tunahifadhi taarifa yako kwa muda gani?

SourceText: We will retain your personal information for as long as you continue to use the app and keep the app installed on your phone as long as we need it to fulfill our purposes, including any relating to app services as well as legal, accounting, or reporting requirements. In any case, we will not process your data over 4 years after your last use of the app.
text: Tutahifadhi taarifa zako binafsi mda wote utakao kua unatumia programu na mda ambao program bado ipo kwenye simu yako ili kukamilisha madhumuni yetu, hii ni pamoja na huduma zote za programu na mahitaji yote ya kisheria, uhasibu, au ripoti. Hata hivyo, hatutachakata data zako zaidi ya miaka 4 baada ya matumizi yako ya mwisho ya programu.

SourceText: How do we keep your data secure?
text: Je, tunawekaje taarifa zako salama?

SourceText: We value your trust in providing us your personal information, thus we are striving to use commercially acceptable means of protecting it. We reserve the right to the storage of your data on third party servers or databases outside of the listed @global.app_name_full team (refer to the section on Third Party Service Providers and Websites) that provide security measures compliant with applicable privacy laws and regulations.
