SourceText: Childrenâ€™s Privacy
text: Faragha ya Watoto

SourceText: If you are under the age of 18 you are not allowed to use this app. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from individuals under 18. If we become aware that a user under 18 has submitted personal data without verifiable parental consent, we will delete such information as quickly as possible.
text: Iwapo upo chini ya miaka 18 hauruhusiwi kutumia programu hii. hatutakusanya taarifa binafsi kutoka kwa mtu alie chini ya miaka 18, na ikatokea tukatambua mtu chini ya miaka 18 ametoa taarifa binafsi bila idhini ya wazazi, tutafuta taarifa hiyo haraka iwezekanavyo.

SourceText: Your data protection rights
text: Haki zako za ulinzi wa taarifa

SourceText:
Under data protection law, you have rights including:

Your right of access - You have the right to ask us for copies of your personal information.

Your right to rectification - You have the right to ask us to rectify personal information you think is inaccurate. You also have the right to ask us to complete information you think is incomplete.

Your right to erasure - You have the right to ask us to erase your personal information in certain circumstances.

Your right to withdraw consent for data processing at any time - You can choose to halt the processing of your data if consent was the legal basis for handling your information.

Your right to restriction of processing - You have the right to ask us to restrict the processing of your personal information in certain circumstances.

Your right to object to processing - You have the right to object to the processing of your personal information in certain circumstances.

Your right to data portability - You have the right to ask that we transfer the personal information you gave us to another organisation, or to you, in certain circumstances.

You are not required to pay any charge for exercising your rights. Depending on the circumstances and the nature of your request it may not be possible for us to do what you have asked, for example, where there is a statutory or contractual requirement for us to process your data and it would not be possible to fulfil our legal obligations if we were to stop. Further information on your rights is available from the [Information Commissioner's Office (ICO)](https://ico.org.uk/for-organisations/uk-gdpr-guidance-and-resources/individual-rights/individual-rights/).
text:
Sheria za ulinzi wa taarifa zako, hii ikijumuhisha:

Haki ya kupatta taarifa - Una haki ya kupata nakala za taarifa zako binafsi.

Haki yako ya kurekebisha - Una haki ya kutuomba kurekebisha taarifa binafsi unayoona kuwa si sahihi. Pia una haki ya kutuomba kukamilisha taarifa unayoona kuwa haijakamilika.

Haki ya kufutwa kwa taarifa â€“ Una haki ya kutuomba kufuta taarifa zako binafsi katika hali fulani..

Haki ya kujitoa ushiriki wako wakati wowote â€“ Unaweza kuamua kuzuia uchakataji wa taarifa zako ikiwa ulishatoa ridhaa yako mwanzo na ndiyo msingi wa kisheria wa kushughulikia taarifa hizo.

Haki ya kuzuia uchakataji wa taarifa â€“ Una haki ya kutuomba kuzuia uchakataji wa taarifa zako binafsi katika hali fulani.

Haki ya kupinga uchakataji wa taarifa zako â€“ Una haki ya kupinga uchakataji wa taarifa zako binafsi katika hali fulani.

Haki ya kuhamisha data zako â€“ Una haki ya kutuomba kuhamisha taarifa binafsi uliyotupa kwa shirika jingine, au kwa wewe mwenyewe, katika hali fulani.

Hauhitajiki kulipa ada yoyote ili kutumia haki zako. Hata hivyo, kulingana na hali na asili ya ombi lako, huenda isiwezekane kutimiza ombi lako, mfano pale ambapo kuna sharti la kisheria au la mkataba linalotutaka kushughulikia taarifa zako na kutozishughulikia kungezuia kutimiza wajibu wetu wa kisheria. Maelezo zaidi kuhusu haki zako yanapatikana kutoka kwa Ofisi ya Kamishina wa Taarifa (ICO)](https://ico.org.uk/for-organisations/uk-gdpr-guidance-and-resources/individual-rights/individual-rights/).

SourceText: We are sorry if you find our app no longer useful. Should you decide to remove our app, we may still retain some of your data (although anonymised) to troubleshoot, aid in investigations, comply with legal requirements or to add to our existing research data sets.

SourceText: Rules of Usage
text: Kanuni za Matumizi

SourceText: @global.app_name_full is open-source, which means that its codebase can be found on GitHub for the wider software developer community. However, it's against the terms of use to alter the existing application or its materials, or to replicate any trademarks from the @global.app_name_full team. While the app is open-source, unauthorised translations or versions that do not credit the @global.app_name_full team are not permitted. Unauthorised access to confidential user data is forbidden. It's not acceptable to provide false information about yourself when using the app, make unfounded claims of affiliation, or inaccurately report the app's behaviour. Ensure that your usage of the app adheres to all local rules and laws. Adults only can use the app. If you are a minor in your country of residence you may not access and use the app.

Ingawa ni chanzo huria, jiepushe na kutafsiri programu katika lugha nyingine au kuunda matoleo mbadala bila kuweka alama ya @global.app_name_full timu. Ufikiaji usioidhinishwa wa data ya siri ya mtumiaji hauruhusiwi. Haikubaliki kutoa maelezo ya uwongo kukuhusu unapotumia programu, kutoa madai yasiyo na msingi ya ushirika, au kuripoti tabia ya programu kwa njia isiyo sahihi. Hakikisha kwamba matumizi yako ya programu yanazingatia kanuni na sheria zote za eneo lako. Hatimaye katika kufikia na kutumia programu, tunaamini kuwa wewe si mtoto katika nchi yako ya makazi.

SourceText: Security
text: Usalama

SourceText:
Our app stores and processes personal data that you have provided to us, in order to offer our services. It is your responsibility to keep your phone and access to the app secure. Removal of software restrictions and limitations imposed by the official operating system of your device is therefore not recommended. Doing so could make your phone vulnerable to malware, viruses, malicious programs as well as compromise your phoneâ€™s security features and could mean that the app will not work properly or at all.
All data collected by PLH is stored securely using encryption protocols, including encryption at rest and in transit, and is accessible only to authorized personnel.
To see how we handle your personal information, please see our @global.privacy_policy.

SourceText:
Please be aware that, except in cases of wilful misconduct, gross negligence, breach of obligations arising from public policy or liability that cannot be limited under the applicable law, the @global.app_name_full team exclude responsibility for the following:

1. Certain functions of the app will require the app to have an active internet connection. The @global.app_name_full team cannot take responsibility for the app not working at full functionality if you do not have access to Wi-Fi, or you do not have any of your data allowance left.

4. 6. Updates to the app occur regularly in order to improve performance and content, to adapt to new technologies, to prevent abuse or harm, to address legal, regulatory, safety, or security issues or for any other further need. The app is available on Android and Apple -- the requirements for this system (and for any additional systems we decide to extend the availability of the app to) may change. It is your responsibility to download app updates to keep using the app. The @global.app_name_full team does not promise that it will always update the app so that it is relevant to you and/or works with the operating system version that you have installed on your device. However, you agree to always accept updates to the application when offered to you.

7. The app site might not be available at all times for reasons of maintenance or trouble with associated software or hardware. We are not liable for any loss you may incur should the site not be accessible or is withdrawn. Equally, we have the right and choice to terminate your access and use of the app (including availability of captured data) at any time. Unless we tell you otherwise, upon any termination, (a) the rights and licenses granted to you in these terms will end; (b) you must stop using the app, and (if needed) delete it from your device.

8. You agree to indemnify, at your own expense, PLH, its officials, employees, consultants and agents, against any claims, including your costs and expenses, by any third party, resulting from your use of the app.

9. Companies or products associated with the app should not be interpreted as endorsement by the app or the @global.app_name_full team or demonstrate an intention to infringe proprietary rights.
text:
Tafadhali fahamu kwamba, isipokuwa kwabkufanya makosa kwa makusudi, uzembe ukiukaji wa wa wajibu unaotokana na Sera ya umma au dhima ambayo haiwezi kuwekwa kikomo chini ya Sheria husika tmu ya @global.app_name_full haiwajibiki kwa mambo yafuatayo:

1. Baadhi ya vitu katika progtma vitahitaji uwepo wa interneti. Timu ya @global.app_name_full haitawajibika kwa program ambayo haifanyi kazi vizuri kama huwezi kupata Wi-Fi, au kama huna salio lililobaki la data.

2. Kutumia programu nje na eneo lipo Wi-Fi, itamaamisha kwamba vigezo vya makubaliano na watoa huduma wa mtandao wako bado inatumika. Hivyo, unaweza kuwa unalipia gharama za interneti kwa muda wote unaitumia program, au gharama nyingine. Kwa kutumia programu hii unakubali kuwajibika kwa gharama hizo, zikiwemo gharama za data ukiwa utatumia programu hii nje na nyumbani ( yaani mkoa au nchi). Iwapo wewe si mlipaji wa gharama za kifara unchotumia kutumia programu hii, tafadhali fahamu kwamba tunaoamini kuwa umepata ridhaa ya kutumia programu hii kutoka kwa mlipaji wa gharama.

3. Ingawa tunajutaidi kuhakikisha kwamba programu inasasishwa na maudhii yake ni sahihi, tunategemea wahusika wenzetu kutupatia taarifa ili tuweze kuziwasilisha kwako. Hatufanyi mapitio ya mara kwa mara ya tovuti zote za nje na hatuwezi kuhakikishia kuwa taarifa hizo daima ni sahihi au za kuamini.

4. Timu ya @global.app_name_full haitakubali dhima yoyote kwa uharibifu au hasara yoyote, ya moja kwa moja au isiyo ya moja kwa moja, utakayopata kutokana na matumizi ya programu, au kutokana na kutegemea ushauri aubtaarifa yoyote inayotolewa na programu. Daima unapaswa kutumia busara na maamuzi yako binafsi yanayofaa kulingana na halinyako binafsi kuhusiana na ushauri aubtaarifa yoyote kutoka katika programu.

5. Hatuwajibiki kwa hali yoyote ya hitilafu za programu, virusi, au vitu vingine hatarishi vilivyotumwa na mhusika wa tatu kupitia tovuti yetu.

6. Sasisho za programu hufanyika mara kwa mara ili kuboresha utendaji kazi na maudhui, kuendana na teknolojia mpya, kuzuia matumizi mabaya au madhara, kushughulikia masuala ya kisheria, ya udhibiti, usalama au ulinzi, au kwa sababu nyingine yoyote ya ziada. Programu inapatikana kwenye Android na Apple â€” mahitaji ya mifumo hii (na kwa mifumo mingine yoyote ya ziada tutakayoamua kupanua upatikanaji wa programu) yanaweza kubadilika. Ni jukumu lako kupakua masasisho ya programu ili kuendelea kuitumia. Timu ya @global.app_name_full haiahidi kwamba daima itasasisha programu ili iendane na mahitaji yako na/au ifanye kazi na toleo la mfumo wa uendeshaji ulilolifunga kwenye kifaa chako. Hata hivyo, unakubali kila mara kukubali masasisho ya programu yanapokutolewa.

7. Tovuti ya programu huenda isipatikane wakati wote kutokana na sababu za matengenezo au matatizo yanayohusiana na programu au vifaa vinavyohusiana nayo. Hatutawajibika kwa hasara yoyote utakayopata endapo tovuti haitapatikana au itasitishwa. Vilevile, tunayo haki na uamuzi wa kusitisha upatikanaji na matumizi yako ya programu (ikiwemo upatikanaji wa data iliyorekodiwa) wakati wowote. Isipokuwa tukikutaarifu vinginevyo, mara tu usitishaji ukifanyika: (a) haki na leseni ulizopewa chini ya masharti haya zitakoma (b) lazima usitishe kutumia programu, na (ikihitajika) uifute kwenye kifaa chako.

8. Unakubali kufidia, kwa gharama zako mwenyewe, PLH, maafisa wake, wafanyakazi, washauri na mawakala wake, dhidi ya madai yoyote, yakiwemo gharama na matumizi yako, kutoka kwa mtu wa tatu, yanayotokana na matumizi yako ya programu.

9. Makampuni au bidhaa zinazohusishwa na programu hazipaswi kufasiriwa kama kuidhinishwa na programu au na timu ya @global.app_name_full, wala kuashiria nia ya kukiuka haki za umiliki wa mtu mwingine.

SourceText: Let's celebrate our journey together and all your achievements!

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Todayâ€™s topic is celebration and next steps.

It has been amazing, it has been wonderful having you on this journey. Today we are celebrating our journey together.

Today we are celebrating all the learnings that we have learnt throughout this time together.

Now, let's think of the next steps. What could be the next steps after this? Maybe we are planning to continue all the learnings that we have learnt here. We don't know, we are hoping that for the next steps, the skills, the learnings will continue. We wish you a pleasant, happy, family time. 

Thank you.
text:
Habari zenu.
Mada yetu ya leo inahusu ushesherehekeaji na hatua zinazofuata.

lilikuwa jambo la kushangazana na kustahajabisha kuwa na wewe kwenye safari hii. Leo tunasherehekea safari yetu pamoja, leo tunasherehekea mafunzo yote tuliyojifunza kwa muda wote.

SourceText:

text:
Fumba macho na pumzika.

Fikiria maisha ya familia yako yalivyokuwa kabla ya kuanza safari yako kwenye programu hii.

Jikumbushe ujuzi uliojifunza:
* Ujitunzaji
* Muda wa kuzungumza wawili
* Usifiaji
* Maagizo chanya
* Kudhibiti msongo wa mawazo
* Kutengeneza bajeti ya familia
* Sheria
* Njia za kufanya athari nyepesi
* Kutatua matatizo
* Usalama wa vijana
* Kushughulikia hali ya hatari

 Tafakari kuhusu safari â€“ je, ilikuwaje kwako:
* Kushirikishana na wengine mawazo na uzoefu
* Kutafakari na kujifunza kutokana na simulizi
* Kutumia ujuzi kwa kijana wako

SourceText:
Today's topic is about calm consequences.

Our actions have consequences. Some consequences happen naturally (â€œif you break something, you canâ€™t use it anymoreâ€). 

Other consequences we set as a family to motivate us to follow the rules (â€œif you come home late, you canâ€™t go out with friends tomorrowâ€).
text:
Mada yetu ya leo inahusu matokeo ya kuwa mtulivu.

Matendo yetu yana matokeo. Matokeo mengine hutokea kiasili ("ukivunja kitu, huwezi kukitumia tena'').

Matokeo mengine tumeyatengeneza kama familia ili yatuhamasishe kufuata taratibu tulizojiwekea (''Ukirudi leo nyumbani kwa kuchelewa, kesho hutapata fursa ya kutoka na marafiki zako'').

SourceText: How will introducing calm consequences help you and your family? Tap play to learn

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is calm consequences.

It is important that when we introduce consequences to our teenagers we involve them, but also important that we are calm when we introduce consequences.

That will assist us to agree on introducing calm consequences to our teenagers, and our teenagers will easily remember them when they are involved and that will make them responsible.
text:
Habari, zetu.

Mada ya leo ni athari nyepesi.

Ni muhimu kwamba tunapoanzisha adhabu nyepesi kwa vijana wetu tuwahusishe, lakini pia ni muhimu tuwe na utulivu tunapowasilisha adhabu hizo.

Hilo litatusaidia kukubaliana kuhusu kuanzisha adhabu nyepesi kwa vijana wetu, na vijana wetu watazikumbuka kwa urahisi wanapohusishwa, na hilo litawafanya kuwa wa kuwajibika.

SourceText:
When your teen behaves well you praise them, and when they break an agreed rule you give a calm consequence. 

Calm consequences work best when they are fair, agreed on together, and used consistently â€” not in anger.
text:
Vijana wako wanapoonyesha tabia njema wasifie, na inapotokea wameenda kinyume na utaratibu mliokubaliana jaribu kuowanyesha matokea ya kile walichokifanya kwa utulivu".

Matokeo tulivu au matokeo yenye utulivu hufanya kazi vizuri zaidi yanapokuwa ya haki, yaliyokubaliwa pamoja, na kutolewa kwa uthabiti bila hasira.

SourceText: Agreeing on consequences together works! Tap play to hear @data.characters.media_male_5.name tell his story
text: Kukubaliana juu ya matokeo kwa pamoja, hufanya kazi! Gusa cheza ili kusikia@data.characters.media_male_5.name elezea simulizi yake
note: The string @data.characters.media_male_5.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my teenagers made me angry, I used to shout and punish them right away. I felt so overwhelmed that I even threatened to leave. But nothing changed â€” they still did the same things, even when I shouted.

@global.app_name helped me see that teens listen better when I am calm. Now, when something happens, I take a deep breath and say, â€˜We will talk about this later when we are both calm.â€™

We also agree on consequences together before something goes wrong. This has made a big difference â€” we can resolve problems together, and I feel much less stressed.
I wish I knew this earlier, but itâ€™s never too late to start.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

Teens often break rules â€” itâ€™s a normal part of growing up.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you with calm consequences:
text: Hapa kuna vidokezo kadhaa vya kukusaidia kwenye athari nyepesi:

SourceText: EXPLAIN
text: ELEZA

SourceText:
Check you are both calm. Take a few breaths. Explain to your teen why you are concerned about their behaviour.

Explain the reasons why the rule mattered. You can share your feelings â€“ it is okay to say you are dissappointed.
text:
Hakikisha wote wawili mmetulia. Vuta pumzi mara kadhaa. Mweleze kijana wako kwa nini una wasiwasi na tabia zake.

Eleza kwa nini sheria hiyo ilikuwa muhimu. Unaweza kumshirikisha hisia zako â€“ si vibaya kusema umesikitika.

SourceText: AGREE
text: KUBALI

SourceText:
Plan consequences with your teen for following and not following the rule.

Ask for their ideas. Talk until you agree on something realistic.

Make a consequence for NOT following the rule and a privilege when they DO follow the rule.
text:
Panga na kijana wako athari za kufuata sheria na kutofuata sheria.

Mwombe atoe maoni yake. Zungumzeni hadi mtakapokubaliana kuhusu kitu halisi.

Weka athari za KUTOFUATA sheria na upendeleo pindi WANAPOFUATA sheria.

SourceText: Remember, consequences are more successful if you discuss and agree in advance with teens before you apply them.
text: Kumbuka, matokeo huwa na mafanikio zaidi ikiwa utajadili na kukubaliana na vijana mapema kabla ya kuyatekeleza.

SourceText: ACT
text: TENDA

SourceText:
**When your teen follows the rule, give praise and privileges!** 
They will feel respected and valued. Remember: The more we praise them, the more they will show that good behaviour!


**When your teen does not follow the rule, follow through with the consequence.** 
When your teen breaks the rule, calmly give the consequence. This should be FAIR (not too harsh), IMMEDIATE (do it straight away), CONSISTENT (same every time).
text:
**Wakati kijana wako anapofuata kanuni, msifie na mpe nafsi ya pekee!**
Wataona kuwa wanaheshimiwa na kuthaminiwa. Kumbuka: Kadri tunavyowasifia zaidi, ndivyo wanavyoendelea kuonyesha tabia njema!


**Kijana wako anapokiuka kanuni, tekeleza athari iliyokubaliwa.**
Wakati kijana wako anapovunja kanuni, toa adhabu nyepesi kwa utulivu. Hii inapaswa kuwa YA HAKI (si kali kupita kiasi), YA HARAKA (itekelezwe mara moja), THABITI (iwe hivyo kila mara).

SourceText: More tips
text: Vidokezo zaidi

SourceText: Remember, you can also agree on GOOD consequences for GOOD actions to see more positive behaviour!
text: Kumbuka, pia mnaweza kukubaliana juu ya matokeo MAZURI kwa matendo MAZURI ili kuona tabia chanya zaidi!

SourceText: Exactly! Consequences work best when they are set calmly, agreed on together, and followed through with care. By listening to your teen and staying firm but kind, you are correcting behaviour AND building trust and helping them learn responsibility.

SourceText:
My mom and dad would always punish me when they were angry with me. They would shout at me and I would also get angry. I often did not follow the rules, because they were too harsh, I did not understand what they were saying, or I would not even bother listening to them, because we were all angry.

One day, they asked me: Let's think together what the consequence should be for not coming home in time. It was great to give my view â€“ before something happens that makes us all angry. We are all calm and agree first. It is easier for me to follow the rules now because I know I agreed on the rule and on the consequence if I do not follow the rule.
text:
Mama na Baba yangu mara nyingi waliniadhibu pindi walipokuwa na hasira na mimi. Walinifokea na mimi nilipata hasira. Mara nyingi sikufuata sheria zao, kwa sababu zilikuwa kali, sikuelewa kile walichokuwa wakisema, au Nilikuwa sijihangaishi kuwasikiliza, kwa sababu wote tulikuwa na hasira.

Siku moja, waliniuliza: Hebu tufikiri kwa pamoja madhara yanayoweza kukupata kwa kushindwa kurudi nyumbani kwa wakati. Ilikuwa ni furaha kubwa kutoa maoni yangu kabla kitu hakijatokea na kutufanya wote kuwa na hasira. Wote tulitulia na kukubaliana kwanza. Sasa ni rahisi kwangu kufuata sheria kwa sababu najua na nilikubali sheria hizo na madhara kama sitafuata sheria hizo.

SourceText: Can skills to handle crises help your family? Tap play to find out
text: Je, ujuzi wa kukabiliana na changamoto unaweza kuisaidia familia yako? Gusa cheza ili kujua

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is dealing with crises.

Crisis may occur anywhere. Crisis may occur anytime. Therefore, it is important as a family to have plans in place should any family member find themselves in a crisis situation.

It is important to have plans so that every family member may feel protected.

When we are dealing with crises, remember to take a pause, breathe and keep yourself calm. That will help you to deal with crises better.
text:
Habari zenu.

Kipindi cha leo kinahusu kushughulikia hali ya hatari.

Hali ya hatari inaweza kutokea mahali popote. Hali ya hatari inaweza kutokea wakati wowote. Kwa hiyo, kama familia, ni muhimu kuwa na mipango ya kukabiliana na hatari kwa ajili ya mwanafamilia yeyote atakayejikuta kwenye hali ya hatari.

Ni muhimu kuwa na mipango ili kila mwanafamilia ahisi kulindwa.

Unaposhughulikia hali ya hatari, kumbuka kupumzika, kupumua na kutulia. Kufanya hivyo kutakusaidia kushughulikia hali ya hatari vizuri zaidi.

SourceText: Every crisis is a challenge, but it is also a chance to grow stronger as a family and show your teen that together, you can get through anything.
text: Kila hatari ni changamoto, lakini pia ni nafasi ya kuwa imara zaidi kama familia na waoneshe vijana wakonkwamba kwa pamoja mnaweza kuvuka katika Jambo lolote.

SourceText: @data.characters.media_female_9.name and her teen learned to handle crises together. Hear their story

SourceText:
My teen used to be so angry all the time. He would never listen and we would get into big arguments every day. Through @global.app_name, I started spending more time with my teen and strengthening our relationship. One day he shared with me that he was part of a gang but he wanted to get out.

We made short-term and long-term plans together on how we could do that. Our life looks so different now!
text:
Kijana wangu alikuwa mwenye hasira muda wote. Alikuwa hasikilizi na tulikuwa tunajikuta katika marumbano makubwa kila siku. Kupitia @global.app_name, nilianza kutumia muda zaidi na kijana wangu na kuimarisha uhusiano wetu. Siku moja alinishirikisha kwamba alikuwa sehemu ya genge baya lakini alikuwa anataka kujitoa.

Tuliweka pamoja mipango ya muda mfupi na ya muda mrefu jinsi tunaweza kufanya hivyo. Maisha yetu yanaonekana tofauti sasa hivi!

Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think. 

Here are some tips to help you deal with a crisis!
text:
Hali ya hatari inaweza kutufanya tuhisi hasira au kukata tamaa. Lakini huu ni wakati ambao vijana wetu wanatuhitaji zaidi â€“ tuvute pumzi, tusikilize, na tufikiri kwa utulivu.

Hivi ni baadhi ya vidokezo vinavoweza kukusaidia kupambana na hatari!

SourceText:
Two years ago, I was raped by my uncle who stayed in our yard. I did not tell my mother, because I was afraid she would hit me, shout at me, or even throw me out of the house. I did not have anywhere else to go.

When my mother started with @global.app_name, we started spending more time together. I was still afraid, but in the end I shared it with my mother. My mom did not shout, but she listened and told me it is not my fault. We went to the police and the clinic together. I am so grateful I do not have to carry this secret anymore.
text:
Miaka miwili iliyopita, nilibakwa na mjomba wangu aliyekuwa anaishi nyumbani kwetu. Sikumwambia mama yangu, kwa sababu niliogopa angenipiga, kunifokea, au hata kunifukuza ndani ya nyumba. Sikuwa na mahali popote pengine pa kwenda.

Wakati mama yangu alipoanza @global.app_name, alianza kutumia muda zaidi pamoja na mimi. Nilikuwa bado naogopa, lakini mwisho nilimshirikisha mama yangu. Mama yangu hakufoka, lakini alinisikiliza na kuniambia siyo kosa langu. Tulienda polisi na kliniki pamoja. Ninashukuru sana sihitaji kutunza zaidi siri hii.

Sehemu hii inajumuisha maudhui ambayo yanaweza kuwa nyeti. Unaweza kuiangalia peke yako kwanza. Hii itakutayarisha vyema kwa kushiriki maudhui na kijana wako na wengine baadaye.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about coping with grief.

Grief affects us all in different ways.

Whatever you feel, you are grieving in your own way, and that is okay.
text:
Mada ya leo inahusu kukabiliana na majonzi.

Majonzi hutuathiri sisi sote kwa namna tofauti.

Vyoyote unavyojisikia, unahuzunika kwa namna yako mwenyewew, na hiyo ni sawa.

SourceText: What techniques can you use to cope with grief? Tap play to find out
text: Ni mbinu gani unazotumia kukabiliana na majonzi

SourceText:
Greetings.

Today's topic is coping with grief.

Taking care of ourselves is important, especially when we are facing challenging and difficult times such as coping with grief. We need to stay calm in order to think and act positively whenever we find ourselves overwhelmed. We may use techniques such as taking a pause to calm ourselves down.
text:
Habari zenu.

Mada ya leo ni kukabiliana na huzuni.

Kujitunza ni muhimu, hasa tunapokabiliana na nyakati ngumu kama vile kukabiliana na huzuni. Tunatakiwa kuwa watuliviu ili kufikiri kutenda vema kila tunapojikuta tumeelemewa. Tunaweza kutumia mbinu kama vile kutulia ili kujituliza.

SourceText:
Taking care of ourselves during grief helps us stay calm and present for our children. 
When we share and name our feelings openly, it can help the whole family feel less alone and more supported.
text:
Kujitunza wakati wa huzuni hutusaidia kuwa watulivu na kuwepo kwajili ya watoto wetu.
Tunaposhirikishana na kutaja hisia zetu kwa uwazi, inaweza kusaidia familia nzima kuhisi kutokuwa na upweke na kuungwa mkono zaidi.

SourceText: Hear how naming feelings helped @data.characters.media_female_12.name feel closer to family while grieving
text: Sikiliza jinsi kutaja hisia kulivyosaidia @data.characters.media_female_12.name ajisikie karibu na familia wakati wa huzuni
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_12.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
After I lost my husband, the parenting tips that I learnt were so helpful to me: I began breathing calmly whenever I was feeling so sad or angry, and my kids really felt the difference because I was learning to keep calm.

Naming our feelings and being open about how we are feeling has helped me feel closer to my child. Before, I felt like I was the only one who was going through these emotions, but now I know that my child is feeling the same things. We can talk about it and help each other. We donâ€™t feel alone anymore.
text:
Baada ya kufiwa na mume wangu, vidokezo vya malezi nilivyojifunza vilinisaidia sana: Nilianza kuvuta pumzi kwa utulivu kila ninapohisi huzuni na hasira, na watoto wangu walihisi tofauti kwa sababu nilikuwa najifunza kuwa na utulivu.

Kuelezea hisia zetu na kuwa wazi kuhusu namna tunavyojisikia imenisaidia kuwa karibu na mtoto wangu. Hapo awali, nilihisi mimi peke yangu ndiye napitia hizi hisia, lakini sasa najua kwamba na mtoto wangu anahisi pia hali hiyo. Tunaweza kuzungumza kuhusu hilo na kusaidiana. Hatuhisi upweke tena.

SourceText:
Difficult emotions can lead to difficult behaviour â€“ especially with children. Losing a caregiver or a loved one can make your teen feel worried, insecure, or angry, and can often make them act out.

SourceText:
All these options are correct.

Everyone copes with grief differently. We can help each other by accepting each otherâ€™s feelings and coming up with ideas together to support each other.
text:
Chaguzi hizi zote ni sahihi.

Kila mmoja hukabiliana na majonzi kwa njia tofauti. Tunaweza kusaidiana kwa kukubali hisia za kila mmoja wetu na kuja na mawazo ya pamoja ili kusaidiana.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you and your family through times of grief:
text: Hapa kuna vidokezo vya kukusaidia wewe na familia yako wakati wa majonzi:

SourceText: ACCEPT
text: KUBALI

SourceText:
Losing someone we love can affect us for weeks, months or years. Thereâ€™s no right way to feel, and no need to feel better quickly.

Your teen may feel sad, angry, confused, or unwell. They may have nightmares, pain, or school problems. Even if they seem happy, they might still feel sad. This is all normal.
text:
Kumpoteza mtu tunayempenda kunaweza kutuathiri kwa majuma, miezi au mwaka. Hakuna njia sahihi ya kujihisi na hakuna haja ya kujisikia vizuri haraka.

Kijana wako anaweza kuhisi huzuni, hasira, kuchanganyikiwa, au vibaya. Wanaweza kuwa na ndoto mbaya, maumivu, au matatizo ya shule. Hata kama wanaonekana kuwa na furaha, bado wanaweza kuwa na huzuni. Haya yote ni ya kawaida.

SourceText: SAY GOODBYE
text: SEMA KWAHERI

SourceText:
Find a way to say goodbye that feels right for you and your family. Some people hold a ceremony or have a special meal to celebrate the person.

Ask your teen what they would want to do to say goodbye.
text:
Tafuta njia ya kusema kwaheri inayokufaa wewe na familia yako. Baadhi ya watu hufanya sherehe au huandaa chakula maalum ili kumsherehekea mtu huyo.

Muulize kijana wako angependa kufanya nini ili kusema kwaheri.

SourceText: TALK
text: ZUNGUMZA

SourceText:
Talking or writing about the person can help bring comfort. Gently share your memoriesâ€”both the happy ones and the hard ones.

Teens may sometimes feel the death was their fault. Kindly remind them it was not. Let them know they can always talk to you about their feelings, and show them itâ€™s okay by sharing yours too.
text:
Kuzungumza au kuandika juu ya mtu huyo kunaweza kuleta faraja. Washirikishe kumbukumbu zako kwa upole zile zote zenye furaha na zile ngumu.

Wakati fulani vijana wanaweza kuhisi kifo kilikuwa kosa lao. Tafadhali wakumbushe haikuwa hivyo. Wajulishe kuwa wanaweza kuzungumza nawe kila wakati kuhusu hisia zao, na uwaonyeshe kuwa ni sawa kwa kuwakushirikisha zako pia.

SourceText:
When we are going through a difficult time, it can help to talk about or write down how we feel.

Letâ€™s practise naming feelings. How do you feel now?
text:
Tunapopitia wakati mgumu, inaweza kusaidia kuzungumzia au kuandika jinsi tunavyohisi.

Wacha tujizoeze kutaja hisia?

SourceText: How could a person feel when someone they love passes away?
text: Je, mtu anaweza kuhisije mtu anayempenda anapoaga dunia?

SourceText: Sad
text: Huzuni

SourceText: Angry
text: Hasira

SourceText: Scared
text: Unaogopa

SourceText: Loved
text: Kupendwa

SourceText: Relieved
text: Ahueni

SourceText: Brave
text: Jasiri

SourceText: Someone who is grieving can feel many different emotions. They might also feel lost, shocked, numb, guilty, lonely, or even hopeful â€” all of these are normal.
text: Mtu anayehuzunika anaweza kuhisi hisia nyingi tofauti. Wanaweza pia kuhisi kupotea, kushtushwa, kufa ganzi, hatia, upweke, au hata kuwa na matumaini - yote haya ni ya kawaida.

SourceText:
This week's home activity is to share with your teen how you feel, and ask them to also name their feelings.

You can remind your teen of some emotions they might feel - like happy, sad, scared, hopeful, angry, or lonely. There is no right or wrong feeling. Sharing emotions helps you both feel less alone.
text:
Shughuli ya nyumbani ya wiki hii ni kushiriki na kijana wako jinsi unavyohisi, na kuwauliza pia wataje hisia zao.

Unaweza kumkumbusha kijana wako baadhi ya hisia anazoweza kuhisi - kama furaha, huzuni, hofu, matumaini, hasira, au upweke. Hakuna hisia sahihi au si sahihi. Kushiriki hisia kunawasaidia nyinyi wawili kuhisi kutokuwa peke yako.

SourceText: Can you share how you are feeling with your teen this week and invite them to name their feelings too?
text: Je, unaweza kumshirikisha jinsi unavyohisi na kijana wako wiki hii na kuwaalika kutaja hisia zao pia?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ndiyo

SourceText: Thatâ€™s wonderful. Talking about emotions helps you and your teen cope and connect during difficult times.
text: Hiyo ni ajabu. Kuzungumza kuhusu hisia hukusaidia wewe na kijana wako kustahimili na kuungana katika nyakati ngumu.

SourceText: I think so
text: Ninafikiri hivyo

SourceText: Thatâ€™s a good start. Even trying to open a conversation about feelings can help your teen feel supported. Keep going - you are doing something very important.
text: Huo ni mwanzo mzuri. Hata kujaribu kufungua mazungumzo kuhusu hisia kunaweza kumsaidia kijana wako kuhisi kuungwa mkono. Endelea - unafanya jambo muhimu sana.

SourceText: No
text: Hapana

SourceText: That's okay. Talking about feelings can be hard, especially during grief. Try again when the time feels right - every small step towards openness helps.
text: Hiyo ni sawa. Kuzungumza juu ya hisia inaweza kuwa ngumu, haswa wakati wa majonzi. Jaribu tena wakati unahisi kuwa sawa - kila hatua ndogo kuelekea uwazi husaidia.

SourceText: Grief can make both parents and teens feel alone - but talking about your feelings can help you cope together. Even small steps like checking in and sharing emotions can rebuild trust and connection.
text: Huzuni inaweza kuwafanya wazazi na vijana wajisikie peke yao - lakini kuzungumza kuhusu hisia zako kunaweza kukusaidia kukabiliana pamoja. Hata hatua ndogo kama kuangalia na kushirikishana hisia zinaweza kujenga uaminifu na muunganisho upya.

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_daughter_10.name and her father learned to support each other
text: Sikia jinsi @data.characters.media_daughter_10.name na baba yake walivyojifunza kusaidiana
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_10.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When I lost my mom, everything changed. I was so sad, but it felt like my dad couldn't understand. Our relationship suffered. We did our own things and we stopped talking to each other. But then something incredible happened.

My dad learnt all these things from the app about what to do when you lose someone. He asked me how I was doing and we started to talk again. He explained that he was sad too, and he even said he was sorry for not talking to me after my mom died. We can now see that it is hard for both of us, and we can help each other. He is supporting me and we are a lot closer.
text:
Nilipofiwa na mama yangu, kila kitu kilibadilika. Nilikuwa na huzuni sana, lakini ilikuwa kama baba yangu hakuelewa. Iliathiri mahusiano yetu. Kila mtu aliendelea na mambo yake na tuliacha kuongea. Lakini baadae jambo la ajabu lilitokea.

Baba yangu alijifunza mambo haya yote kutoka kwenye programu kuhusu nini cha kufanya pale unapofiwa na mtu. Aliniuliza ninaendeleaje na tulianza kuongea. Alielezea kwamba alikuwa na huzuni pia, na aliomba msamaha kwa kutozungumza na mimi baada ya mama kufariki. Sasa tunaweza kuona kwamba ni vigumu kwetu sisi, na tunaweze kusaidiana. Ananisaidia na tupo karibu zaidi.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about giving positive instructions!

Telling our teens what we DO want them to do works better than telling them to STOP doing something.
text:
Maada ya leo ni kuhusu kutoa maelekezo chanya!

Kuwaambia vijana wetu nini tunataka wafanye ni vizuri kuliko kuwakataza kufanya jambo fulani.

SourceText: Giving positive instructions really works! Tap play to learn more
text: Kutoa maelekezo chanya inafanya kazi vizuri sana! Bofya cheza kujifunza zaidi

SourceText:
Greetings, greetings everyone.

Today our topic is positive instructions.

It is important to give positive instructions to our children, because when we give them positive instructions they know and understand what we are expecting them to do and they do it the way we want them to do it.

So, at the end it keeps everyone happy.
text:
Habari zenu?

Leo mada yetu inahusu maelekezo chanya.

Ni muhimu kutoa maelekezo chanya kwa watoto wetu, kwa sababu tunapowapa maelekezo chanya, wanajua na kuelewa kile tunachotarajia wakifanye na wanakifanya kwa namna tunavyotaka wakifanye.

Kwa hiyo, mwishowe kila mtu hufurahi.

SourceText:
When you give positive instructions, your teen is more likely to listen! 

And remember to praise your teen for any good behaviour â€” the big and small things.
text:
Ukitoa maelekezo chanya, kijana wako ana uwezekano wa kusikiliza!

Kumbuka kumsifia kijana wako kwa kila tabia njema â€” vitu vikubwa a vidogo.

SourceText: Tap play to hear how positive instructions worked for @data.characters.media_female_3.name and her teens
text: Bofya cheza kusikia jinsi maelekezo chanya kwa @data.characters.media_female_3.name na vijana wake
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_3.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Before, I used to raise my teens the way I was raised: I would tell them â€œdonâ€™t do this, donâ€™t do that.â€ We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learnt about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my teens. It took time to learn to say â€œplease do thisâ€ instead of â€œdonâ€™t do this.â€

My teens and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done. My teen said one day â€œI really love this new mom,â€ and my own stress levels have come down a lot.
text:
Mwanzo, niliwalea watoto wangu kama vile nilivolelewa mimi. Ningewaambia, usifanye hiki usifanye kile. Tulikuwa tukigombana sana lakini mambo yalibadilika sana pindi nilipojifunza kutoa maelekezo chanya. 
Sasa nimejikita katika tabia niliyotaka kuiona, na natoa maelekezo ya wazi na rahisi kwa watoto wangu. Ilinichukua muda kujifunza kusema, tafadhali fanya hiki badala ya usifanye hivi. 
Mtoto wangu pamoja na mme wangu wanasema wanapenda namna hii ya ufanyaji vitu kwasababu sasa wanajua ni kitu gani kinafanyika. Mtoto wangu siku moja alisema, nampenda sana mama huyu mpya na msongo wangu wa mawazo umepungua kwa kiasi kikubwa.

SourceText:
Letâ€™s do a thought experiment!

DO NOT THINK ABOUT AN ELEPHANT.
text:
Tufanye jaribio la fikra!

USIFIKIRIE KUHUSU TEMBO.

SourceText:
What are you thinking about? 

You probably DID think about an elephant...
text:
Unafikiria kuhusu nini?

Inawezekana ulifikiri kuhusu tembo...

SourceText:
In the same way, when we tell our teens â€œdonâ€™t do that,â€ they often focus only on the thing we told them not to do.
They may not understand what we *DO* want.

And like most of us, they donâ€™t enjoy being told what not to do.
text:
Vivyo hivyo, tunapowaambia vijana wetu â€œusifanye hivyo,â€ mara nyingi wao huzingatia tu kile tulichowaambia wasifanye.
Wanaweza wasielewe kile tunachotaka *WAFANYE*.

Na wengi wetu, hawafurahii kuambiwa wasifanye kitu fulani.

SourceText:
NOW, THINK ABOUT A CHEETAH!

What are you thinking about?
text:
SASA FIKIRIA KUHUSU CHUI!

Unafikiri kuhusu nini?

SourceText:
Thatâ€™s right! Positive, clear instructions help teens focus on what they should be doing.

Teens will also feel more respected this way and are more likely to listen.
text:
Hivyo ni sahihi! maelekezo fasaha husaidia vijana kuzingatia kile ambacho wanapaswa kufanya.

Kwa namna hii vijana watajisikia kuheshimiwa pia na watakuwa wasikivu.

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you give your teen clear and positive instructions!

SourceText: GET REAL

SourceText: Can your teen actually do what you are about to ask? It may be impossible for them to read quietly all day, but half an hour when you really need it is realistic.

SourceText: GET POSITIVE
text: KUWA NA MTAZAMO CHANYA

SourceText: Smile, look them in the eye and use positive words. Praise them as soon as they start to do what you ask!
text: Tabasamu, mwangalie machoni na tumia maneno chanya. Msifie mara tu anapoanza kufanya kile unachotaka!

SourceText: GET CLEAR

SourceText: Often we know what we want in our head, but we donâ€™t say it clearly enough. Say exactly what you want your teen to do. Try â€˜please come home by 7pmâ€™ instead of â€˜come home on timeâ€™.

SourceText:
At first, I did not care much that my mother was doing with @global.app_name. But then I started to see my mother change how she communicated with us.

One day, when I was going out with my friends, she said I must be home by 6pm. I was like â€œHmmm okay,â€ because she normally did not give clear instructions on what she wanted â€“ she would just say nothing and then shout at me for being late when I got home.

When I got home around 5pm, my mother gave me a hug and said â€œThank you for being on time.â€ It was strange, but I liked it.

Since then, we have much clearer communication in the house.
text:
Mwanzoni, sikuwa najali sana kile ambacho mama yangu alikuwa anafanya na @global.app_name. Lakini baadaye nilianza kumuona mama yangu akibadilika katika jinsi alivyokuwa anawasiliana nasi.

Siku moja, nilipokuwa natoka nje na marafiki zangu, alisema lazima nirudi nyumbani saa kumi na mbili kamili jioni. Nilikuwa kama â€œHmmm sawa,â€ kwa sababu mara zote hakuwa anatoa maelekezo yaliyo wazi kuhusu kile alichokitaka â€“ hakusema chochote halafu baadaye alinipigia kelele kwa kuchelewa ninaporudi nyumbani.

Niliporudi nyumbani karibu saa kumi na moja jioni, mama alinipokea kwa kunikumbatia na kusema, â€œAsante kwa kurudi kwa wakati.â€ Ilikuwa ajabu, lakini niliipenda.

Tangu hapo, tuna mawasiliano ya wazi sana ndani ya nyumba.

Today's topic is about helping your teen learn.

SourceText:
Greetings everyone!

Today's topic is helping your teen to learn.

There are different fun ways and activities that we can use as parents to help our teens learn. Some of those activities could be playing games together or doing house chores together. Remember, our teens learn better when they are having fun!
text:
Habari!

Mada ya leo ni kumsaidia kijana wako kujifunza.

Kuna njia tofauti za kujifunza na shughuli ambazo tunaweza kutumia kama wazazi kusaidia vijana wetu kujifunza. Baadhi ya shughuli hizo zinaweza kuwa kucheza michezo pamoja au kufanya kazi za nyumbani pamoja. Kumbuka, vijana wetu hujifunza vyema zaidi wanapoburudika!

SourceText:
Learning does not only happen in school - it happens through fun activities, teamwork, and everyday moments. 
When we involve our teens and share decisions, we help them feel capable, confident, and connected to us.
text:
Kujifunza hakufanyiki shuleni pekee - hufanyika kupitia shughuli za kufurahisha, kazi ya pamoja na nyakati za kila siku. 
Tunapo wahusisha vijana wetu na kuwashirikisha kwenye maamuzi, tunawasaidia kujisikia wana uwezo, ujasiri, na kushikamana nasi.

Since we started spending more one-on-one time together, we have a better bond, a better understanding between us. I feel better about how I am parenting. I am doing a better job as a parent, not just being a parent, but showing love and working with him.

I like that the app encourages you to work with your children, and not just you are the parent up there and they are down there as the children, but they are involved a lot in the decisions you make that impact on them.

SourceText:
Yes, talking while doing chores helped them both!

When you do a chore with your teen, take time for yourself, and give them space to talk, you help them feel safe to learn with you.

This is an easy way to build a good relationship and teach them things they wonâ€™t learn at school.
text:
Ndiyo, kuzungumza huku wakifanya kazi za nyumbani kuliwasaidia wote wawili!

Unapofanya kazi za nyumbani pamoja na kijana wako, chukua muda wako mwenyewe, na kuwapa nafasi ya kuzungumza, unamsaidia kujisikia salama kujifunza pamoja nawe.

Hii ni njia rahisi ya kujenga uhusiano mzuri na kuwafundisha mambo ambayo hawatajifunza shuleni.

SourceText:
Letâ€™s think of activities you can do with your teen to help them learn.

Remember, teens are better at remembering what they learnt when it is fun.

Kumbuka, vijana hukumbuka vizuri yale waliojifunza kama wakiwa wanafurahia.

SourceText:
**Here are some ideas you could try today:**

SourceText: Here are some skills you can use to help your teen learn!
text: Huu ni baadhi ya ujuzi unaweza tumia kumsaidia kijana wako akajifunza!

SourceText: GET TOGETHER
text: KUKUTANA PAMOJA

SourceText: People learn better when they learn with others. Spend time with your teen and let them learn with you. When you do activities together, you give them space to learn, to make mistakes and to ask you questions.
text: Watu hujifunza vizuri zaidi wanapojifunza na wengine. Tumia wakati na kijana wako na waache wajifunze nawe. Mnapofanya shughuli pamoja, unawapa nafasi ya kujifunza, kufanya makosa na kukuuliza maswali.

SourceText: SUPPORT
text: MSAADA

SourceText: Your teen will learn from you if they know you support them. Let them try things and be patient with them. This helps them â€œlearn how to learnâ€, because they feel safe with you.
text: Kijana wako atajifunza kutoka kwako ikiwa anajua unamuunga mkono. Waache wajaribu mambo na kuwa na subira kwao. Hii inawasaidia "jinsi ya kujifunza", kwa sababu wanahisi kuwa salama na wewe.

SourceText: PRAISE
text: USIFIAJI

SourceText: Praising your teen is a powerful way to help them try again. Teens do not get things right the first time and should learn how to try again. Praise them for trying to do things, so they can learn from their mistakes.
text: Kumsifu kijana wako ni njia nzuri ya kumsaidia kujaribu tena. Vijana hawafanyi mambo sawa mara ya kwanza na wanapaswa kujifunza jinsi ya kujaribu tena. Wasifu kwa kujaribu kufanya mambo, ili wajifunze kutokana na makosa yao.

SourceText:
Helping your teen learn can feel stressful, but doing fun daily activities together supports their growth and learning.

This weekâ€™s home practice is to try a few activities with your teen!
text:
Kumsaidia kijana wako kujifunza inaweza kua changamoto, lakini kufanya shughuli za kila siku za kufurahisha kwa pamoja kunasaidia ukuaji wao na kujifunza.

Mazoezi ya nyumbani ya wiki hii ni kujaribu shughuli chache na kijana wako!

SourceText:
Itâ€™s not always easy to find things to do with your teen.

Try dancing to your teenâ€™s music or having a simple check-in chat, like asking, â€œWhat made you happy today?â€ or â€œHow can I help you?â€

Jaribu kucheza muziki anaocheza kijana wako au kumuuliza kitu kama vile, "Ni nini kilikufurahisha leo?" au â€œNaweza kukusaidiaje?â€

SourceText: Spending fun, relaxed time with your teen helps them learn important life skills - and it strengthens your bond. Even small changes, like listening more and playing together, can make a big difference.

We play games, we sing together and other stuffâ€¦ She takes time to listen before jumping to conclusions, like she listens and then she calms down and takes her time to explain, and then be like â€œwhat you did is not goodâ€ and such.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about family budgets.

Many families are stressed about money, especially if teens keep asking for things!

When we make a budget together, we can agree how to spend AND save to prevent stress and work towards our familyâ€™s goals.
text:
Mada ya leo inahusu bajeti za familia.

Familia nyingi hufadhaika kuhusu pesa, hasa ikiwa vijana wanaendelea kuomba vitu!

Tunapopanga bajeti pamoja, tunaweza kukubaliana jinsi ya kutumia na kuweka akiba ili kuzuia mfadhaiko na kufanyia kazi malengo ya familia yetu.

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is family budgeting.

It is important to create a budget, but it is even more important to create a budget involving the entire family.

Doing it together helps increase the level of understanding of how you spend money as a family and how much you save for the family and you can even come up with plans of how you can save as a family.
text:
Habari, zenu.

Mada ya leo ni kuhusu bajeti za familia.

Ni muhimu kupanga bajeti, lakini ni muhimu zaidi kupanga bajeti inayohusisha familia nzima.

Kufanya hivyo pamoja kunasaidia kuongeza kiwango cha uelewa wa jinsi mnavyotumia pesa kama familia na kiasi gani mnaweka akiba kwa ajili ya familia na mnaweza hata kupanga mipango ya jinsi mnavyoweza kuweka akiba mkiwa kama familia.

SourceText: When we involve our teens in budgeting, they learn to be responsible with money and work towards goals. That is something we all want for our teens, right?
text: Tunapowashirikisha vijana wetu katika kupanga bajeti, wanajifunza kuwajibika na pesa na kufanya kazi kwa malengo. Hilo ni jambo ambalo sote tunataka kwa vijana wetu, sivyo?

SourceText:
**There are four steps for doing a family budget:**

ğŸ’­ Step 1: THINK 
ğŸ¯ Step 2: CHOOSE 
âš’ï¸  Step 3: BUILD 
ğŸ“‹ Step 4: PLAN
text:
**Kuna hatua nne za kupanga bajeti ya familia:**

ğŸ’­ Hatua 1: FIKIRIA
ğŸ¯ Hatua 2: CHAGUA
âš’ï¸  Hatua 3: JENGA
ğŸ“‹ Hatua 4: PANGA

SourceText: Can you complete these steps together with your family now?
text: Unaweza kukamilisha hatua hizi pamoja na familia yako sasa?

SourceText: My family can join in now
text: Familia yangu inaweza kujiunga sasa

SourceText: Let me try it out by myself
text: Ngoja niijaribu peke yangu

SourceText:
You need:

- ğŸ““Papers (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and pens
- ğŸ«˜ Stones or beans or anything with lots of bits to represent money

Take a minute to get these things before we start with the first step.
text:
Unahitaji:

- ğŸ““ Karatasi (au gazeti la zamani au kasha la karatasi nene) na kalamu
- ğŸ«˜ Hindi au maharage au kitu chochote chenye chembechembe nyingi kitakachowakilisha pesa

Tumia dakika moja kutafuta vitu hivyo kabla hatujaanza hatua ya kwanza.

SourceText:
**Step 1: THINK**
Think about what you spend money on each month.
text:
**Hatua ya 1: FIKIRI**
Fikiria juu ya kile unachotumia pesa kila mwezi.

SourceText:
- Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
- Write next to each picture how much each thing costs each month (there is no need to share the numbers if you donâ€™t want to).
- Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text:
- Chora picha za vitu vyote ambavyo wewe na familia yako mnatumia pesa kila mwezi.
- Andika karibu na kila picha ni kiasi gani kila kitu kinagharimu kila mwezi (hakuna haja ya kushirikisha namba ikiwa hutaki).
- Ongeza kiasi cha pesa unachopaswa kutumia kila mwezi.

SourceText:
**Step 2: CHOOSE**
Think about your needs and wants.
- WANT is something you can live without. 
- NEED is something you cannot live without.
text:
**Hatua ya 2: CHAGUA**
Fikiria juu ya mahitaji na matakwa yako.
- KUTAKA ni kitu ambacho unaweza kuishi bila kuwa nacho. 
- UHITAJI ni kitu ambacho huwezi kuishi bila kuwa nacho.

SourceText:
Look at your list of things you spend money on and choose:

- Which are NEEDS that you cannot live without? Why?
- Which are WANTS which are nice to have but not essential? Why?
- Which things could you try to spend less money on?
text:
Angalia orodha yako ya vitu unavyotumia pesa na uchague:

- Je, ni MAHITAJI gani ambayo huwezi kuishi bila kuwa nayo? Kwa nini?
- Je, ni MATAMANIO yapi ambayo ni mazuri kuwa nayo lakini sio muhimu? Kwa nini?
- Ni mambo gani unaweza kujaribu kutumia pesa kidogo?

SourceText:
**Step 3: BUILD**
Make a budget!
text:
**Hatua ya 3: JENGA**
Tengeneza bajeti!

SourceText:
- Write down what your income is for the month.
- Take some stones or beans or anything with lots of bits - this is your income for the month. For example: If your income is TSh2000 and you have 20 beans, each bean is TSh100.
- Decide what you will spend on, and put the stones/objects on that image.

Not sure about your decisions? Having trouble deciding between "needs" and "wants"? Thatâ€™s totally fine! This exercise will get easier with practice.
text:
- Andika mapato yako kwa mwezi.
- Chukua mawe au maharagwe au kitu chochote chenye punje nyingi - haya ni mapato yako ya mwezi. Kwa mfano: Ikiwa mapato yako ni TSh2000 na una maharage 20, kila maharagwe ni TSh100.
- Amua utatumia nini, na uweke mawe/vitu kwenye picha hiyo.

Je, hauna uhakika na maamuzi yako? Je, unapata shida kuamua kati ya "mahitaji" na "matamanio"? Hiyo ni sawa kabisa! Zoezi hili litakuwa rahisi kwa kufanya mazoezi.

SourceText:
**Step 4: PLAN**
Plan how you can save money, so you can deal with emergencies and realise your family goals!
text:
**Hatua ya 4: PANGA**
Panga jinsi unavyoweza kuokoa pesa, ili uweze kukabiliana na dharura na kutambua malengo ya familia yako!

SourceText:
If you can save even a tiny amount for the future or emergencies, it can make a big difference over time.

- Add a circle called â€œemergenciesâ€.
- Add a circle called â€œfamily goalsâ€.
- Now try to move your money around so you can save a bit every month for goals and emergencies.
text:
Ikiwa unaweza kutunza hata kiasi kidogo kwa siku zijazo au dharura - inaweza kuleta mabadiliko makubwa baada ya muda.

- Ongeza mduara unaoitwa "dharura".
- Ongeza mduara unaoitwa "malengo ya familia".
- Sasa jaribu kusogeza pesa zako ili uweze kuweka akiba kila mwezi kwa malengo na dharura.

SourceText: *(A few years later)*
text: *(Miaka michache baadae)*

SourceText:
Having a savings plan could have helped @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name to be prepared for this kind of emergency! 

There are different ways we can save: at home, by buying things we can sell for profit, at a bank, or in a stokvel.

Think of the advantages and disadvantages of each savings option.
text:
Kuwa na mpango wa kuweka akiba kungemsaidia @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name kuwa tayari kwa aina hii ya dharura.

Kuna njia tofauti tunaweza kuweka akiba: nyumbani, kwa kununua vitu tunaweza kuuza kwa faida, katika benki, au vikundi vya akiba.

Fikiria faida na hasara za kila chaguo la kuweka akiba.

SourceText:
When we involve teens in budgeting, they learn important life skills, like understanding the difference between needs and wants.

Making a budget together also helps teens see that we all need to make hard choices sometimes, but that it helps us to have enough money at the end of the month - and to realise our goals!
text:
Tunapohusisha vijana katika kupanga bajeti, wanajifunza stadi muhimu za maisha, kama vile kuelewa tofauti kati ya mahitaji na matamanio!

Kutengeneza bajeti pamoja pia huwasaidia vijana kuona kwamba sote tunahitaji kufanya maamuzi magumu wakati mwingine, lakini hutusaidia kuwa na pesa za kutosha mwishoni mwa mwezi - na kutimiza malengo yetu!

SourceText: Can creating family budgets help your family? Tap play to learn more
text: Je, kuunda bajeti za familia kunaweza kusaidia familia yako? Gusa cheza ili upate maelezo zaidi

SourceText:
I used to ask my mom to buy me nice clothes all the time. Each time, she would say â€œI do not have money,â€ but I knew that she was getting money from my uncle. I did not understand why she refused to buy me clothes. I thought at some point â€œshe does not love me.â€

But one day, she called me to sit down with her and asked â€œwhat are the needs and wants in our house.â€ I started to list all my needs and wants. Then my mother helped me to also think about the family needs. Now I understand where our money is going, towards the things we need as a family.

From that day, I understand I cannot come in and ask any time. Now, when I want something, I wait till the month-end when we all discuss the budget together to see if it fits. We understand each other better now.
text:
Nilikuwa nikimwomba mama yangu aninunulie nguo nzuri kila wakati. Kila mara, alikuwa akisema â€œSina pesa,â€ lakini nilijua kwamba alikuwa akipata pesa kutoka kwa mjomba wangu. Sikuelewa kwanini alikataa kuninunulia nguo. Nilifikiri wakati fulani â€œhanipendi.â€

Lakini siku moja, aliniita niketi naye na kuniuliza â€œni mahitaji gani na matakwa gani katika nyumba yetu.â€ Nilianza kuorodhesha mahitaji na matakwa yangu yote. Kisha mama yangu akanisaidia pia kufikiria kuhusu mahitaji ya familia. Sasa ninaelewa pesa zetu zinaenda wapi, kuelekea vitu tunavyohitaji kama familia.

Kuanzia siku hiyo, naelewa siwezi kuja na kuuliza wakati wowote. Sasa, ninapotaka kitu, nasubiri hadi mwisho wa mwezi tutakapojadili bajeti pamoja ili kuona kama inafaa. Tunaelewana vizuri zaidi sasa.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about spending one-on-one time with our teens. 

Being a parent can be so hard. Sometimes it feels like our teens never listen to us.

But science shows that spending just a few minutes each day of focused one-on-one time with your teen helps build trust and love.
text:
Mada ya leo inahusu kutumia muda wa pamoja wawili na vijana wetu.

Kuwa mzazi kunaweza kuwa kugumu sana. Wakati mwingine inaonekana kama vijana wetu hawatusikilizi kabisa.

Lakini sayansi inaonyesha kwamba kutumia dakika chache tu kila siku za muda wa pekee na kijana wako kunasaidia kujenga uaminifu na upendo.

SourceText: Why is spending one-on-one time with your teens important? Tap play to learn
text: Kwa nini kutumia muda wa pamoja wawili na kijana wako ni muhimu? Gusa cheza ili kujifunza

SourceText:
Hello.

Our topic today is one-on-one time with our children.

It is important to spend time with our children so that they can get to understand us, and for us to get an opportunity to understand them.

Remember, a family with good understanding lives in harmony.
text:
Habari!

Mada yetu ya leo inahusu kuzungumza na watoto wetu mkiwa wawili.

Ni muhimu kutumia muda tukiwa na watoto wetu ili waweze kutuelewa, na sisi kupata fursa ya kuwaelewa.

Kumbuka, familia inayoelewana vizuri huishi kwa utulivu.

SourceText:
Let's discuss, what is one-on-one time?

One-on-one time is when you focus on your teens, without distractions like TVs or phones. Let your teens take the lead in choosing what you do or talk about.

It is great if you can spend fifteen minutes a day together, but even five minutes a day is really good.
text:
Ngoja tujadili, nini maana ya kutumia muda wa pamoja?

Kutumia muda wa pamoja ni pale wakati unayowazingatia vijana wako, bila usumbufu kama televisheni au simu. Waachie vijana wako kuongoza katika kuchagua kile mnachofanya au kuzungumzia.

Ni jambo zuri kama unaweza kutumia dakika 15 kwa siku pamoja kijana, lakini hata dakika 5 kwa siku pia ni vizuri sana.

SourceText: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_1.name and her teen
text: Sikia jinsi gani kutumia muda wa pamoja kulivyomsaidia @data.characters.media_female_1.name na kijana wake
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When I first heard I had to spend One-on-One Time with my teen, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my teen so that he thinks we have to do everything together.

But I really wanted to build my relationship with my teen and I wanted him to open up about what was troubling him. So we tried the One-on-One Time.

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we watch his TV programme together and we chat about it. And we can even talk about how my son is changing into adolescence and even about girlfriends and those things!
text:
Wakati niliposikia kwa mara ya kwanza kuwa ni lazima nitumie muda wa pamoja na kijana wangu, ilikuwa ngumu kwangu. Sikujuwa ni lini nifanye hivyo au niseme nini. Sikutaka kumzoesha kijana wangu hadi afikirie kuwa tunapaswa kufanya kila kitu pamoja.

Lakini nilitaka sana kujenga uhusiano wangu na kijana wangu na nilitaka afunguke kuhusu kile kinachomsumbua. Kwa hiyo tulijaribu kuwa na muda wa pamoja wawili.

Mwanzo, lilihisi kuwa ni jambo la ajabu, lakini baadaye likawa la kufurahisha! Sasa tunaangalia kipindi chake cha runinga pamoja na tunazungumza kuhusu hilo. Na hata tunaweza kuzungumza kuhusu jinsi mwanangu anavyobadilika kuwa katika umri wa ujana, hata kuhusu wasichana na mambo kama hayo!

SourceText: Here are some skills to help guide you in spending one-on-one time with your teen!
text: Hapa kuna baadhi ya ujuzi wa kukusaidia katika wakati wa pamoja na kijana wako!

SourceText:
Let your teen choose.

Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. They might think this is weird at first, but they will come to enjoy this time with you!
text:
Muache kijana wako achague.

Mwambie kijana wako kwamba ungependa kutumia muda pamoja naye na kwamba anaweza kuchagua cha kufanya au cha kuzungumzia. Mwanzoni, anaweza kuona kuwa hili ni jambo la ajabu, lakini baadaye atafurahia muda huu wa kuwa na wewe!

SourceText: STAY
text: KAA

SourceText:
Focus on your teen.

Switch off the TV and put phones aside. Look at your teen. Nod or say â€œI seeâ€ to show that you are really paying attention. Accept what they say without judging them.
text:
Weka umakini kwa kijana wako.

Zima runinga na weka simu kando. Mtazame kijana wako. Fanya ishara kwa kichwa au sema "ndiyo" ili kuonyesha kuwa unampa mkazo. Kubali anachosema bila kumhukumu.

SourceText: Spending one-on-one time with your teen can be hard to plan. Here are some easy ideas that worked for other parents.

**Ideas for one-on-one time with your teen:**

- Do a chore together

- Eat breakfast/lunch/dinner
- Have tea after school
- Watch a TV show
- Review homework
- Chat before bedtime

SourceText: Here's what @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name has to say about one-on-one time with her mother

SourceText:
When my mother asked to spend time with me, I thought â€œMaybe something is wrong, maybe she is sick.â€ But she said â€œNo, I just want to spend time.â€ I was sceptical, but I accepted.

She asked me what I like doing. It was strange and I was not comfortable, because she never ever spent time with me on my own.

The more she kept on trying and we spent this time together, it felt really nice. She got to share her own childhood with me, things I never heard before. That helped me to also share what is going on in my life. We even talk about boyfriends and about problems I have. I know I can talk to my mother now.
text:
Mama yangu alipoomba kukaa nami, nilifikiri â€œLabda kuna tatizo, labda ni mgonjwa.â€ Lakini alisema, "Hapana, nataka tu kakaa nami." Nilikuwa na shaka, lakini nilikubali.

Aliniuliza ninapenda kufanya nini. Ilikuwa ya kushangaza na sikuwa na raha, kwa sababu hakuwahi kutumia wakati na mimi peke yangu.

Kadiri alivyozidi kujaribu na kuwa na wakati huu pamoja, nilijisikia vizuri sana. Alnishirikisha maisha yake ya utotoni, mambo ambayo sikuwahi kuyasikia hapo awali. Hilo lilinisaidia pia kushiriki kile kinachoendelea katika maisha yangu. Tunazungumza hata juu ya wapenzi na shida nilizonazo. Najua naweza kuzungumza na mama yangu sasa.

SourceText:
Today's topic is about praise.

Praise is a powerful parenting skill.

If we praise our teens when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!

Greetings everyone.

Our topic today is about praise.

It is good to praise our children when they've done good because when we do that, they will do more of that good behavior we want to see.

And let's not forget to praise ourselves when we do good!
text:

Na tusisahau pia kujisifia sisi wenyewe tunapofanya mazuri!

SourceText:
When we learnt about this praising thing I thought, â€œWe were never praised for things as teenagers, so why should we start now?â€ But I got interested when I learnt what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after the weekly workshop, I noticed my teen doing what they do every day: washing the dishes. And I said â€œThank you for washing the dishes, my girl, it really makes me happy that you are helping out.â€ My teen was smiling and she even came to give me a hug, which she never does.

This praising business is hard. I still forget sometimes or give praise at the same time as criticism. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!
text:
Tulipojifunza kuhusu jambo hili la kusifu nilifikiri, â€œHatukusifiwa kamwe kwa mambo tukiwa vijana, kwa hivyo kwa nini tuanze sasa?â€ Lakini nilipendezwa nilipojifunza faida za kusifu zingeweza kuwa nini.

Mara tu baada ya warsha ya kila wiki, niliona kijana wangu akifanya kile anachofanya kila siku: kuosha vyombo. Na nikasema, "Asante kwa kuosha vyombo, msichana wangu, inanifurahisha sana kwamba unasaidia." Kijana wangu alikuwa akitabasamu na hata alikuja kunikumbatia, jambo ambalo huwa hafanyi.

Biashara hii ya kusifu ni ngumu. Bado ninasahau wakati mwingine au kutoa sifa wakati huo huo kama ukosoaji. Lakini kusifu kunafanya tofauti. Sikuwahi kufikiria kwamba sifa rahisi inaweza kufanya mabadiliko hayo kwa mtu!

SourceText:
Today's topic is about problem solving.

text:
Maada ya leo ni kuhusu kutatua matatizo.

SourceText: How can problem solving help you and your family?
text: Je kutatua matatizo kunaweza kukusaidia wewe na familia yako?

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is problem solving.

We all know that in life there are times where we face problems, and we all know in a way that when we find ourselves in these situations, it is difficult to think of immediate positive solutions.

Therefore, it is important that when we are facing problems we take a pause, we breathe, keep calm and think of problem-solving skills that we may use.

Remember to include our teenagers when we are solving problems. This will help them to become responsible and learn how to solve their own problems in the future.
text:
Habari zenu.

Maada ya leo inahusu utatuzi wa matatizo.

Sote tunajua kuwa katika maisha kuna nyakati tunakabiliwa na matatizo, na sote tunajua kwa namna fulani kwamba tunapojikuta katika nyakati hizo, ni vigumu kufikiria haraka ufumbuzi chanya.

Kwa hiyo, tunapokabiliwa na matatizo ni muhimu tupumzike, tupumuwe, tutulie na tufikirie ujuzi wa kutatua matatizo tunaoweza kutumia.

Tunapotatua matatizo tukumbuke kuwashirikisha vijana wetu. Kufanya hivyo kutawasaidia kuwajibika na kujifunza jinsi ya kutatua matatizo yao wenyewe siku zijazo.

As parents, we sometimes think we need to fix every problem by ourselves. And teens can think the same! 

By involving your teen, you strengthen your relationship as well as their confidence. Together you can overcome anything.

SourceText:
When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame. But what our teens really need is someone to help find solutions together. 

Listen to them, accept how they see and feel things, and thank them for trusting you.

Teaching your teen how to deal with problems will help them for the rest of their lives. What a gift!

Wasikilize, kubaliana na namna wanavyo ona na kuhisi vitu, na washukuru kwa kukuamini.

Kuwafundisha vijana wako namna ya kushughulikia matatizo itawasaidia wao maisha yao yote. Ni zawadi ya kipekee!

SourceText:

- My teenager is lazy
- My teenager is not doing their school work

SourceText:
When my father introduced the problem-solving steps to me, it helped me with my family, but it also helped me with my friends.

I told my friends about the steps, and now when we are arguing we sit down and everyone comes up with solutions. We then look for the negatives and positives of each solution, and we agree â€œokay letâ€™s try this one.â€

My friends even took it to their own homes, and it is helping with their families as well!

It is great when others listen to you and accept your ideas even though you are young. We can all bring that harmony with our friends and family.
text:
Pindi baba yangu aliponitambulisha hatua za kutatua tatizo, ilinisaidia mimi, familia yangu lakini pia iliwasaidia marafiki zangu.

Niliwaambia marafiki zangu kuhusu hatua hizo, na sasa wakati tunapobishana, tunakaa chini na kila mmoja anakuja na suluhisho. Kisha tunaangalia madhara hasi na chanya ya kila suluhisho na tunakubaliana ''sawa ngoja tujaribu hii moja.''

Marafiki zangu huchukuwa na kupeleka nyumbani kwao, na inawasaidia wao na familia zao pia!

Ni furaha pindi ambapo wengine wanakusikiliza na kukubaliana na mawazo yako hata kama wewe ni mdogo. Sote tunaweza kuleta maelewano na marafiki na familia.

SourceText:

Good decisions come from thinking through the consequences. Talk openly with your teen when thereâ€™s a problem. Listen to each other and find solutions together.

Each challenge is an opportunity to teach your teen that actions have consequencesâ€”and you can handle them as a team.

Remember to praise each other for working through tough situations together.

How can I help prevent my teen from having sex too young?
Try selecting each option for more tips!

SourceText:
Thatâ€™s not quite right.

Teens hear many things about sexâ€”from school, friends, or social media. Some of it is wrong.

Knowing about sex doesnâ€™t mean they are having sex. Good information helps them stay safe and understand why waiting to have sex can be a good choice.

Without this knowledge, they may face problems, like not knowing how pregnancy happens or the risks of sex.

Kujua kuhusu ngono haimaanishi kwamba wanafanya ngono. Taarifa sahihi huwasaidia kuwa salama na kuelewa kwa nini kusubiri kabla ya kufanya ngono kunaweza kuwa uamuzi mzuri.

bila maarifa, wanaweza kukumbana na matatizo, kama kutokujua kwa namna gani mimba inatokea au hatari vya ngono.

Thatâ€™s right.

Teens are figuring out who they are. They look to friends and media for answers, and may feel pressure to do things theyâ€™re not ready for.

Talk calmly with your teen about waiting to have sex until they feel ready, are in a safe relationship, and understand the consequences. Focus on guiding them calmly to make healthy choices.

SourceText: Why is teen safety important for you and your family?
text: Kwanini usalama wa vijana ni muhimu kwako na familia yako?

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today our topic is teen safety.

It is our responsibility as parents to keep our teens safe at all times. We need to ensure that our teenagers are safe in the communities that we live in. It is our responsibility that we make them aware of the safe and unsafe areas in the communities.

It is also our responsibility to ensure that they understand the dangers that they might be exposed to when they are online. That way our teenagers will be responsible and be able to make right decisions to keep themselves safe too.
text:
Habarini, wote.

Mada yetu ni usalama wa vijana.

Ni jukumu letu kama wazazi kuhakikisha kuwa vijana wetu wako salama wakati wote. Tunahitaji kuhakikisha kwamba vijana wetu wako salama katika jamii tunazoishi. Ni jukumu letu kuwafanya watambue maeneo salama na yasiyo salama katika jamii.

Ni jukumu letu pia kuhakikisha kuwa wanaelewa hatari wanazoweza kukumbana nazo wanapokuwa mtandaoni. Kwa njia hiyo, vijana wetu watakuwa na uwajibikaji na wataweza kufanya maamuzi sahihi ya kujilinda wao wenyewe.

I was so grateful to make the safety plan with my teen. I thought I knew which areas are safe for my teen and which are not. But when we made the safety plan together, I realised that my girl knew more areas that I was not aware of.

I also thought she was safe at school, but through this activity I realised she was being bullied and the teachers did not do anything about it.

The more we talked, the more I understood and got information from my teen. That really helped me to protect my teen and keep her safe.

SourceText: What do you think is the biggest online risk for teens these days?
text: Unadhani ni hatari gani kubwa zaidi mtandaoni kwa vijana siku hizi?

SourceText: Adults use social media, gaming and messaging apps and websites to meet teenagers and pressure them to do sexual things
text: Watu wazima hutumia mitandao ya kijamii, michezo ya mtandaoni, na programu za ujumbe pamoja na tovuti kukutana na vijana na kuwashinikiza kufanya mambo ya ngono

SourceText: Yes, this is a serious risk. Some adults may act friendly online but try to trick or pressure teens. Talking openly can help keep your teen safe.
text: Ndiyo, hii ni hatari kubwa sana. Watu wazima wengine wanaweza kuonyesha urafiki mtandaoni lakini wanajaribu kudanganya au kuwatia shinikizo vijana. Kuzungumza kwa uwazi kunaweza kusaidia kumlinda kijana wako.

SourceText: People post things online to make us hurt other people - like making violence seem cool or spreading hate towards certain races or countries
text: Watu huweka vitu mtandaoni ili kutufanya tuumize watu wengine â€“ kama kufanya ukatili kuwa jambo la kuvutia au kueneza chuki dhidi ya rangi fulani au nchi nyingine

SourceText: Yes, this is a real concern. Some people spread hate or make violence seem normal. Helping your teen think about what they see online can protect them.
text: Ndiyo, hili ni jambo la kweli la wasiwasi. Watu wengine hueneza chuki au kufanya ukatili kama jambo la kawaida. Kumsaidia kijana wako kufikiria kuhusu wanachoona mtandaoni kunaweza kumlinda.

SourceText: People put things online to convince teenagers to hurt themselves or take their own lives
text: Watu huweka vitu mtandaoni kuwahamasisha vijana kujiua au kujihatarisha kwa kuumiza nafsi zao

SourceText: Yes, sadly this does happen. Some online spaces can make teens feel hopeless or alone. Checking in often can help keep your teen safe.
text: Ndiyo, kwa bahati mbaya hili hufanyika. Baadhi ya maeneo mtandaoni yanaweza kufanya vijana wajisikie kukata tamaa au upweke. Kuangalia mara kwa mara kunaweza kusaidia kumlinda kijana wako.

SourceText: Teenagers share sexy photos, videos or information about themselves, and others use it to embarrass or threaten them
text: Vijana hutuma picha za kingono, video au taarifa zao binafsi, na wengine hutumia hizo kuwaaibisha au kuwatishia

SourceText: Yes, this is a real danger. Once something is shared, it can be spread or used to hurt them. Teaching your teen to pause and think before sharing can make a big difference.
text: Ndiyo, hii ni hatari kubwa. Mara tu kitu kinapotumwa kwa wengine, kinaweza kusambazwa au kutumiwa kuwadhuru. Kumfundisha kijana wako kusimama kidogo na kufikiria kabla ya kutuma kwa watu wengine kunaweza kufanya tofauti kubwa.

SourceText: People can often be nasty to teenagers online - they feel like they can bully people safely

SourceText: Yes, online bullying happens a lot because people feel braver behind a screen. Talking about kindness and bullying can help your teen feel supported and know what to do.
text: Ndiyo, unyanyasaji mtandaoni hutokea sana kwa sababu watu huhisi ujasiri zaidi wakiwa hawaonekani moja kwa moja. Kuzungumza kuhusu utu na unyanyasaji kunaweza kumsaidia kijana wako ajisikie kuwa na msaada na ajue cha kufanya.

SourceText: I am scared. Everyone is too drunk to drive me home. This guy says he will take me, but he wants us to go to his house first. I canâ€™t tell my parents â€“ I lied about coming to this party.

SourceText:
I care about your safety more than anything. If you are ever upset, or scared, you can always call me for help, or tell me about it.

Shall we use an imaginary â€˜Aunty Ceciliaâ€™ as our Safety Word? Just say something about Aunty Cecilia, I promise that I will try my best to help and I will not be angry â€“ even if you are doing something you shouldn't be doing.

Je tuunaweza kutumia jambo la kufikirika â€˜Shangazi Ceciliaâ€™ kama Neno letu la Usalama? Sema tu kitu kuhusu Shangazi Cecilia, ninaahidi kwamba nitajaribu niwezavyo kusaidia na sitakasirika - hata kama unafanya jambo ambalo hupaswi kufanya.

SourceText: Step 1: Draw all the important places in your community.

SourceText: Here are some skills to help you keep your teen safe!
text: Hapa kuna baadhi ya ujuzi utakao kusaidia kumlinda kijana wako salama!

SourceText: MAPS
text: RAMANI

SourceText: Make maps with your teen of safe and unsafe areas in your community and online. Talk about how to keep their information, photos and videos private online. Talk about how once something goes online, it stays there forever. They might know an example from their friends.
text: Tengeneza ramani na kijana wako juu ya maeneo salama na yasiyo salama kwenye jamii yenu na mtandaoni. Zungumzieni jinsi ya kuweka taarifa zao, picha na video zake ziwe za faragha mtandaoni. Zungumzieni jinsi ambavyo kitu kikishawekwa mtandaoni, kitakaa hapo daima. Wanaweza kujua mfano kutoka kwa marafiki zao.

SourceText: RULES
text: SHERIA

SourceText: Make rules with your teen about how they can stay safe in your community (especially in risky areas that cannot be avoided), and how they can safely use the apps and websites that they like.
text: Tengeneza sheria na kijana wako kuhusu jinsi ya kujilinda katika jamii yenu (hasa katika maeneo hatari ambayo hayaepukiki), na jinsi wanavyoweza kutumia kwa usalama programu na tovuti wanazozipenda.

SourceText: SAFETY WORD
text: NENO LA USALAMA

SourceText: Agree on a Safety Word. If something happens that makes your teen upset, uncomfortable or scared, they can say the Safety Word and you will help them without getting angry or punishing them, even if they were doing something wrong.
text: Kukubaliana juu ya Neno la Usalama. Ikiwa kutatokea jambo lolote litakalomfanya kijana wako kuhisi huzuni, wasiwasi au hofu, anaweza kusema Neno la Usalama na utamsaidia bila kuchukizwa au kumwadhibu, hata kama alikuwa anafanya kitu kisicho sahihi.

SourceText: That's okay. It can feel hard at first, but small talks about safety make a big difference. Try again when you feel ready.
