SourceText: When teens know they can turn to us without fear, they are more likely to ask for help when something feels unsafe - both offline and online. Talking calmly and making safety plans together builds trust that lasts.
text: Wakati vijana wanapojua kuwa wanaweza kutukaribia bila hofu, wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kuomba msaada wanapohisi kuwa kuna jambo lisilo salama â€“ iwe mtandaoni au nje ya mtandao. Kuzungumza kwa utulivu na kupanga mipango ya usalama pamoja kunajenga uaminifu wa kudumu.

SourceText: Safety planning helped @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name open up. Hear her story
text: Kupanga juu ya usalama ilimsaidia @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name kuwa muwazi. Sikiliza hadithi yake
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_7.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
When my friends or I got into trouble, I would always try to hide it from my mother because she would get so angry and shout at me.

When we made the map of safe and unsafe places, I learnt a lot â€“ also why it is dangerous to share every picture online. My mother told me I can always ask her if there is a problem and she promised she would not get mad.

She kept her promise, so now if I have a problem or I do not feel safe I know we can always come up with a solution together. I can even talk to my mother about the things I do online now!
text:
Wakati mimi au marafiki zangu tulipopata matatizo, nilikuwa najaribu kumficha mama yangu kwa sababu alikuwa akikasirika sana na kunifokea.

Tulipotengeneza ramani ya maeneo salama na yasiyo salama, nilijifunza mambo mengi â€“ pia kwa nini ni hatari kushiriki kila picha mtandaoni. Mama yangu aliniambia kuwa naweza kumuuliza kila mara kunapokuwa na tatizo na akaahidi hatakasirika.

Aliweka ahadi yake, hivyo sasa nikiwa na tatizo au nikihisi kutokuwa salama, najua tunaweza kutafuta suluhisho pamoja. Hata pia ninaweza kuzungumza na mama yangu kuhusu mambo ninayofanya mtandaoni sasa!

SourceText:
Today's topic is about taking care of yourself.

Taking time for yourself helps you stay calm and strong.
text:
Mada ya leo ni kuhusu kujijali wewe mwenyewe.

Kutenga muda kwa ajili yako mwenyewe kunakusaidia kubaki mtulivu na mwenye nguvu.

SourceText: How will caring for yourself help you and your family? Listen to find out
text: Vipi kujitunza kutakusaidia wewe na familia yako? Sikiliza ujue

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is self-care.

There are times when we experience challenges, face problems and do not know what to do. It is important to take care of ourselves to learn the techniques for keeping ourselves calm, in case problems, challenges or issues come up.

When we are calm we are in a good state to think positively and come up with positive solutions to any challenges we may be facing.
text:
Habari zenu?

Mada ya leo inahusu kujithamini wenyewe.

Kuna nyakati tunapata changamoto, tunakabiliwa na matatizo na hatujui cha kufanya. Ni muhimu kujithamini kwa kujifunza mbinu tunazoweza kuzitumia kuwa watulivu iwapo matatizo, changamoto au shida zitatokea.

Tunapokuwa watulivu, tunakuwa katika hali nzuri ya kufikiria vizuri na kupata ufumbuzi chanya wa changamoto zozote tunazoweza kukabiliwa nazo.

SourceText:
Why self-care?

We often donâ€™t look after ourselves enough. But this is so important, especially as a parent!

Reducing our stress and treating ourselves well helps us AND our teenagers.
text:
Kwa nini kujitunza?

Mara nyingi hatujali vya kutosha kuhusu sisi wenyewe. Lakini hili ni jambo la muhimu sana, hasa kama mzazi!

Kupunguza msongo wa mawazo na kujitendea vema kunatusaidia sisi pamoja NA vijana wetu pia.

SourceText: Self care works! Hear @data.characters.media_female_14.nameâ€™s story

SourceText:
For me as a parent, it was almost impossible to find time for myself. I was always busy taking care of everyone else. Through @global.app_name, I realised how important it is to take care of myself. It helps me AND my family!

Having a moment for myself helps me to breathe and notice how I feel. Even 5 minutes to have a cup of tea makes a big difference. Now I can deal with my stress better.
text:
Kwangu mimi kama mzazi ilikua karibu haiwezekani kupata muda kwa ajili yangu mimi mwenyewe. nilikua na shughuli nyingi za kuwatunza wengine kila wakati kupitia @global.app_name niligundua jinsi ilivyomuhimu kujitunza. Huwa inasaidia mimi NA familia yangu pia!

Kupata muda kidogo kwa ajili yangu hunisaidia kupumua na kutambua jinsi ninavyohisi.hata dakika 5 za kunywa chai hufanya tofauti kubwa. Sasa ninaweza kukabiliana na msongo wa mawazo vyema.

SourceText:
Taking a small break can help you feel calm and strong. But finding time is hard when you have many responsibilities.

Support from other adults can make it easier.

kuchukua mapumziko madogo kunaweza kukusaidia kujisikia mtulivu na mwenye nguvu . lakini kupata muda ni ngumu unapo kuwa na majukumu mengi.

SourceText:
Sometimes getting a small break means someone else helps you.
Who can you ask to help you get a short break when you need it?

SourceText: Nice! Taking care of yourself is an important parenting skill!

SourceText: Here are some tips to help you take care of yourself.

SourceText: RELAX

SourceText: Do a 30 second quick relaxation activity.

SourceText:
Take a moment now to relax. Breathe in slowly as you count to three... and breathe out as you count to three. Feel your body relax with each breath. 

Try this whenever you are feeling stressed and need a break. A few calm breaths can make a big difference.

It could be showing love to your children, helping them with schoolwork, or preparing a meal even when you felt tired. 

Every small effort you make matters, and you get to celebrate yourself.

SourceText: You can take care of yourself better when people help you â€” a caregiver, friend, neighbour, or family member. When we help each other take small breaks, self-care becomes easier.

When caregivers support one another, teens see that caring for yourself and others is a normal part of family life.

My dad was always busy. He would come home from work and snap at us when we started asking him questions.

@global.app_name helped us a lot. We no longer fight. Now, when my dad comes home, he first sits down by himself for 5 minutes and then we do a relaxing activity from @global.app_name together, so we can all take a deep breath and relax. Then we can chat about our day, about anything good or bad that happened. Everyone is so much happier now.

SourceText:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the â€œSupport Contactsâ€ section in your Library for help.
text:
Mada hii ina maudhui ambayo ni nyeti. Unaweza kuangalia mwenyewe. Hii itakuandaa vizuri ili kushirikisha maudhui na kijana wako na wengine hapo baadae.

Ukihitaji msaada, angalia ''Namba za msaada'' kwenye sehemu ya maktaba upate msaada.

SourceText:
Todayâ€™s topic is body changes and intimate relationships.

Teens go through many changes in their bodies and feelings. Talking to them helps them handle it better.

Let your teen know youâ€™re there to listen and support them. You donâ€™t need all the answersâ€”just being there helps them feel safe and make good choices.
text:
Mada ya leo inahusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi.

Vijana hupitia mabadiliko mengi katika miili yaona hisia. Kwa kuzungumza nao unaweza kuwasaidia kushughulikia mabadiliko haya pia.

Mwambie kijana wako kwamba upo kumsikiliza na kumpa msaada. Hauhitaji kujibu maswali yote â€” uwepo wako unasaidia ajisikie salama na kufanya machaguo mazuri.

SourceText:
**Think back to your own teenage years:**

- Did you face any challenges with body changes or relationships?
- What support or advice do you wish you had?
- Do you think your teen might be going through something similar?
text:
**Fikiria miaka yako ya ujana:**

- Je, umewahi kupata changamoto kutokana na mabadiliko ya mwili au mahusiano?
- Je ni aina gani ya msaada au ushauri unatamani ungepata?
- Je, unafikiri kijana wako anaweza kuwa anapitia jambo linalofanana?

SourceText: Why talk with your teen about body changes and relationships? Tap play to find out
text: Kwanini unazungumza na kijana wako kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano? Bofya kucheza na utambue

SourceText:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is body changes and intimate relationships.

Discussing body and intimate relationships with your child can be difficult. However, it is important to have these discussions in order for your teen to understand that this stage of life is normal. This will help them to acknowledge the changes in their bodies and be able to make positive decisions regarding intimate relationships.
text:
Habari zenu.

Mada ya leo ni mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi.

Kujadili mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi na mtoto wako inaweza kuwa ngumu. Hata hivyo, ni muhimu kuwa na majadiliano haya ili kijana wako aelewe kwamba hatua hii ya maisha ni ya kawaida. Hii itawasaidia kutambua mabadiliko katika miili yao na kuwa na uwezo wa kufanya maamuzi chanya kuhusu mahusiano ya kimapenzi.

SourceText: Even if these conversations feel uncomfortable at first, starting small can build trust. You might be surprised by how much your teen wants to share once they know you are ready to listen without judgment.
text: Hata kama maongezi haya hayana hisia nzuri mwanzoni, kuanza taratibu huleta imani. Unaweza kushangaa kuona kiasi gani kijana wako anataka kukushirikisha endapo watajua upo tayari kusikiliza bila kuhukumu.

SourceText: Hear how @global.app_name helped @data.characters.media_female_10.name talk to her son about relationships
text: Sikia ambavyo @global.app_name imemsaidia @data.characters.media_female_10.name kuzungumza na mtoto wake wa kiume kuhusu mahusiano

SourceText:
Thanks to the app, I can now talk to my son about all these changes that he is going through with his body and emotions and relationships. We were both not comfortable bringing it up before, but the practical examples in the app made it possible for us to start talking. And I was really surprised by how many questions and experiences my son already has, even though he is only 14!

Now he can come to me if there is something happening at school or if he is not sure how to handle something. The other day he even told me that some of his friends were making fun of him because he does not have a girlfriend yet, so we talked about it and I could explain to him that it is important to focus on school first and that it is never okay for someone to pressure him to have a relationship.
text:
Nashukuru kwa programu, sasa ninaweza kuongea na kijana wangu kuhusu mabadiliko haya yote anayokabiliana nayo katika mwili wake, hisia na mahusiano. Wote hatukuwa huru kuzungumzia kabla, lakini mifano halisi katika programu imetufanikisha kuanza kuzungumza. Na nilishangazwa na maswali na uzoefu kijana wangu alionao, japokuwa anamiaka 14 tu!

Sasa anakuja kwangu kama kuna kitu kimetokea shuleni au kama hana uhakika namna ya kukabiliana na jambo. Siku moja aliniambia baadhi ya marafiki zake walikuwa wanamtania kwa sababu hakuwa na rafiki wa kike, hivyo tulizungumza na nilimwelezea kwamba ni muhimu kuweka mkazo shuleni kwanza na kwamba sio sawa kwa mtu kumlazimisha kuwa na mahusiano.

SourceText:
Teens often learn different things about sex from school, friends, family, or social media - but this information isnâ€™t always correct or right for their age.

Talking about sex can feel uncomfortable. Parents and teens may even argue, especially if parents donâ€™t agree with what their teen is doing.

Letâ€™s see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name, handled this.

Mara nyingi vijana wanajifunza vitu tofauti kuhusu ngono kutoka shuleni, marafiki zao, familia, au mitandao ya kijamii - lakini mara zote hizi taarifa siyo sahihi au siyo sawa kwa umri wao.

Kuzungumza kuhusu ngono kunaweza kuwa na hisia mbaya. Wazazi na vijana wanaweza kurumbana, hasa kama wazazi hawakubaliani na kile anachofanya kijana.

Hebu tuangalie namna @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name na mjukuu wake, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name, walivyo shughulikia.

Anaweza kuishia kwenye hali isiyo salama na kuhisi siyo sawa kuzungumza na @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name kuhusu hilo hata kama ana maswali au anahitaji msaada. Anaweza kuwa na wasiwasi kwamba @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name ata hukumu machaguo yake au kuhisi aibu.

We saw how challenging that moment was for @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name.

Letâ€™s look at an example of how this kind of conversation can happen calmly.

(_calmly_) Thank you for sharing this with me, @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name. I know that you like @data.characters.boyfriend_1.name a lot, he is a charming boy and he does great at school, but you are only 16 and he is 18.

I feel worried that it is not safe for you to be alone with him. He might pressure you into doing something that you are not prepared to do.

Nahisi wasiwasi kwamba siyo salama kwako kuwa peke yako na yeye. A naweza kukushinikiza kufanya jambo ambalo hauko tayari kufanya.

Sitaki kukuambia ni nani unayeweza kumuona lakini tunahitaji kuwa na sheria fulani kuhusu jinsi mnavyotumia wakati pamoja.

Many parents want to help their teens but find it difficult to talk about sensitive topics, like body changes and relationships.

Yes, you may need to start the conversation - and itâ€™s okay to feel shy. Be open and use the right words for any body parts you discuss (like breasts, penis, or vagina).

You can practise with a friend and ask a health worker or social worker for more information. The more you know, the better you can help your teen.

And remember, itâ€™s also okay not to know everything. You can say, â€œIâ€™m not sure - let me find out and tell you later.â€
text:
Ndio, unaweza kuhitajia kuanza mazungumzo â€” na ni sawa kujihisi aibu. Kuwa wazi na tumia maneno sahihi unapozungumzia sehemu za mwili (kama matiti, uume, au uke).

Unaweza pia kufanya mazoezi na rafiki na kuuliza mhudumu wa afya au mfanyakazi wa kijamii kwa taarifa zaidi. Kadri unavyojua zaidi, ndivyo utakavyoweza kumsaidia kijana wako vizuri zaidi.

Na kumbuka, pia ni sawa kutokuwa na majibu yote. Unaweza kusema, â€œSijui hakika â€” acha nitafute taarifa na nitakujulisha baadae.â€

Thatâ€™s not quite right.

Teens need to learn about body changes and relationships early, so they are prepared and can make good choices.

If you find out your teen is having sex, try to stay calm and share your worries gently. Getting angry can make it harder for your teen to talk to you.
text:
Hii sio sawa kabisa.

Vijana wanahitaji kujifunza kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano mapema, ili wawe tayari na waweze kufanya maamuzi mazuri.

Kama utagundua kuwa kijana wako amefanya mapenzi, jaribu kubaki mtulivu na kushirikisha wasiwasi wako kwa upole. Kukasirika kunaweza kumfanya kijana wako ashindwe kuzungumza nawe.

SourceText:
Age 10 is when a lot of children start to enter puberty, so they need to already understand how their bodies and feelings may change.

This will also help them cope better with sexual feelings safely.
text:
Umri wa miaka 10 ndiyo wakati watoto wengi huanza kubarehe, hivyo vijana wanapaswa tayari kuelewa jinsi miili yao na hisia zao zinavyoweza kubadilika.

Hii pia itawasaidia kukabiliana vyema na hisia za kingono kwa usalama.

SourceText:

Hii pia itawasaidia kukabiliana vyema na hisia za kingono kwa usalama.

SourceText:
Itâ€™s good to start talking about body changes and relationships early - by gently answering your childâ€™s questions.

You donâ€™t need to explain everything. Just give simple, honest answers that match their age and understanding.
text:
Ni vizuri kuanza kuzungumzia kuhusu mabadiliko ya kimwili na mahusiano mapema-kwa kujibu kwa utulivu maswali ya kijana wako.

Hauhitaji kuelezea kila kitu. Mpe jibu rahisi, aminifu ambalo linaendana na umri wao na uelewa wao.

SourceText: Many parents also ask:
text: Wazazi wengi pia wanauliza:

SourceText:
How can I best keep my teen safe?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
text:
Ninawezaje kumweka kijana wangu salama vizuri zaidi?
Jaribu kuchagua kila chaguo kwa kupata vidokezo zaidi!

SourceText: I determine what my teen can and cannot do
text: Ninaamua kile ambacho kijana wangu anaweza na hawezi kufanya

SourceText: I keep information or bad influences away from them
text: Ninaweka taarifa au ushawishi mbaya mbali nao

SourceText: I build a healthy trusting relationship with my teen
text: Ninatengeneza uhusiano mzuri wa kuaminika na wenye afya pamoja na kijana wangu

SourceText: I discuss consequences and solutions with my teen
text: Ninajadili madhara na suluhisho pamoja na kijana wangu

SourceText: I emphasize that pressure is never okay
text: Nasisitiza kuwa shinikizo halikubaliki kamwe

SourceText:
This may not work.

When we try to control too much, teens may do the opposite of what we want.

But when we guide them and give them space to make choices, they often act more responsibly.
text:
Hii inaweza isifanye kazi.

Tunapojaribu kudhibiti sana, vijana wanaweza kufanya kinyume na tunachotaka.

Lakini tunapowaongoza na kuwapa nafasi ya kufanya maamuzi, mara nyingi hufanya mambo kwa uwajibikaji zaidi.

SourceText:
This may not work. 

Teens get pressure and information from many places we canâ€™t control.

As parents, we can guide and prepare them to know what is right or wrongâ€”and help them feel confident to make good decisions.
text:
Hii inaweza isifanye kazi.

Vijana hupata shinikizo na taarifa kutoka sehemu nyingi ambazo hatuwezi kuzidhibiti.

Kama wazazi, tunaweza kuwaongoza na kuwaandaa wajue kilicho sawa na kisicho sawaâ€”na kuwasaidia kujihisi kujiamini kufanya maamuzi bora.

SourceText:
Thatâ€™s right.

When your teen feels trusted, they are more likely to trust you and come to you for advice or help.

Praise and thank them when they share. Avoid judging, so they feel safe to talk to you again.
text:
Hiyo ni kweli.

Wakati kijana wako anahisi kuaminika, kuna uwezekano mkubwa kukuamini na kuja kwako kwa ushauri au msaada.

Mpongeze na mshukuru anapokushirkisha. Epuka kumhukumu, ili ahisi salama kuzungumza nawewe tena.

SourceText:
Thatâ€™s right.

Good decisions come from thinking through the consequences. Talk openly with your teen when thereâ€™s a problem. Listen to each other and find solutions together.

Each challenge is an opportunity to teach your teen that actions have consequencesâ€”and you can handle them as a team.

Remember to praise each other for working through tough situations together.
text:
Hiyo ni sawa.

Maamuzi mazuri hutokea kwa kufikiria matokeo. Zungumza kwa uwazi na kijana wako pale mnapokumbana na tatizo. Sikilizaneni ninyi kwa ninyi na tafuteni suluhisho pamoja.

Kila changamoto ni nafasi ya kumfundisha kijana wako kwamba matendo yana matokeoâ€”na kwamba mnaweza kuyakabili kwa pamoja kama timu.

Kumbuka kupongezana kwa kushirikiana kwa kupitia hali ngumu pamoja.

SourceText:
Thatâ€™s right.

To stay safe, your teen needs to know the difference between respectful behaviours and relationships, and unhealthy ones..

Respectful relationships feel caring, safe, and fair. Unhealthy ones involve pressure, discomfort, or feeling unsafe.

No one should be forced to do something theyâ€™re not okay with. You can learn more about this in the Staying Safe module.
text:
Hiyo ni sawa.

Kubaki salama, kijana wako anahitaji kuelewa tofauti kati ya tabia na mahusiano ya heshima, na yale yasiyo na afya.

Mahusiano ya heshima huhisi kuwa ya upendo, salama, na ya haki. Mahusiano yasiyo na afya hujumuisha shinikizo, hali ya kutokuwa na furaha, au kuhisi kutokuwa salama.

Hakuna mtu anayepaswa kulazimishwa kufanya jambo ambalo hakubaliani nalo. Unaweza kujifunza zaidi kuhusu hili katika mada ya Kubaki.

SourceText: Another common question among parents:
text: Swali lingine lililozoeleka miongoni mwa wazazi:

SourceText:
How can I help prevent my teen from having sex too young?
Try selecting each option for more tips!
text:
Ninawezaje kusaidia kumzuia kijana wangu kufanya ngono akiwa bado mdogo?
Jaribu kuchagua kila chaguo kupata vidokezo zaidi!

SourceText: Keep any information about sex away from them
text: Weka taaarifa za ngono mbali nao

SourceText: Forbid them to have a boyfriend or girlfriend
text: Kuwakataza kua na rafiki wa kike au kiume

SourceText: Have an open discussion on how and why they could wait to have sex
text: Fanya mazungumzo ya wazi kuhusu kivipi na kwa nini wanaweza kusubiri kabla ya kufanya ngono

SourceText:
Thatâ€™s not quite right.

Teens hear many things about sexâ€”from school, friends, or social media. Some of it is wrong.

Knowing about sex doesnâ€™t mean they are having sex. Good information helps them stay safe and understand why waiting to have sex can be a good choice.

Without this knowledge, they may face problems, like not knowing how pregnancy happens or the risks of sex.
text:
Hiyo sio sahihi kabisa.

Vijana husikia mambo mengi kuhusu ngonoâ€”kutoka shuleni, kwa marafiki, au kwenye mitandao ya kijamii. Baadhi ya taarifa hizo si sahihi.

Kujua kuhusu ngono haimaanishi kwamba wanafanya ngono. Taarifa sahihi huwasaidia kuwa salama na kuelewa kwa nini kusubiri kabla ya kufanya ngono kunaweza kuwa uamuzi mzuri.

bila maarifa, wanaweza kukumbana na matatizo, kama kutokujua kwa namna gani mimba inatokea au hatari vya ngono.

SourceText:
Thatâ€™s not quite right.

Your teen might have a boyfriend or girlfriend and not tell you.

If you make them hide it, they may not come to you with questions or problemsâ€”and this can lead to risky situations.
text:
Hiyo si sahihi kabisa.

Kijana wako anaweza kuwa na mpenzi na asiwe amekuambia.

Kama ukiwalazimisha kuficha uhusiano huo, wanaweza wasikushirikishe maswali au matatizo yaoâ€”na hili linaweza kuwapelekea kwenye hali za hatari.

SourceText:
Thatâ€™s right.

Teens are figuring out who they are. They look to friends and media for answers, and may feel pressure to do things theyâ€™re not ready for.

Talk calmly with your teen about waiting to have sex until they feel ready, are in a safe relationship, and understand the consequences. Focus on guiding them calmly to make healthy choices.
text:
Hiyo ni sawa.

Vijana wanajaribu kujitambua wao ni akina nani. Huwaangalia marafiki na vyombo vya habari kutafuta majibu, na wanaweza kuhisi shinikizo la kufanya mambo ambayo hawajawa tayari kuyafanya.

Zungumza kwa utulivu na kijana wako kuhusu kusubiri kufanya ngono hadi pale atakapojihisi yuko tayari, yuko kwenye uhusiano salama, na anaelewa matokeo ya maamuzi yake. Lenga kuwaongoza kwa utulivu ili wafanye maamuzi yenye afya.

SourceText:
Discussing body changes and intimate relationships can be uncomfortable, but it is so important in order to keep your teen happy, healthy and safe. 

Here are some skills to help you get started.
text:
Kujadili kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi kunaweza kuwa kwa hali ya kutokuwa na raha, lakini ni muhimu sana ili kuhakikisha kijana wako anakuwa mwenye furaha, afya njema, na salama.

Hapa kuna baadhi ya ujuzi wa kukusaidia kuanza mazungumzo hayo.

SourceText: BUILD
text: KUJENGA

SourceText:
Build a strong relationship with your teen by spending time with them and showing them you trust them. Create a safe, encouraging space, and avoid judging them.

That will make your teen share their questions and worries with you, when they need advice or are in a potentially dangerous situation.
text:
Jenga uhusiano mzuri na kijana wako kwa kutumia muda pamoja naye na kuwaonyesha kuwa unamwamini. Unda nafasi salama, ya kutia moyo, na uepuke kuwahukumu.

Hilo litamfanya kijana wako ashiriki maswali na mahangaiko yake nawe, anapohitaji ushauri au yuko katika hali inayoweza kuwa hatari.

SourceText: START
text: ANZA

SourceText:
Your teen may feel shy or scared, so parents need to start the talk about body changes and intimate relationships.

Begin early by answering questions simply and honestly. This builds confidence for you and your child.

Itâ€™s okay to feel uncomfortable. Be open, use the correct words, and get help if you donâ€™t know all the answers.
text:
Kijana wako anaweza kuhisi aibu au hofu, hivyo ni jukumu la mzazi kuanzisha mazungumzo kuhusu mabadiliko ya mwili na mahusiano ya kimapenzi.

Anza mapema kwa kujibu maswali kwa urahisi na kwa uaminifu. Hii hujenga kujiamini kwako na kwa mtoto wako.

Ni sawa kuhisi kutokuwa na raha. Kuwa wazi, tumia maneno sahihi, na tafuta msaada kama hujui majibu yote.

SourceText: GUIDE
text: MWONGOZO

SourceText:
Your teen will hear about sex from many places. If they feel safe with you, you can help them find good information and make smart choices.

Help them think about consequences without shame or blame. Make sure they know they should never feel pressure (or pressure others) into sex or a relationship.

You can also ask other adults or health workers for help and information.
text:
Kijana wako atasikia kuhusu ngono kutoka sehemu nyingi. Ikiwa wanajihisi salama na wewe, unaweza kuwasaidia kupata taarifa sahihi na kufanya maamuzi ya busara.

Wasaidie kufikiria kuhusu matokeo ya maamuzi yao bila aibu wala lawama. Hakikisha anajua kuwa hapaswi kulazimishwa (wala kumlazimisha mtu mwingine) kuingia kwenye ngono au uhusiano.

Unaweza pia kuomba msaada na taarifa kutoka kwa watu wazima wengine au wahudumu wa afya.

SourceText:

You can talk about what happened with @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name or @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name and their parents.

These stories can make it easier to talk about tricky topics and share ideas about healthy, respectful relationships.

Talking openly with your teen about body changes and relationships helps them feel safe, supported, and better able to make healthy choices. 

No matter your teenâ€™s age, now is the best time to build trust and guide them with care.

SourceText: @data.characters.media_daughter_8.name learned a lot from honest talks with her mother. Tap play to hear their story
text: @data.characters.media_daughter_8.name alijifunza mengi kutoka kwa mazungumzo ya uaminifu na mama yake. Bonyeza kucheza kusikiliza hadithi yao
note: The string @data.characters.media_daughter_8.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
As teens, we hear all these things about sex from others at school and on the internet. I thought all those things were true, and I was doing a lot of things secretly, because my friends were pushing me and I was afraid of what my mother would say.

When I did this app together with my mother, I realised that so many things I learnt were not true. I learnt I can get better information and I learnt others should never push me to do things I do not want to do. My mother and I can talk about these things now. I wish we could have done that when I was younger, because it would have helped me a lot, but I am still glad we can talk today. Whenever I have a question or problem now, I know I can ask my mother and she will help me think of answers and solutions together.
text:
Kama vijana, tunasikia mambo mengi kuhusu ngono kutoka kwa wengine shuleni na mtandaoni. Nilidhani yote hayo ni kweli, na nilikuwa nafanya mengi kwa usiri, kwa sababu marafiki zangu walikuwa wananishawishi na nilikuwa naogopa kwamba mama yangu atasema nini.

Nilipopitia programu hii pamoja na mama, niligundua kwamba mengi niliyojifunza yalikuwa sio kweli. Nilijifunza naweza kupata taarifa nzuri zaidi na nilijifunza wengine wasinisukume kufanya jambo ambalo nisilotaka kufanya. Mimi na mama yangu tunaweza kuongelea haya mambo kwa sasa. Nilitamani tungeweza fanya haya nilipokuwa mtoto, kwa sababu ingenisaidia sana, lakini bado ninafurahi tunaweza kuzungumza leo. Kila ninapokuwa na swali au tatizo sasa, ninajua naweza kumuuliza mama yangu na atanisaidia kufikiria majibu na suluhisho kwa pamoja.

SourceText:
Our topic today is staying safe.

To keep our teens safe, we need to understand their reality and the potential risky situations they can find themselves in.

We can help our teens know how to use their thoughts, voice, AND body in dangerous situations. It makes a big difference!

Huenda tukahitaji kuwa na majadiliano na watoto wetu kuhusu usalama wao na jinsi wanavyoweza kujiweka salama kila wakati!

SourceText: Why is discussing safety with your teen important? Tap play to find out

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Our topic is staying safe.

As parents it is important to ensure that our teens are safe at all times. Our safety and our childrenâ€™s safety is important. We may need to have discussions with our children about their safety, and how they can keep themselves safe always.

kama wazazi ni muhimu kuhakikisha vijana wetu wako salama muda wote. Usalama wetu na usalama wa watoto wetu ni muhimu. Tunaweza kuhitaji kuwa na mjadala na watoto wetu juu ya usalama wao, na ni kwa namna gani wanaweza kujiweka salama muda wote.

SourceText: Practising how to recognise warning signs and how to respond can help teens feel confident to protect themselves when it matters most.

SourceText: Hear how learning warning signs kept @data.characters.media_female_11.name's teen safe

SourceText:
Learning how to stay safe really helped us. The other day, my daughter got invited to a party by an older boy, and he said he would pay for her transport. Before, she would just go secretly, but now she came to me to talk about it.

We reminded each other that it is important to see the warning signs and stay safe, and she decided to say â€˜noâ€™. I am so proud of her. Even me, I now know that others should not pressure or convince me to do something. I can give the right example to my children.

Tulikumbushana kila mmoja wetu kwamba ni muhimu kuona ishara za onyo na kukaa salama, na aliamua kusema ' hapana ' ninajivunia sana yeye. Hata mimi, Sasa ninafahamu kwamba wengine hawawezi kunishinikiza au kunishawishi kufanya kitu chochote. Ninaweza kutoa mfano sahihi kwa watoto wangu.

SourceText:
People can make us feel safe and happyâ€”but sometimes they pressure us or make us uncomfortable. This can happen to both teens and adults.

Knowing the warning signs helps us stay safe.

Before, I would have been too scared, also what other people think, but now I feel confident.
text: Imenisaidia sana kwamba ninaweza kutumia sauti yangu na kuwa salama. Siku chache zilizopita, nilikuwa naelekea nyumbani peke yangu na mwanaume alianza kunifuata nami niliogopa. Baba yangu alinifundisha kwamba jambo muhimu sana ni kuwa salama, kwahiyo niligeuka na kuongea kwa sauti kubwa ' kwanini unanifuatilia, sitaki!' Ilimshangaza mwanaume huyo na hata watu wengine walitutazama, hivyo mwanaume yule aliondoka. Nilijisikia amani na hata kumwambia baba yangu. Alisema nilifanya vyema na nilijisikia vizuri. Hapo awali, nilikua niliogopa  sana, na pia vipi watu wengine wangefikiria, lakini sasa nahisi ujasiri.

SourceText:
Greetings everyone.

Today's topic is managing stress.

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too.

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.
text:
Salamu kila mtu.

Mada ya leo ni kudhibiti mafadhaiko.

Ni muhimu kujua jinsi ya kudhibiti mafadhaiko yetu. Wakati fulani watoto wetu wanaweza kuishi kwa njia zinazotufanya tuhisi mfadhaiko na sisi kama wazazi tunaweza kuwafanya watoto wetu wahisi mfadhaiko pia.

Kwa hivyo, ni muhimu kutambua tunapohisi mfadhaiko na kuchukua pumziko na kupumua. Hiyo itakusaidia kudhibiti mafadhaiko yako.

SourceText: Pause, take a breath. Now hear how taking a simple pause helped @data.characters.media_female_4.name and her teens
text: Chukua pumziko, pumua. vuta pumzi. Sasa sikia jinsi kuchukua pumziko rahisi kulivyosaidia @data.characters.media_female_4.name na vijana wake
note: The string @data.characters.media_female_4.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined @global.app_name, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home because they knew I would start yelling at them.

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first. But every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!
text:
Maisha ni magumu wakati mwingine. Kabla sijajiunga na @global.app_name, nilikuwa nikiudhika kila wakati. Ningetoa hasira zangu kwa kila mtu nyumbani, si tu vijana wangu bali hata mume wangu pia. Hukimbia niliporudi nyumbani kwa sababu walijua ningeanza kuwafokea.

Kujifunza kuchukua pumziko na kupumua ilikuwa ngumu mwanzoni. Lakini kila nilipojaribu, ilinisaidia kutulia. Sasa vijana wangu hawatoroki tena ninaporudi nyumbani na wanasikiliza vizuri zaidi kuliko nilipokuwa nikiwapigia kelele!

SourceText: Yes, when we recognise we feel stressed, we can take a deep breath and respond with calm and understanding. That way we can find solutions together that make everyone feel better.
text: Ndiyo, tunapotambua kwamba tunafadhaika, tunaweza kuvuta pumzi na kujibu kwa utulivu na kuelewa. Kwa njia hiyo tunaweza kupata suluhu pamoja ambazo zinafanya kila mtu ajisikie vizuri.

SourceText: Here are a few skills to help you manage stress that you can use with your teens!
text: Hapa kuna ujuzi mdogo wa kukusaidia kudhibiti mfadhaiko ambayo unaweza kutumia na vijana wako!

SourceText: BREATHE
text: VUTA PUMZI

SourceText:
Breathe slowly. Pause.

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.
text:
Pumua polepole. Sitisha.

Kabla ya kusema chochote, pumua polepole ndani na nje mara tano. Itakutuliza, na kukupa nafasi ya kufikiria.

SourceText: SHARE
text: KUSHIRIKISHANA

SourceText:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.
text:
Shirikisha namna unahisi.

Hili ni jambo gumu. Wengi wetu tuliambiwa tusilie, au kuonesha hisia zetu kwa watoto wetu. Lakini vuta pumzi ndefu na uwaambie kwa utulivu jinsi unavyohisi. Wataelewa vizuri, na pia watajifunza kutoka kwako jinsi ya kukabiliana na msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText: SHOW
text: ONESHA

SourceText:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.
text:
Waonyeshe unajali.

Hili pia ni jambo gumu! Msongo wa mawazo hutufanya tujiangalie sisi wenyewe. Lakini vijana wetu wanahitaji msaada wetu. Waulize wanajisikiaje. Wasikilize na uwafariji. Jaribu kuwakumbatia au sema "Ninaelewa". Kufanya hivyo kunaweza kubadilisha kila kitu.

SourceText: SEEK
text: TAFUTA

SourceText:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?
text:
Tafuta kitu chanya.

Je, wewe na kijana wako mnaweza kufikiria mawazo yanayoweza kusaidia? Je, mnaweza kufanya pamoja kitu chanya ili kuhamisha mawazo yako kutoka kwenye msongo wa mawazo?

SourceText: Hear how @data.characters.media_son_1.name learned to stay calm from his father
text: Sikia jinsi @data.characters.media_son_1.name alivyojifunza kuwa mtulivu kutoka kwa baba yake
note: The string @data.characters.media_son_1.name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else.

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.
text:
Pindi nilipofanya kitu kibaya, Baba yangu alinikasirikia sana na kunipiga. Alikuwa hanisikilizi na hii ilinifanya kumkasirikia yeye pamoja na watu wengine.

Sasa, pindi anapokuwa na hasira, anachukua dakika chache kuvuta pumzi ndefu kabla hajajibu chochote. Inafanya kila mtu kutulia badala ya kusababisha ugomvi mkubwa.

Hii inanisaidia sana nyumbani na hata shuleni, hata Mimi sasa siwakasirikii wengine na si mtu wa hisia kali. Pindi ninapojihisi hasira au mwenye msongo wa mawazo, Navuta pumzi ndefu kama Baba yangu anavyofanya. Nimekuwa mtu tofauti.

SourceText:
Sit down, close your eyes, and listen to your breath as it goes in and out.

SourceText: Power of three
text: Nguvu ya tatu

SourceText:
Close your eyes.
Let's use the magic power of 3 to stay present and relax. 

Name 3 sounds you can hear right now.
Name 3 smells you can smell right now.
Name your 3 favourite foods.
What are 3 things you can be grateful for right now.

At the end of a touch day, thinking of 3 things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.
text:

Hebu tutumie maajabu ya namba 3 ili tuendelee kuwepo na kupumzika.

Taja vyakula 3 unavyovipenda.

Si lazima yawe makubwa, siku ngumu inapokaribia kuisha, kufikiria mambo 3 ya kushukuru yanaweza kutusaidia kupata ujasiri wa kuharibu tena kesho.

SourceText: Body scan
text: Uchunguzi wa mwili

SourceText:
Here is an activity to relax your body:â€¯

Sit comfortably and close your eyes if you can.â€¯
Imagine a golden ring scanning your body from your feet to your head.â€¯â€¯
Pay attention as it moves up and down your body. Are there any areas that feel tense? Numb? Painful?â€¯â€¯
Focus on those areas for a moment. Breathe into the area and, when you breathe out, try to let go of any tension or pain.â€¯â€¯
Do this for a few breaths.â€¯â€¯

Open your eyes. How does your body feel now?

You can also try this next time you find yourself lying in bed unable to sleep!
text:
Hapa kuna shughuli ya kupumzisha mwili wako:

Keti kwa raha mstarehe halafu ufumbe macho yako ukiweza.
Fikiria kama kuna pete ya dhahabu inauchunguza mwili wako kuanzia unyayoni hadi utosini.
Sikiliza kwa makini pindi inapojongea kwenda juu na chini ya mwili wako. Je, kuna maeneo yoyote yaliyokakamaa? Yaliyo na ganzi? Yaliyo na maumivu?
Tulia kwa muda kwenye maeneo hayo kwa muda. Vutia pumzi kwenye eneo hilo na, unaposhusha pumzi, jaribu kuachilia hali yoyote ya kukakamaa au ya maumivu.
Fanya hivi kwa kuvuta pumzi kadhaa.

Fumbua macho yako. Je, mwili wako unahisije sasa?

Unaweza pia kujaribu kufanya hivyo mara ijayo utakapojikuta umelala kitandani usingizi lakini usingizi umekupaa!

SourceText: Feel the ground
text: Kuhisi ardhi

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Notice your connection with the ground beneath you.â€¯
What parts of your body touch the ground? What parts of your body do not?â€¯â€¯
Notice where it feels warm and where it feels cool.â€¯
Feel the ground underneath you supporting you. Let your body sink into the support of the ground.

Try this next time you feel alone or are doing a mundane activity like washing up. It can really help!
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Chunguza uhusiano wako na ardhi iliyo chini yako.
Je, ni sehemu gani za mwili wako zinagusa ardhi? Je, ni sehemu gani za mwili wako hazigusi ardhi?
Chunguza mahali palipo na joto na mahali palipo na baridi.
Gusa ardhi iliyo chini yako inayokubeba. Acha mwili wako uzame na kubebwa na ardhi.

Jaribu hivi wakati mwingine unapojisikia mpweke au unafanya shughuli ya kawaida kama kunawa. Inaweza kusaidia kweli!

SourceText: Counting sounds
text: Sauti za kuhesabu

SourceText:
Sit down and close your eyes.
How many sounds can you hear?  
Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers. 
After ten seconds, how many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear? 

Try again for another ten seconds.  
Did you hear any new sounds? Did you hear any sounds inside your own body? 
Notice how you feel now.
text:
Kaa chini na ufumbe macho yako.
Je, unaweza kusikia sauti ngapi?
Sikiliza sauti za ndani na nje ya chumba. Zihesabu kwa vidole vyako.
Baada ya sekunde kumi, umefikisha vidole vingapi? Ulisikia sauti zipi?

Jaribu tena kwa sekunde kumi.
Je, umesikia sauti zozote mpya? Je, umesikia sauti zozote ndani ya mwili wako mwenyewe?
Chunguza jinsi unavyohisi sasa.

SourceText: Feel your feelings
text: Hisi hisia zako

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Do you ever feel something so strongly that you want to run away from it?

Instead of moving away from the feeling, letâ€™s move towards it for a moment.
It is ok. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath.

Become curious. Where are you feeling it in your body? Is it hot or cold? Hard or soft? Tight or loose?
Ask yourself some questions. What is it telling me? What does it need? How can I be kind to myself right now?
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Je, huwa unahisi kitu kwa nguvu sana kiasi kwamba huwa unataka kukikimbia?

Badala ya kuikimbia hisia hiyo, hebu tuikimbilie kwa muda.
Si vibaya. Fumba macho yako kama unajisikia vizuri. Vuta pumzi ndefu.

Kuwa mdadisi. Je, unaisikia wapi kwenye mwili wako? Je, ni ya moto au baridi? Je, ni ngumu au laini? Je, imekakamaa au imelegea?
Jiulize maswali kadhaa. Je, inaniambia nini? Je, inahitaji nini? Je, ninawezaje kujitendea wema sasa hivi?

SourceText: Your song
text: Wimbo wako

SourceText:
Here is something fun to help you let go of stress:â€¯  

Choose a song that reflects what you need in this moment. Do you need a gentle song to soothe your tired soul or an upbeat song to help you shake some stress out?â€¯  

Make a space and move your body to the music. Remember to breathe while you move. Let your breath and the movement go together.â€¯

Even a few minutes of movement can be enough to release stress and lift your mood!
text:
Hapa kuna kitu cha kufurahisha cha kukusaidia kuondokana na msongo wa mawazo:

Chagua wimbo unaoendana na kile unachohitaji kwa sasa. Je, unahitaji wimbo wa taratibu ili kuibembeleza nafsi yako iliyochoka au unahitaji wimbo wa kuchangamsha ili kukusaidia kuondoa msongo wa mawazo kwa kiasi fulani?

Tengeneza nafasi na uchezeshe mwili wako kulingana na muziki. Kumbuka kuvuta pumzi unapocheza. Fanya pumzi yako iendane na miondoko yako.

Hata dakika chache za kucheza  zinaweza kutosha kuondoa msongo wa mawazo na kuinua hali yako!

SourceText: Ground & gratitude
text: Ardhi & shukrani

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Take a moment to feel the ground under your feet.
Think of something you feel grateful for.
Focus on your breath.
Breathe in and out.

In and out.
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Tumia muda kuhisi ardhi iliyopo chini ya miguu yako.
Fikiria kuhusu jambo unalolishukuru.
Makinikia upumuaji wako.
Vuta pumzi na kuzishusha.

Kuvuta na kushusha.

SourceText: Notice how you feel
text: Chunguza unavyohisi

SourceText:
Hello! How are you feeling right now? Happy, sad, angry, excited, worried?

Notice where you feel it in your body. Notice what thoughts are connected to that feeling. Take a deep breath.

Thank yourself for taking the time to check in with your feelings and thoughts!
text:
Hello! Unajisikiaje sasa hivi? Furaha, huzuni, hasira, taharuki, wasiwasi?

Chunguza mahali unapohisi hali hiyo kwenye mwili wako. Chunguza ni mawazo yapi yanayohusiana na hisia hiyo. Vuta pumzi ndefu.

Hongera kwa kutumia muda ili kuangalia hisia na mawazo yako!

SourceText: Pause power
text: Nguvu ya kutulia

SourceText:
Letâ€™s practice a calming trick that we call â€˜Pause Powerâ€™.

Plant your feet on the ground and breathe in and out three times as slowly as you can. Imagine you are smelling a flower or blowing out a candle.

Ta-da! Pause Power!

This is a great trick to use when you are feeling frustrated because it will help to calm you down.
text:
Hebu tufanye mazoezi ya mbinu ya kutulia tunayoiita â€˜Kata Umemeâ€™.

Weka miguu yako kwenye ardhi halafu vuta pumzi nje na ndani mara tatu polepole kadri uwezavyo. Fikiria kama unanusa maua au unazima mshumaa.

Ta da! Kata Umeme!

Hii ni mbinu nzuri ya kutumia unapohisi kuchanganyikiwa kwa sababu itasaidia kukutuliza.

SourceText: Praise yourself
text: Jisifie

SourceText:
Self-praise can be really helpful, especially when we have difficult days. 

Think of your week and finish the following phrase: â€œThis week, I am proud of myself for â€¦â€ It can be anything, not just things about being a parent!

Think of one thing you did well today. Now wrap your arms around yourself and give yourself a big HUG!
text:
Kujisifia kunaweza kusaidia sana, hasa kwenye siku zinazotuendea vibaya.

Fikiria jinsi wiki ilivyokuendea halafu umalizie tungo ifuatayo: "Wiki hii, ninajionea fahari kwaâ€¦" Kinaweza kuwa kitu chochote, siyo mambo ya malezi tu!

Fikiria jambo moja ulilofanya vizuri leo. Sasa jifumbate kwa mikono yako mwenyewe halafu UJIKUMBATIE kwa nguvu!

SourceText: Taking care of yourself
text: Kujithamini mwenyewe

SourceText:
Sit comfortably and close your eyes. 

Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?

Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. Say the following words silently to yourself:

May I be peaceful.
May I be safe.
May I be healthy.
May I be happy.
May there be love in my family.
May I feel loved.

Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Notice if you feel any different.
text:
Kaa vizuri halafu ufumbe macho yako.

Tambua kinachokutokea muda huu. Unafikiria nini? Je, mawazo yako ni chanya au hasi? Je, unahisije? Je, unahisi kufurahi au kutofurahi? Je, mwili wako unahisije? Je, unahisi wasiwasi au umetulia?

Husiana na moyo wako kwa wema na upole. Unaweza kuhitaji kuweka mkono mmoja kwenye moyo wako au kifuani. Sema kimoyomoyo maneno yafuatayo:

Ninaomba niwe na amani.
Ninaomba niwe salama.
Ninaomba niwe na afya.
Ninaomba niwe na furaha.
Na upendo uwe kwenye familia yangu.
Ninaomba nihisi kupendwa.

Chukua muda kutafakari uzoefu wako. Angalia ikiwa unahisi tofauti yoyote.

SourceText: Take a pause
text: Tulia

SourceText:
Step 1. Close your eyes and take a deep breath. 

Step 2. Ask yourself, "What am I thinking?" Notice if your thoughts are positive or negative.
Notice how you are feeling emotionally. Notice if your emotions are pleasant or unpleasant. Remind yourself that whatever you feel, it is okay.
Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.

Step 3. Focus on your breath. Feel your breath as it goes in and out. You can put a hand on your stomach and feel it rise and fall with each breath. Do this for about 10 breaths.

Step 4. Expand your awareness to your whole body. Listen to the sounds in the room. 

Step 5. Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different. When you are ready, open your eyes.

Well done for taking a pause. You can do this anytime you are feeling stressed. It gives you a chance to be calmer. Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also take a pause with your children!
text:
Hatua ya Kwanza. Fumba macho yako halafu uvute pumzi ndefu.

Hatua ya Pili. Jiulize, "Je, ninafikiria nini?" Chunguza kama mawazo yako ni chanya au hasi.
Angalia jinsi unavyojihisi. Chunguza kama mihemuko yako ni ya kufurahisha au kutofurahisha. Jikumbushe kwamba chochote unachohisi, si kibaya.
Chunguza jinsi mwili wako unavyohisi. Chunguza kitu chochote kinachoumiza au kinacholeta wasiwasi.

Hatua ya Tatu. Makinikia upumuaji wako. Hisi pumzi yako inapoingia na kutoka. Unaweza kuweka mkono kwenye tumbo lako na kuhisi linavyopanda na kushuka kwa kila pumzi. Fanya hivyo kwa mipumuo kama 10.

Hatua ya Nne. Panua ufahamu wako kuhusu mwili wako wote. Sikiliza sauti zilizomo chumbani.

Hatua ya Tano. Tumia muda kutafakari iwapo unahisi mabadiliko au la. Ukimaliza, fumbua macho yako.

Umefanya vizuri kwa kupumzika. Unaweza kufanya hivyo wakati wowote unapohisi msongo wa mawazo. Inakupa nafasi ya kuwa mtulivu. Hata pumzi chache za kina au kuunganishwa na ardhi chini yako kunaweza kuleta mabadiliko. Unaweza pia kuchukua pumziko na watoto wako!

SourceText: Physical activity
text: Shughuli ya kutumia nguvu

SourceText:
Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.

Let your hands hang by your side. Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you relax your body.

Relax your arms and let them swing sideways while you turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.

Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from your ankles â€“ remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.

Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!

Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.

Take a moment to reflect on your experience.

Well done! You can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text:
Simama na unyooshe mikono yako juu angani. Sukuma mawingu yote na uache jua likuangazie. Jinyooshe kwenda kulia na kushoto. Jinyooshe kwenda mbele na nyuma.

Acha mkono yako ining'inie ubavuni mwako. Kaza mabega yako na kuyapandisha hadi kwenye masikio yako huku ukipumua, bana macho yako, na ushikilie pumzi yako. Legeza mabega yako wakati unapolegeza mwili wako.

Legeza mikono yako na uibembeze ubavuni, halafu binua upande wa juu wa kiwiliwili chako. Mikono yako inapaswa kupiga polepole mgongo wako unapojigeuza kutoka upande mmoja hadi mwingine.

Weka mguu mmoja mbele ya mwingine na fanya miduara midogo kwa kutumia vifundo vya miguu - kumbuka kugeukia pande zote mbili. Kila mguu ufanye miduara minne kwa kila upande.

Sasa tikisa mwili wako wote haraka kadri unavyoweza. Tikisa upande wa juu kabisa! Tikisa upande wa chini kabisa! Tikisa mwili wote!

Fumba macho yako na uinue mikono yako polepole kuzidi kichwa chako huku ukivuta pumzi. Teremsha mikono yako polepole kuelekea ubavuni mwako huku ukishusha pumzi.

Tumia muda kutafakari hali uliyoipitia.

Hongera! Unaweza kufanya shughuli hii wakati wowote unapohisi kama unahitaji kutoa msongo wa mawazo na kutia nguvu akili na mwili wako.

SourceText: List of things
text: Orodha ya vitu

SourceText:
Make a list of healthy activities that you like to do. Here are some suggestions:
* Listening to your favourite music
* Going for a walk (if possible)
* Doing some exercise
* Drinking a cup of tea by yourself
* Calling up a friend
* Singing, dancing, praying, or reading
* Sitting in the sun with your eyes closed
* Watching your favourite TV show

Pick one and do it today!
text:
Tengeneza orodha ya shughuli zinazoleta afya unazopenda kufanya. Haya ni baadhi ya mapendekezo:
* Kusikiliza muziki unaoupenda
* Kwenda matembezini (kama inawezekana)
* Kufanya mazoezi
* Kunywa kikombe cha chai peke yako
* Kumpigia rafiki simu
* Kuimba, kucheza, kusali, au kusoma
* Kuketi juani huku umefumba macho
* Kutazama kipindi cha runinga unachokipenda

Chagua shughuli moja na uifanye leo!

SourceText: Connect
text: Unganisha

SourceText: When you take care of yourself, you take care of your children. We all need to connect. Try to talk to friends, family, and other support networks every day. If it has been a while since you reached out to someone, do it now!
text: Unapojitunza wewe mwenyewe, unawatunza watoto wako. Sisi sote tunahitaji kuhusiana. Kila siku, jaribu kuzungumza na marafiki, familia, na mitandao mingine inayosaidia. Kama umepita muda tangu ulipowasiliana na mtu fulani, fanya hivyo sasa!

SourceText: Prevent anger
text: Zuia hasira

SourceText:
Think about what makes you angry. When does it happen? How do you normally react?

Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
text:
Jambo linalokukasirisha. Je, linatokea wakati gani? Je, kwa kawaida, mwitikio wako huwa ni upi?

Zuia hasira kabla hata haijapanda. Unapokuwa umechoka, lala usingizi au pumzika. Unapokuwa na njaa, jaribu kula kitu. Unapokuwa mpweke, omba msaada kwa mtu.

SourceText: Angry? Take a break
text: Je, umekasirika? Pumzika

SourceText:
Managing anger can be really difficult. Take a break when you feel you are getting angry at your children or someone else.

Go somewhere else for 5 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have a safe outdoor space, go outside. You can get through this!
text:
Kudhibiti hasira kunaweza kuwa kugumu. Pumzika unapohisi unawakasirikia watoto wako au mtu mwingine.

Nenda mahali pengine kwa dakika 5 ili uweze kudhibiti tena hisia zako. Kama una mahali salama nje, nenda nje. Una uwezo wa kulimaliza jambo hili!
